loans.name: Altos Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité forman el grupo llamado Altos, donde todas y cada una de ellas son mujeres muy emprendedoras y luchan por poder salir adelante y crecer en sus emprendimientos.
La señora Liz es la presidenta del comité, es casada y vive con su familia en la ciudad de Caacupé. La Señora Liz vende verduras, carne, ropa y todo tipo de productos, donde ella sale a la venta casa por casa y el préstamo lo solicita para poder comprar verduras, carne, ropa y demás, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
Ella está muy agradecida por la oportunidad de crecimiento que tiene, y que le permite seguir creciendo y luchando.
texts.en:
The 17 members of this committee make up the "Altos" group, where all the women are very enterprising and are fighting to get ahead and to grow with their businesses.

Liz is the group's president: she is married and lives with her family in the city of Caacupé. Liz sells vegetables, meat, clothes and all sort of products. She sells door-to-door and is applying for a loan in order to be able to buy vegetables, meat, clothes and more and to continue with her sales.

Liz is very grateful for this opportunity to grow and that will allow her to keep on fighting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, clothes and more.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.en:
Gulchehra is 39 years old. She is married and has three children. Two of them are adults and one of them is not yet an adult. Gulchehra lives with her family in a rural area. Her house is located near mountains. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 21 years. She buys cows, feeds them for some months, and sells them in a local market. 

Gulchehra now has seven cows. She has a big cowshed in her house. She is aiming to improve their living conditions so Gulchehra wants to repair her house. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 USD to buy building materials as cement, wood, paint, etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, paint, etc. for repairing her house

loans.name: Karen

texts.es: La señora Karen de 32 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene personas que dependen de sus ingresos, cuida mucho de sus padres y tiene la buena intención de mejorar la situación en la que se encuentran, por ello les ayuda económicamente. Se dedica a la elaboración y venta de masitas (rollos, empanadas, brazo gitano, alfajores) desde hace 6 años, sus productos son vendidos generalmente en las entidades financieras que están ubicadas por la zona sud de la ciudad de Cochabamba, el motivo del presente crédito es para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de masitas, porque tiene clientes que hacen pedidos de grandes cantidades de sus productos ya que los mismos son elaborados con mucha dedicacion y resultan del gusto de muchas personas, para satisfacer la demanda necesita incrementar su producción, de esta forma lograra mejorar sus ingresos y crecer en la actividad que desempeña, siempre velando por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Karen, 32, is single and has no dependents.  She takes care of her parents a lot and intends to improve their current situation, so she helps them financially.

Karen has earned a living for six years making pastry (rolls, empanadas, "brazo gitano" [jelly roll], "alfajor" cookies).  She generally sells her pastry to the financial businesses located in the southern part of the city of Cochabamba.

Her goal for this loan is to buy the ingredients she needs to make pastry.  She has customers who order large quantities of her products because they're so well made and tasty to a lot of people.  To satisfy this demand she needs to increase production.

This way Karen will manage to improve her income and grow in her business, all the while looking after her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make pastries

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de Fatima  está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde tres integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que debe seguir luchando por crecer. Entre el trabajo que ella hace, se dedica a la Costura, y por medio de esto está ganándose el sustento de su familia.
La Sra. Maria pide este préstamo para la comprar telas, agujas, una máquina para poder concretar los pedidos de sus clientes, y de esa forma poder seguir luchando y creciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas están recibiendo de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The "Virgen de Fatima" group is on its first loan cycle at the women's committee programme where everybody is working and helping each other to get ahead. The members have undergone the poverty elimination survey and three members have been found to be living under the poverty line.

One member of the group is María who, at the last survey, was found to be living in "level one" poverty - this means that she must continue to fight in order to improve her situation. One job that she has is in dress-making, and it is through this work that she is earning a living for her family.

María is applying for this for loan in order to buy material, needles and a sewing machine to carry out her customers' orders. This way she can continue to fight and grow. María is grateful for the opportunity that all the group's members are receiving in order for them to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy material, needles and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Pyahu está en su ciclo número 5to. Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde ellas a parte de su trabajo también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elida quien está luchando por mejorar su vida y la de su familia.
Ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas para la venta, y que por medio de su trabajo tiene los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Elida es una mujer muy luchadora que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante, trabajando de una manera honesta.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones y demás ropas que podrá vender y de esa forma seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Pyahu Group is in its fifth loan cycle in the women's communal bank program.  They're also completing the poverty-elimination survey as part of their work with the bank.

One of the members, Elida, is striving to improve her life and her family's.  She said she works selling a variety of clothes and that her job provides the income to be able to help her family.  She's a very determined woman who's getting ahead with a lot of sacrifice and earning an honest living.  

Elida's requesting this loan to be able to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and other clothing to sell.  This way she'll continue improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts, pants, and other clothes

loans.name: Oriental Group

texts.es:
El llamado Oriental se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes del comité son de una zona eminentemente rural, donde todas están luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y ayudar también a su comunidad. 
En su mayoría todas trabajan en actividades rurales, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Una de ellas es la Sra. Blanca, quien se dedica a la cría, venta o faena de animales de corral, donde comenta que por medio de esto ayuda a su familia, dándoles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
Blanca pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar balanceados para sus animales, con lo que podrá continuar en la cría de sus animales.
texts.en:
The group Oriental was formed by various neighbors in Santaní city. All the members of the committee are from a rural area, where everyone is fighting to improve their living conditions while also helping their community.

The majority of members work in rural jobs, fighting to improve their living conditions. One of them is Bianca. She raises and sells livestock, and in this way helps her family, giving them everything she wasn't able to have.

Bianca seeks this loan to be able to invest in buying feed for her animals, with which she will be able to continue raising her animals.

loans.use: to buy feed for animals.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small house. One year ago, Mohammad opened a small grocery store where he sells regular grocery products that customers often request. Mohammad would like to improve his store and expand it.
 
Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his grocery store to resell. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to improve his store and increase the sales.
 
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products for his grocery store .

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Dinh is 41 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Dinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dinh has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a clean water system and a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement and sand to build a toilet.

In the future, Dinh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to build a toilet.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 43-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Emma has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mamura

texts.en:
Mamura was born in 1986. She is married and has two little children. Mamura’s husband is a builder. 

Mamura began her own business in animal husbandry five years ago because she needed to make money. She has additional income from growing agricultural products. 

Mamura lives poorly because she has a small income. Her house is in bad condition, and she must to repair her house. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, etc., for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as cement, wood, etc., for repairing her house.

loans.name: Umida

texts.en: A kind woman by the name of Umida lives in a house that is in bad condition. Her husband is a migrant in Russia and has a very small salary. They have five clever children. Her children want to live in a house that is in good condition but her income from growing agricultural products is not enough to repair it. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing her house. In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood, and paints for repairing her house

loans.name: Abdel Raheem

texts.en:
Abdel Raheem is a 23-year-old single man from Bedia, a small village near Nablus city. He lives with his family in a small house. Three years ago, Abdel opened a small store to sell cosmetics and perfumes.  It is a very good business and the demand is high. Abdel would like to improve his store and expand it.
 
Abdel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products for his gift store. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to improve his store and increase the sales. 

Abdel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy more products for his cosmetics and perfume store

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is a successful young business lady. She is 20 years old. Two years ago, she began her own business in animal husbandry. She took part in the course ‘To Get Ahead’ from a women's organization and organized her business. Now, she is going to increase her working capital and in this way, develop her business. Nasiba is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy cattle to increase her working capital. With the profit, she is going to improve her living conditions. Her parents are proud of her. Nasiba awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Orosta

texts.en: Orosta is 34 years old. She is married and has three children. Orosta lives with her family in a rural area. She is the main income provider for her family. Her husband is a migrant in Russia and doesn’t send her money regularly. Orosta grows potatoes. She has been busy with this business for more than 14 years. Orosta grows potatoes on her own land and sells the harvest in a local market. She manages the business alone. She must make a circumcision ceremony for her son but she has no money. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to make a circumcision ceremony for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To make a circumcision ceremony for her son

loans.name: Timina

texts.en:
Timina is a single woman with one child who goes to school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 10 years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase tomatoes, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, vegetables, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, vegetables, rice, beans, and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
Jose Armando, es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es José Armando, tengo 18 años de edad, vivo en La Vega, nací en dicha ciudad y a causa de dificultades económicas he vivido en diferentes lugares de esta ciudad. Tengo dos hermanas.
Por otro lado, estoy ingresando a la Universidad Católica tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI) a la facultad de medicina debido a razones humanitarias y a la vez me gusta bastante, pero sobre todo me siento capaz y convencido de poder ejercerla.
No obstante, para eso necesito del préstamo, y ser uno de los  beneficiados, el préstamo es de vital importancia para mí ya con este tendría la oportunidad y la facilidad de ejercer mi carrera, y poder  desarrollarme académicamente. Mi madre no trabaja y mi padre es moto-concho(taxi de motor)  y no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para mi carrera. Este préstamo cambiaría positivamente el curso de mi vida puesto que le ofrecería la luz necesaria para emprender el viaje a tan demandante camino. 
Entre mis metas a cumplir puedo citar algunas, entre ellas: esforzarme al máximo para adquirir los conocimientos necesarios de mi carrera y humildemente conseguir excelente índices para así graduarme con altos honores. Por otro lado, tengo la responsabilidad de suplir a mi familia de recursos, que tanto lo necesitan.
texts.en:
This is his story: My name is Jose Armando.  I’m 18 years old.  I live in La Vega.  I was born there and due to financial difficulties I have lived in different places in this city.  I have two sisters.

On another note, I am enrolling in the Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI) in their college of medicine, for both humanitarian reasons and also because I like it pretty well.  Above all, I feel capable and convinced that I can do it.

Nevertheless, to do that I need to be one of the beneficiaries of a loan.  The loan is of vital importance for me because with it I would have the chance to study for my degree and could develop myself academically.  My mother doesn’t work; my father drives a mototaxi and doesn’t have sufficient financial resources for my degree.  This loan would change the course of my life for the better since it would shed the light needed to undertake a trip down such a demanding path.

There are many goals I could tell about, among them: to put forth my best effort to get the necessary knowledge for my degree and humbly get excellent grades so that I can graduate with high honors.  At the same time, I have a responsibility to provide resources to my family, which they need so much.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses

loans.name: Johana

texts.en:
Johana is a 37-year-old single businesswoman. She settled to earn her living in Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines together with her family. 

Over the past five years, Johana was able to put up a fishing business that absolutely met their needs. Until now, the business was still doing well and giving enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. Every end of the month, Johana receives approximately an adequate amount from her fishing business operations.

Johana joined GDMPC last year to have an easy access to financial services. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC in addition to her capital. The money taken is intended to buy additional fishing materials like fishnets. 

With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Johana expects an increase in sales so as to expand her business and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing materials like fishnets.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a married woman with six school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking  oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans and cooking oil

loans.name: Souheila

texts.en:
Souheila is a 51-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working at preparing and selling her special handmade accessories for four years. In 2010, she started working on her own, and in May 2013 she opened her own shop to increase her income and expand her sales. She has a special talent in her domain, and is well known in her region with her special creations and prices.

Today, Souheila is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua for the second time, in order to buy electrical appliances necessary for her business development and to cover some of her home needs.

Her previous loan reflected positively on her business development, and she is working hard to make sure that she can also keep on developing her family's socioeconomic situation.

Souheila is working hard to start her own dream business, which has to do with establishing a vocational training center for handmade accessories, in addition to starting a waste recycling business to keep on developing her working sectors.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances necessary for her business development and to cover some of her home needs.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
This is Salama. Her previous loan was a big help in her business, allowing her to buy more shop items.  She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.
 
She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.  Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household consumables, wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar.

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa is a 33-year-old single lady who's the sole breadwinner for two members of her family. She has been employed in a factory that has to do with lightening needs for 12 years, and it is her only source of living.

Sanaa is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary furniture for her parents' house to keep it a healthy living place. She hopes that one day she will be financially capable of starting her own business. She has been dreaming for a long time of opening a shop of her own to sell shoes.

loans.use: To buy necessary furniture for her parents' house to keep it a healthy living place

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Nehmat

texts.en:
Nehmat is a 37-year-old married mother of three children. She had been running her convenience store for 14 years ago to help her beloved husband to cover their increasing family needs. Nehmat is a hard worker with a very good reputation in her region for the special talents and services she provides.

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages that will attract her customers' attention and increase her income. Nehmat is very anxious about this loan, since it is her first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that through her the loan she applied for, she will be able to develop her business in a well managed way through diversifying her merchandise to cover her customers' needs.

loans.use: To increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casado y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian y tres personas dependen de él. 
José es motorista, ya cuenta con 15 años de realizar este trabajo el cual aprendió de un amigo, además de realizar esa actividad, José tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa, y sale a las 5 de la mañana para realizar su trabajo de motorista. 
Él necesita este crédito, para invertirlo en la tienda ya que quiere hacerla más grande y comprar productos para tener mayor variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Sus planes a futuro son seguir ampliando su tienda y que no falten los ingresos a su familia.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old, he studied until the fourth grade and he has three dependents. He is married and has three children, two of whom study. José is a driver and for 15 years he has been doing this job, which he learned from a friend. On top of this activity, José has a small shop in his house and he goes out at 5:00 in the morning to work his job as a driver. 

He needs this loan to invest in the shop since he wants to expand it and buy products in order to offer his clients more variety. His future plans are to continue expanding his shop and for his income to be enough for his family.

loans.use: to buy more products for his shop.

loans.name: Dania

texts.es:
Dania es una joven estudiante de Contabilidad, ella solicita un préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Dania, tengo 21 años de edad soy de Dominicana, soltera, nací y crecí santo Domingo Distrito Nacional junto a mi Madre que es Ama de casa y mis  tres hermanos.

Deseo seguir estudiando en la Universidad del Caribe, donde mis estudios de Lic. En Contabilidad, la cual me permite trabajar sin tener que dejar mis estudios.

Mi necesidad acerca de este préstamo es que soy una persona de bajos recursos, trabajo y el dinero que gano no  alcanza para cubrir mis estudios. Este préstamo es sumamente necesario para mí ya que sin  el apoyo de KIVA-FUNDAPEC no podré seguir estudiando.

Mis metas académicas son tener siempre calificación excelente, que mi familia se sienta orgullosa de mí ya que soy la única que está estudiando, lograr tener una carrera universitaria. Uno de mis sueños es poder ayudar a mi familia económicamente y tener una familia la cual este llena de amor y enseñarles a mis hijos el valor que tiene la vida que hay que luchar para poder llegar y que por más que uno de caiga hay que levantarse siempre poniendo a Dios por delante de todas las cosas.
texts.en:
Dania is a young Accounting student.  She is asking for a loan to be able to pay her educational expenses. 

This is her story:  My name is Dania.  I am 21 years old.  I am Dominicana and am single.  I was born and grew up in Santo Domingo, National District, alongside my mother (who is a homemaker) and my three siblings.

I want to keep studying in the Universidad del Caribe, where my studies towards a degree in Accounting allow me to work without having to leave my studies.

My needs related to this loan are that I am a person of few resources.  I work, and the money I earn doesn’t cover my studies.  This loan is ultimately necessary for me because without the support of Kiva and Fundapec I will not be able to keep studying.

My academic goals are to always have excellent grades, that my family would always be proud of me because I am the only one who is studying, and that I would manage to have a university degree.  One of my dreams is to be able to help my family financially and have a family which is full of love.  I want to teach my children the value of life, and that it is necessary to fight to be able to arrive, and that each time you fall, it is necessary to get yourself back up, always putting God ahead of everything.

loans.use: to pay for higher education expenses

loans.name: Mere

texts.en:
Mere is a 61-year-old married mother of three children who has been baking saj bread (a type of flatbread baked on a domed or convex metal griddle) since 1980 in order to improve her family's poor financial situation and cover some of their expenses. Mere has been an Al Majmoua borrower for nine loan cycles. She is a good-standing borrower and all her previous loans have greatly helped in increasing and expanding her business and in improving her family's situation. 

Saj bread is much requested by most villagers, tourists and friends and Mere hopes to stay active and capable of meeting her customers' needs. All she asks for is to stay healthy and to open a larger bakery for her children in order to expand her business in the future.

Today, her acquired loan will be invested in buying necessary business raw materials such as flour, oil and other necessary business needs.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, oil and other items

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a hardworking and enterprising woman.  She is a married mother of two children who are in schools.  She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

Fatuma prepares dumplings using sugar, cooking oil, and wheat flour and sells to neighbors and passersby.  She cites seasonality as her major business challenge.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business.  She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, sugar, and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 30-year-old lady.  She is married and lives with her husband and children (two sons and one daughter) in the small town of Altagram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She received only an elementary education (up to grade four). Her husband Tahirab, 34 years old, studied up to grade five.  Two of their children are students in grade five and grade one, respectively.  The third one is below school-going age.

Shahida's husband is a farmer who cultivates different vegetables like potatoes, beans and onions on his own farmland. He is the main source of income for the family, but he is unable to give sufficient financial support to his family with his small income,

For the past three years, Shahida has been engaged in the activity of selling cow's milk in her village to give financial support to her family and husband.   Now, she has only one cow. She is determined to expand her business to provide more financial assistance to her family.

Therefore, she has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase one more cow, so that she can sell more milk to her customers and meet their demands.  Shahida is a very responsible and ambitious woman. She is hoping to earn an additional profit to give a better living to her family, educate her children properly and build a concrete-made house for them.

Shahida is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS for making her dreams successful.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to expand her dairy business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with five children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. She cites school fees as her highest monthly expense.

Fatuma has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase hair braids, shampoo and combs for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair braids, shampoo and combs for her business

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan de 66 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, es casado, su esposa le ayuda a él en su trabajo tiene ocho hijos, en su casa viven cinco hijos con él, dos de ellos trabajan, dos estudian y uno de ellos no estudia, le ayuda a él para sembrar la agricultura y cuidar su pequeña granja, de él dependen cinco.

El clientre se dedica a la agricultura y a la granja, ya tiene cerca de 10 años de dedicarse a eso, este trabajo lo aprendio de su hermano esto le queda a unos dos kilometros de su casa, su señora y sus hijos le ayudan, ya que él ya esta mayor y le cuesta trabajar mucho, pero sabe que debe hacerlo para mantener a su familia.

El préstamo lo utilizara, para comprar pollos, alimentos y vacunas para ellos y abonos, pesticidas para su cultivo. Lo necesario que utilizara, para sembrar y comprar mas pollitos de esta manera el podra mejorar su granja y poder a la misma vez trabajar siempre en la agricultura, ya que él necesita tener siempre para comprar el tratamiento de su esposa. Sus sueños son poder tener una granja grande y poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y que su esposa siempre tenga su medicamento, ya que ella padece del corazón y necesita tener mes a mes su tratamiento.
texts.en:
Juan, age 66, studied through the third grade.  He is married, and his wife helps him in his work.  He has eight children.  Five children live with him in his house.  Two of them work, two are students, and one of them isn’t studying.  He helps him to sow and care for his small farm.  Five children depend on him.

He works in agriculture and farming.  He has about ten years doing this type of work; he learned it from his brother.  It is about two kilometers from his house.  His wife and his children help him, because he is already an older man and it is hard for him to work a lot.  He knows that he should do it to take care of his family.

He will use the loan to buy chickens, feed, and vaccinations for them, as well as manure and pesticides for his crops.  It's necessary that he uses it, in order to plant and to buy more chicks.  In this way he will be able to improve his farm and can, at the same time, always work in farming.  He always needs to buy treatments for his wife.  

His dreams are to be able to have a large farm and to be able to give his children a better quality of life.  He also dreams that his wife would always have her medicine, because she suffers from her heart and needs to have her treatments from month to month.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, and vaccinations for them, as well as manure and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers to resell.

loans.name: Víctor Ruben

texts.es:
Víctor de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, esta acompañado tiene 6 hijos las edades de ellos son: 25,23,22,21,19 y 3 años de edad, tres de ellos ya estan acompañados y los otros tre viven con él;  la niña mas pequeñla es la que estudia en el kinder y actualmente vive con sus tres hijos solteros y su compañera de vida.

Víctor, es agricultor en pequeño, desde muy joven se a dedicado a eso, ya que no estudio lo suficiente para tener un empleo diferente, con el segundo grado que estudio él a podido sacar a su familia adelante, a sus dos primeros hijos solamente alcanzo a enviarlos hasta sexto grado; pero de ahi él ya no pudo darles mas estudio. Se dedica a la agricultura y de eso una parte la deja para el gasto de la casa y la otra para pagar el alquiler de la tierra.

El prestamo lo utilizara para pagar el alquiler de la tierra, para cultivar, ya que no cuenta con terreno propio y todos los años le toca pagar quien le alquile. De esta manera, él podra trabajar ya que quiere mejorar su vivienda y tiene la esperanza de poder sacar un poco para ir comprando, materiales poco a poco.

Sus sueños son en este año sembrar mas ya que su siembra le da buenos frutos y de esta manera sacar para poder ayudar a sus hijos, ya que su hija mayor esta esperando un bebe y su esposo tubo un accidente y no puede trabajar y su deseo es poder ayudar a su hija.
texts.en:
Víctor is 53 years old and studied up until Grade 2. He has six children who are 25, 23, 22, 21, 19 and 3 years of age. His youngest daughter goes to kinder. Three of his children have partners and the other three single children live with him and his life partner. 

Víctor has worked as a farmer from a very young age since he didn’t study enough to get a different job. He has been able to bring his family up with his schooling up to Grade 2 alone. He was only able to send his first two children to school up until Grade 6, after that he was not able to provide them with further education. From Victor’s work as a farmer he sets aside money to cover the household costs and the other half to pay the land rent.  

Victor will use this loan to pay for land rent to grow crops, since he has no land of his own and every year he has had to pay someone rent. In this way he will be able to work to improve his home with the hope of putting money aside to buy materials for it bit by bit. 

Victor dreams of planting more this year since his is able to grow good crops. By doing so he will be able to help his children since his eldest daughter is expecting a baby and her husband had an accident and cannot work, so Victor’s wish is to help his daughter.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of land which he will cultivate

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 26 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios  años, su principal siembra es el maíz y el frijol, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en: This borrower is 26 years old. He lives with his wife and children in his own house. He has worked in agriculture for a number of years. His principal crops are corn and beans. He sells his products to the agencies that buy and sell basic grains near his place of residence. With the earnings that he obtains from his sales, he helps with his family's expenses. He is applying for a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies that will help him in growing his crops, such as compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pest controls, etc., and thus he will be able to have better earnings and continue helping with the expenses of his household without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, iron and pay for labour

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a 25-year-old single woman from a small village near Jenin City-West Bank, Palestine.  She works as a secretary in a local firm where she earns a low income.  Salam would like to complete her studies since she was not able to do that before due to bad economic conditions.  She would like to complete her BA degree and find a better job in the future. 

Salam took a USD loan from FATEN.  This loan will help her pay the university installments for her first semester to complete her studies and earn a BA degree. 

Salam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for her first semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, ovaltine, and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Silvia Lourdes

texts.es:
Silvia es una joven de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijas que estudian y viven con ella, y además en la casa viven su madre y un hermano. 

Silvia es comerciante, ella vende antojitos y tiene dos años de dedicarse a este rubro, además ella es costurera, y no tiene que movilizarse a ningún lugar porque el negocio lo tiene en casa.

 El préstamo lo necesita para comprar productos para la pequeña tienda, como yuca, maíz, frijol, sodas, arroz, azúcar, etc. mejorará su vida ya que tendrá mejores ingresos a través de las ventas. 

Ella sueña con que el negocio crezca y que sus hijos se involucren en el negocio, y con las ganancias espera mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Silvia is a young woman of 25 who studied up to Grade 2 at primary school. She is a single mother and has two children who study and live with her. Her mother and a brother also live with her. 

Silvia has run a business selling snacks for two years and she also works as a dressmaker. She doesn’t have to commute at all because she runs this business from home.  

Silvia requires a loan to buy products for her small store such as cassava, corn, beans, soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. By doing so her life will improve because she will gain better earnings from her sales.

Silvia dreams of expanding her business and that her children also become involved with it. She hopes to make home improvements with her earnings.

loans.use: to buy products for her small store such as cassava, corn, beans, soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nyame Wo Tumi Group

texts.en:
Monica is married with children. She is 34 years old and completed primary school. She sells second hand clothing. She began this business with a little bit of capital since she needed to raise her children and at this date, she has nine years of experience.

She is the featured borrower of this group and is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase second hand clothing to sell to her customers. In the future, she wants to be able to have more capital and own a depot of second hand clothing.

The other member of the group sells groceries.

loans.use: To purchase second clothing to sell

loans.name: Al- Bakeel Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Al- Bakeel Al- Hodeidah is a group consists of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AL-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Saleha is a 37-year-old married woman who lives in a poor area in Hodeidah, and is the leader of the group.  She lives in miserable conditions, but she did not give up and started her business four years ago selling ice cream in the street under the sunshine.  She started to run her business herself, but the income from this business is very low, and she wants to improve it.  Currently, she wants to buy more of ice cream goods and products, but she doesn’t have enough capital. She decided to apply for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more ice cream goods and products such as sugar,  and tangs to make ice cream for resale.

Saleha looks forward to improving her business to provide her family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more ice cream goods and products such as sugar, and tangs.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married and has three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the last two years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil, and firewood for her business. She decided to join to acquire financial services for her business

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil,and firewood for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer living in the Muranga area of central Kenya. She is married and has four children.She loves farming because it has been her source of income for over 10 years. She produces and sells milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of crops. Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital for business growth.

Jane chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they help small-scale farmers to grow their income. During the training session, she learned different ways of improving her farming. This loan will enable her to earn more income and she will be able to improve her farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase books, staple machines and pens to expand her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is 31 years old, married and has been running a small general store in her community for many years.  She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store.  She makes enough to provide for her family. To make sure her store is fully stocked, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy stock of rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demands consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and flour to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two children who go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Fatuma has been operating a cafe business making consumables like rice, tea, beans, and chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan, she wants to purchase more stock such as onions, maize flour, tomatoes, wheat flour and rice for the business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase onions, maize flour, tomatoes, wheat flour, and rice for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el cliente de 26 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios  años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarla en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene , el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando el los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitación.
texts.en:
This 26-year-old client lives with his wife and two children in their own home.  He has been working in agriculture for several years and that has given him the skills and knowledge he needs to look after his crops.  He mainly grows corn and sorghum.  When the harvest is ready, he stores it in the granary shown in the photo.  Then he takes it out and sells it to some trading agencies near his home.  The income he generates goes towards household expenses.  

He is asking for a loan to buy some agricultural supplies which will help him sow seeds.  He needs compost, fertilizers and seeds.  This will help him to earn more profit and continue looking after his family and home with no restrictions.

loans.use: to buy compost, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Anam

texts.en: Anam is 35 years old and married. She has been in the beauty parlor business for many years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a larger variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She hopes to serve more customers time after time. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams in large quantities

loans.name: Ana Ismelda

texts.es:
Ana tiene 42 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera de un hijo el cual va a la escuela, con ella vive su madre y dos hermanos, pero solo son dos las personas que dependen económicamente de ella. 

La actividad a la cual Ana se dedica es el comercio, ya que posee una tienda que administra junto con su madre, y es la principal fuente de ingresos de los cuales cubren sus gastos familiares.

El préstamo lo utilizará para ampliar la tienda y para comprar más productos, ya que muchos clientes buscan productos que no tienen y necesitan el crédito para cubrir esta necesidad.

Sus sueños son que la tienda siga creciendo, y que sea de las mejores de la comunidad, para que sus ingresos mejoren y no les falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 42, studied until sixth grade.  She is the single mother of one son who goes to school.  She lives with her mother and two brothers; however, there are only two people who depend on her financially.

Ana works in commerce.  She has a store which she looks after with her mother.  It is her main source of income and it helps to cover family expenses.

She will use the loan to expand her store and buy more products, as a lot of customers are asking for things that she doesn’t have.  She will use the money to fulfill this demand.

She hopes to see the store continue to grow and be one of the best in the area, earning her more money to look after her family.

loans.use: to expand her store and buy more products.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe BENKADI ont en moyenne  47ans, 7enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à KIMPARANA/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des produits divers, des condiments et des céréales. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur 17ème  prêt solidaire. ROKIA 2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo   compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 100Kg de mil, 50Kg de fonio , 70Kg de haricot et 30Kg d’arachide. Elle s’approvisionne sur place et dans les villages environnants.Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 41 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
On average, the women of the Benkadi group are 47 years old and have 7 children. They all live in traditional extended families in Kimparana/Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali). 

The women know one another through relatives. They buy and sell various products, condiments, and cereals. After having had properly reimbursed their previous loans, the women of the Benkadi group are on their 17th group loan.

Rokia, the woman standing second from the left, plans on using her loan to buy 100kg of millet,  50Kg of fonio (a type of grain), 70kg of beans, and 30kg of peanuts. She buys her supplies locally and in neighboring villages. She sells to a mixed clientele of men and women for cash and credit. 

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 41,000 FCFA that she'll use for health expenses, food, schooling costs, and her businesses.

loans.use: to buy food items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to look after her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, a 33-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, and after doing embroidery and sewing, sells them to the people of her locality. She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Shaheen has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. 

With a good credit history, this will be Shaheen's third loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 25 años de edad posee un negocio en su lugar de residencia donde elabora y vende chocobananos, charamuscas y gelatinas, tiene mucha clientela porque es un producto muy vendible con lo que obtiene de sus ventas  logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar con su hijo y su hermano, la clienta está solicitando un crédito para la  para seguir con la elaboración de los productos  y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This 25-year-old client runs a business from home making and selling ‘chocobananos’, bananas in chocolate; frozen juice and jelly.  She has a lot of customers because these products are very popular.  With the income she generates, she is able to take care of some household expenses.  

She is a single mother and lives in a relative’s house with her son and her brother.

She is asking for a loan to be able to continue making her products and improve her profits to offer her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bananas (guineos), fruit, chocolate, jelly, bags, glasses, spoons and other necessary items.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Rubina is a 25 year-old married woman. She has been doing a business selling fruit for many years. She is a very enthusiastic lady and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of four children and is responsible for their food, health and education. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas. This will help her to meet market demands consistently.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more gari, palm oil and peppers for resale.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra is a 49-year-old married woman. She has eight children. For about six years, she has been in the business of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way, she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Pachacutec Group

texts.es: Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “PACHACUTEC” en la ciudad del Cusco. Marleny nació en la ciudad del Cusco y tiene 41 años de edad. Su actividad económica principal de Marleny es la imprenta, ella es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como tintas y papeles. Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la venta de carne, venta de productos de limpieza, a brindar servicio de alojamiento y transportes. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (La fotografía de la persona que aparece adjunta en la foto principal llego después a la reunión porque trabaja en una entidad privada y no tenía tiempo).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors make up the communal bank called “Pachacutec” in the city of Cusco.  

Marleny, 41, was born in Cusco and earns her living from printing.  She is a very charismatic, friendly and successful person.  She needs this loan to buy work materials such as ink and paper.  

This communal bank is made up of various people who are always looking for opportunities to make a living and with hard work, create a better life for their children.  Different activities that members of this group do are selling meat, selling cleaning products, providing accommodation and offering transport.  
The members are grateful for the support and promise to pay back the loans in the agreed installments.  

Marleny appears in the photograph attached to the main photo.  This is because she arrived late to the meeting due to other work commitments and wasn’t in time to appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy work materials such as ink and paper.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil and other items

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a very hardworking  business woman. She is married with two children who go to school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Bibi has operated a charcoal and firewood selling business for the past 2 years. Her potential clients are neighbours and passersby. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business, and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma has successfully built her business manufacturing artificial flowers with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She counts a good client list and earns enough to contribute to the family income.

Previously with the help of a Kiva loan she purchased items needed for her business. Currently she has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase bundles of tissue paper, glace paper and packs of glues and wires. This will allow her to meet the demands of her customers consistently. 

She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of tissue paper, glace paper and packs of glues and wires.

loans.name: José Gudiel

texts.es:
José es un joven trabajador de 27 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo grado cuatro y son cuatro personas las que dependen de él. 

Este joven se dedica a la agricultura, actividad que realiza junto con su esposa, él se levanta desde muy temprano para comenzar su trabajo a las 6 de la mañana y la ventaja es que el lugar le queda cerca de su casa.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado lechero, engordarlo y que produzca en un futuro.

Él sueña con que sus animales se críen en un buen estado y se desarrollen bien y obtener más ganancia en la venta de leche y queso.
texts.en:
José is a young worker of 27 years of age. He has a partner and two children. He was only able to study until the second grade and there are four people who depend on him.

This young man makes a living from agriculture. He does this work together with his wife. He gets up very early to start his work at six in the morning and the advantage is that the place where he works is very close to the house.

He needs the loan in order to buy dairy cattle and fatten them up so they produce in future.

He dreams of his animals being raised well so they develop well and he can obtain greater profits by selling milk and cheese.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle and fatten them up

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 50-year-old married woman. 

She has been running a business manufacturing furniture with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo) for many years. They started making beds and chairs with nylon and rope, and they are struggling hard to support the needs of their four children. 

Shamshad requires a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy nylon, ropes, and wooden frames in large quantity to increase their sales. She is hopeful of getting more income through her sales. 

She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy nylon, ropes and wooden frames in large quantity.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman and has two children who go to school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for her family.

She has operated a fish selling business for one year now, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.
 
She decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish, cooking oil and firewood for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to expand her business.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen has successfully built her hand embroidery business with the support of the Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She has now become famous in her locality for providing beautiful embroidery designs. 

Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she purchased raw materials needed for her business. Now she wants to grow her business so she has requested a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy more materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

She dreams of a bright future for her children and would like to build her own house, as now she is living in a rented house with her family. 

She is in her 4th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 25-year-old married woman. She has four children, two of whom are school going. Her husband (also shown in the photo) sells cloth.  He buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the wholesale market and then sells it o the people of their community. He earns a good amount of income to cover their household expenditures. For the improvement of her husband's business, Shagufta requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. 

Shagufta is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy and good area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts for his motorcycle. His business goal is to have many motorcycles within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 19-year-old single man from Qalqilia city. His father is a worker with a low and unstable income. Ahmad is a student in a local university where he studies the French language. He would like to finish his study and earn his BA degree so he can find a job in the future. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to complete his study and earn his BA degree. 

Ahmad appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Eva Alejandrina

texts.es: Eva de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y sus cuatro nietos, Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas en su casa desde hace varios años trabaja de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy trabajadora y amable, con las ganancias que obtiene y la ayuda de su hija logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Eva solicita un crédito para comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir elaborando las tortillas y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Eva is 61 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter and her four grandchildren. She has made a living selling tortillas in her home for many years, and works from Mondays to Sundays. She has a large customer base because she is a very hard-working and friendly person. With the profits she makes and the help of her daughter she will be able to pay her household expenses. Eva is requesting a loan to buy quintales of corn and lime to continue making tortillas and in this way boost her earnings to achieve better financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy quintales of corn and lime.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es:
Reyna de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, es madre de tres hijos de las edades siguientes.20,18 y 14 años de edad. Una de ellas estudia octavo grado, el varon cuando le sale trabajos en la finca va a trabajar. La cliente vive con su nieta y sus tres hijos, es madre soltera al igual que su hija que ya tiene  1 hija y esta embarazada nuevamente, de la cliente dependen 4.

Reyna posee una pequeña tienda de charamuscas, sodas, paletas, chocobananos; desde hace tres años, trambien va a lavarle a una señora y ella le da su par de dolares, ella aprovecha cuando sale el equipo de footbol de su comunidad para asi poder tener mas ingresos para llevar la comida a su casa.

El préstamo lo utilizara para surtir la tienda comprando azucar, arroz, café, sal, etc y de esa manera podra tener mas que ofrecer, ademas de eso ella podra pagar una deuda que ya tiene, la cual saco para poner su tienda.

Sus sueños dice que son un dia poder tener su tienda surtida y poder agrandarla más, ya que su hija esta esperando otro hijo mas y es madre soltera, las ganancias que obtenga serviran para darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reyna is 40 years old, and studied up to the second grade. She is the mother of three children aged 20, 18 and 14. One of her daughters is studying in the eighth grade, and her son works on a farm when there is work. Reyna lives with her granddaughter and her three children and is a single mother like her daughter who has one child and is pregnant again. Therefore, Reyna has four dependents.

Reyna has had a small store selling charamuscas, which are a traditional sweets, sodas, lolly pops, and chocolate covered bananas for three years. She also helps a woman with her personal grooming and earns a couple of dollars from this. When the local football team has a match, she takes her products to the ground to boost her earnings to put food on the plate at home.

She will use the loan to stock her store, buying sugar, rice, coffee, salt and other items. In this way, she will have more to offer, and pay off a debt she has which is a result of setting up her shop.

She says that she dreams of one day having a well-stocked store which she can expand, because her daughter is expecting another child and is a single mother, and the earnings from this would enable her to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, coffee, salt and other items.

loans.name: Iram

texts.en: Iram is 29 years old and married. She has been running a small beauty parlor in her locality for many years.  She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services, she has become very famous in her community. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because she has limited cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 45,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hoping to serve more customers time after time. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy hair care and skin products in large quantities.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is married and has three school-going children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated a tailoring business, making curtains as well as garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth and sewing threads for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more slippers for resale

loans.name: Balquees

texts.en:
Balquees is a fifty-two-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has two buffaloes, which she uses to produce milk that she then sells to people in her area. She also sells butter and cheese to generate extra profits.  

Balquees has become famous for providing good-quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She also sells animals on a seasonal basis to generate extra income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her third loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. Balquees is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a twenty-nine-year-old entrepreneur residing in Dansoman, a district of Ghana where she lives with her husband. For six years, Juliana has been running a grocery shop. She operates in a kiosk at her residence. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Juliana will make bulk purchases of grocery items such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, milk and Milo. With the additional profits, Juliana hopes to expand her shop so that she can make a larger profit.

loans.use: purchase grocery items such as rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, milk, and Milo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a thirty-year-old divorced father of one. He has been working as a blacksmith for the past eighteen years. He is a hard worker, very talented in his domain, and is working hard to provide his only child a better life. Hassan was only twelve years old when he started to work as a blacksmith because he had to support his family. Today, he is well known in his region and his business is developing gradually to meet his customers' needs and requests.

Hassan is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay what's needed to complete building his dream house to make it a healthy living place for his beloved child.

loans.use: complete building his house to make it a healthy living place

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 48 años de edad, estudió muy poco en la escuela, ahora tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, con él vive su madre, sus dos hijos y su esposa. 

José es agricultor y ganadero, tiene 14 años de dedicarse a este rubro que aprendió por su padre, ya que se lo inculcó desde pequeño, también se dedica  a la carpintería y sus horas de trabajo son de 6 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. 

El préstamo lo solicita para comprar dos terneros, para engordarlo y luego venderlos, será satisfecha su necesidad ya que tendrá más ingresos para el hogar. 
José sueña con que sus animales crezcan en buen estado y así venderlos a buen precio en un futuro.
texts.en:
Jose, 48, studied very little at school.  Now he has two children who attend school and he lives with his mother, two children and wife.

Jose is has been working in agriculture and livestock farming for 14 years, having learned the trade from his father since he was a young boy.  He also does carpentry work.  His work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

The loan he is requesting is to buy two calves to raise and sell in order to earn more income for the household.  His dream is to raise healthy animals and sell them at a good price in the future.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, milk, eggs, bread and other items.

loans.name: Dounamba

texts.fr:
Née en 1969 à DIALAKORO, DOUNAMBA  vit avec ses 5 enfants et son époux dans une famille traditionnelle à DALABALA,  dans la Sous-préfecture de Kangaré  (Région de Sikasso, République du MALI).
DOUNAMBA n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt, elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage et vente de céréales : maïs et riz. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, il y a cinq ans. 
Après avoir remboursé le cinquième prêt, DOUNAMBA est à son sixième  prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé pour  acheter 15 sacs de riz, auprès des paysans producteurs de DALABALA et environ qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Elle  vend  essentiellement à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles BAMAKO et SELINGUE.   
DOUNAMBA  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans les activités l’achat stockage et vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Dounamba was born in 1969 in Dialakoro. She lives with her spouse and five children in a traditional family in Dalabala, subprefecture of Kangaré (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali).

Dounamba never got a chance to go to school. Early on, she got interested in money-earning businesses, in particular buying, stocking, and selling cereals such as maize and rice.

Eager to meet a strongly growing customer demand, she decided five years ago to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. After having repaid her fifth loan, she's now seeking her sixth personal loan, which she will use to buy 15 sacks of rice from farmer producers in Dalabala and surroundings. She will stock the rice for at least three months.

She sells mostly to a clientele made up of resellers coming from the large cities, such as Bamako and Sélingué. She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 90'000, to be in part used to help her husband provide for the family's needs, and in part reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of rice

loans.name: Badegna Group

texts.fr:
BADEGNA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TAGAN. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’ustensiles à l’image de FERIMA qui est la première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TAGAN dans la Sous-préfecture de KANGARE (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente d’ustensiles : cuillère  et assiette. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
FERIMA, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à TAGAN, excelle dans la vente d’ustensiles. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 30 douzaines de cuillère et 10 douzaines d’assiette. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses objets  à SELINGUE, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 50.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité ci-dessous.
texts.en:
Badegna Group is part of Benkadi Association in Tagan. It regroups women who got to know each other through bonds of kinship and community. They are married and average 40 years of age and four children.

They all live in large traditional families in Tagan, in Kangare Subprefecture (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali). They run various businesses, such as buying and selling utensils, just like Ferima, the woman sitting on the right in the photograph.

They've been in retail for several years, and their businesses of buying and selling utensils (spoons and plates) are very much in demand. Eager to meet the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, one year ago. They are seeking their second solidarity loan (group loan).

Ferime, the group's president, is very well known in Tagan, and she excels at selling utensils. She intends to use her loan to buy 30 dozen spoons and 10 dozen plates. She gets her supplies in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her products in Sélingué, for cash and on credit, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 50'000, to be used to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to 30 dozen spoons and 10 dozen plates

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es:
Ana de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado no culmino sus estudios como bachiller debido a la falta de recursos económicos de sus padres en esos momentos, siendo la primera de 4 hermanos tuvo que buscar un trabajo como domestica para ayudarles a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
 Actualmente está soltera y no tiene hijos, ella solo vive con sus padres quienes ya son personas de avanzada edad y tiene que trabajar más duro para mantenerlos, ya que ellos no tiene la misma fuerza de antes para trabajar.

Ella se dedica a trabajar como domestica desde que tenía 15 años,  ya que por los recursos económicos con los que contaba su familia se dedica a trabajar para ayudar con el estudio y la alimentación de su familia,  tiene que caminar 1.5 km desde su casa y casi toda la calle es cuesta arriba tiene que salir de su casa a las 5:15 am para estar en su lugar de trabajo a las 6:00 am para salir a esa hora, ella tiene que madrugar  para dejar los quehaceres del hogar y tiene que llegar temprano a su trabajo para realizar los quehaceres del trabajo, aparte de este trabajo como doméstica, ella trabaja la agricultura apoyada por su padre y un primo, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 am hasta las 5:00pm.  

Con el crédito comprara madera valorada en $640,  la cual será para la infraestructura del techo de la casa que tiene en construcción junto a su familia y comprara teja la cual está valorada en $360; con esto podrá culminar las compras de la construcción, ya que comprando todo de una sola vez le saldrá un poco más barato ya que aprovechara el transporte en llevar las dos cosas de una sola vez.

En el futuro ella desea poder formar su propia familia, tener hijos y darles el ejemplo de vida que ha tenido ella con sus padres, que ellos puedan tener el estudio que ella no tubo debido a las condiciones económicas con que sus padres contaban, además ella desea poder terminar la construcción de la casa antes que llegue el invierno y poder estar refugiados por las tormentas ya en su nueva casa.
texts.en:
Ana, 28, has a ninth grade education.  She was unable to go to high school because her parents could not afford it then.  She is the eldest of four siblings and had to work as a domestic employee to help her parents cover the household expenses.  She is single and has no children and lives with her elderly parents.  She works hard to support them since they cannot work like they used to.

She has been domestic employee for 15 years in order to help pay for the family's education and food, because of the lack of economic resources in the household.  She walks 1.5 km from home, up hill, and leaves in the morning at 5:15 a.m. to be at work at 6:00 a.m.  In order to leave on time she must get up earlier and do the housework beforehand.  She also works in agriculture helping her father and a cousin.  Her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.
