With the loan she will buy wood worth $540, which will be the infrastrructure for the roof of the house she and her family are building.  She will buy tiles worth $360 to finish the construction.  It will be a little cheaper for her to make the purchase at one time as she can transport both things together.

In the future she wants to form her own family, have children and set an example for them just like her parents did for her.  She wants them to get the education she could not receive because her parents could not afford it.  She wants to finish her house before winter so they will have shelter from the storms in their new home.

loans.use: To buy wood and tiles for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Carlos Alfredo

texts.es:
Carlos de 28 años de edad, está casado, estudió hasta segundo año de bachillerato, su esposa es comerciante pues vende ropa y productos de belleza, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando, con él vive su madre y dos hermanos. 

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tiene 7 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que aprendió por su padre y su hermana mayor, a además se dedica  a la albañilería, y es uno de sus hermanos quien se involucra y le ayuda en el trabajo.

El crédito lo utilizará para arrendar el terreno donde va a cultivar y para comprar un novillo de repasto. 
Él espera que la siembra haga en las tierras arrendadas le produzcan al máximo para tener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos, 28, is married and finished his second year of high school.  His wife is a merchant and sells clothing and beauty products.  They have two children who attend school, and they live with his mother and two siblings.

Carlos works in agriculture and livestock farming, and has been in the trade for seven years, having learned it from his father and elder sister.  He also works as a bricklayer with one of his brothers who helps him out.

The loan will be used to rent cropland and to buy a young bull for grazing.  He hopes to obtain a good crop production in order to earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To rent cropland and buy a young bull.

loans.name: Luzalva

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Lusalva en su confección, pues ella logró comprar con su credikiva, hilos, telas, accesorios, al pormayor y de contado, con ello su capital de trabao se vió ligeramente aumentado y lo mismo sus ventas y utilidades de negocio. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores en Kiva :"Dios los bendiga sigan apoyandome para seguuir progresando junto a mi familia. "  En la actualidad Lusalva está aplicando a un nuevo finaciamiento mediante el cual compará una vez mas en un mayor volumen y de contado, telas, hilos, encajes, accesorios para producir principalmente nueva ropa infantil.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Luzalva in her sewing business.  With her CrediKiva loan she was able to buy wholesale thread, fabric and accessories in cash.  Her working capital increased slightly as did her sales and business profit.  She sends the following message to Kiva lenders:  "God bless you, please continue to support me so I can prosper with my family.".  

Luzalva is requesting a new loan to buy, once again and in cash, more fabric, thread, lace and accessories to make new children's clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and lace, wholesale, to make new children's clothing.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine  is married with two children and only one child goes to school.  She has a business of making beads and has been in this business for two years.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more materials for making beads.  She generates additional income from selling piped water. 

She sells on both a retail and wholesale basis six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring to sell on a wholesale basis only and also to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms.  She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity bills and medication.

loans.use: To buy more materials for making beads.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a man of thirty six years and married to Faith with whom they have four children.  He sells second hand clothes in Kiambu area, a business he has been doing for twelve years now, and gets a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings.

This will be Peter's fourth loan with Vision fund Kenya and he plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes for selling.  He wants to be able to provide for all his family's needs and expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling

loans.name: Isa

texts.en:
Isa is a 27 year old man from Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya.  He is a married man with two kids who are 2 and 4 years old.

He is a carpenter and he has been doing this for the last 10 years and he gets a monthly income of KES 12,000, though he struggles.  He has applied for his first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to buy materials like lumber.  He will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business.

He has a dream of developing his business so as to become the best in his town and also to help him support his family.

loans.use: to boost his business by adding more lumber for making furniture

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is a 30 years old man from Kakamega region, married and supporting five people in his family.  He has been blessed with one child who is 3 years old.

He has a Barber Shop business which he has been doing for the last 4 years and generates a monthly income of KES 12,500.  He has applied for his second loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase more shaving machines and mirrors.  He will use the anticipated profits to educate his child and other dependents.

His dreams to have a good source of income so as to take good care of his family's health and to educate his child.

loans.use: to improve the appearance of his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase goods to make Sambusa (traditional food).

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with two children and only one of whom goes to school.  She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for 2 1/2 years.  She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bales of used clothes.  She generates additional income from poultry farming. 

She works at the market and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of used clothes.  She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and to also to buy a plot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister, her sister's daughter and a cousin). She has a business of hair dressing and has been in this business for 11 years. She generates additional income from a beauty school. 

She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and hair treatment. She works in her shop seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to owning a fully stocked beauty salon and also to open up another salon. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids, weaves and hair treatments.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members, including her sister. 

Jalia has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from selling foodstuffs. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a wholesale basis. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to buy a delivery van and also to build more rental rooms. 

Jalia resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, food for the family and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Mary has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She generates additional income from selling local gin. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Mary aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land on which she can build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low-interest loans. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She has a pub business and has been in this business for 10 years. 

Teddy has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more crates of soda and beer and cans of local gin. She works from home seven days a week and sells on a wholesale basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Teddy aspires to own a fully stocked pub and also to buy a plot of land on which she can build a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, medication and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more cans of local gin, crates of beer and soda.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of groundnut (peanuts) and peppers for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, red oil, charcoal, and other items to expand her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Married with three children, Mariam is a client of ID-Ghana and she sells cosmetics, wigs and cream at the local market in Dansoman District in Ghana. 

This loan will also assist Mariam in reducing costs and increasing sales and profits. She is very passionate about helping the community and loves working with her customers. She will make bulk purchases of the cosmetics she sells with the requested Kiva loan.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases of cosmetics.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth is a man who is twenty-eight years old and married, and together with his wife they are expecting their first child. 

He keeps livestock and pigs in Kiambu. This is a business he has been doing for six years and he gets a monthly income of eight thousand.

This will be Kenneth's first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he plans to use to buy two pigs and purchase livestock feed. In the future, he wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his livestock and buy two pigs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a single man who is thirty. He keeps livestock like cows, goats etc and also keeps poultry in his home area. He has been in this business for three years now and he a gets monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Robert's first loan with Vision Fund Kenya and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase animal feed for his livestock and poultry. In future he wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to purchase feed for livestock and poultry.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph and his family are doing are well.  He was able to buy a cow with his previous loan.  Now, milk sales and his retail shop have helped him increase his income to 30,000 shillings.

This will be Joseph's eighth loan with Vision fund Kenya and he plans to use the entire loan to buy another dairy cow. In future he wants to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 65 years old and he lives in Olkalou.  His wife and two grandchildren are doing well..

John is still in the farming business and he was able to buy some calves with the previous loan.  John managed to expand his farming activities with his previous loan and right now his monthly income is KES. 30,000, up from KES. 15,000. 

John has applied for his fourth loan of KES. 50,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use on his maize plantation. He plans to use his anticipated profits to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya and to educate his grandchildren.

In the future, he hopes to be an established farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Angel 3 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Angel 3. It is made up of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They are hardworking and enterprising and seek a loan of 110,000 YER from AMB. 

Neama, 52, is the group's leader.  She is married and has six children.  Her oldest is 26 and the youngest age 21.  She lives in miserable conditions, but has not surrender to her challenges. 

Neama portion of the loan is 50,000 YER, from AMB.  She will buy incense, perfumes, and women clothes and reselling them to her customers for a profit. This loan will allow her to strengthen her business and increase her revenue.  One of Neama's aims is to grow her business by attracting more customers, which will help her and her husband pay their expenses.  

Naema hopes to earn large profits so she can improve her savings and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy incense, perfumes, and women clothes.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24 years old and she lives in the town of Lugazi, in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is Married and has two school age children. For the past three years, Grace has been working hard to manage her clothing boutique. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more clothes for sell.  This will help Grace generate greater profits and add a wholesale shop.  Grace also hopes to open another boutique. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to micro finance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married with three school age children. She also takes care of her parents.  

Rose runs a food stall and has been in business for three years.  She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas, bags of sweet and Irish potatoes, cassava and pumpkins. 

Rose doesn’t participate in any other income generating activities.  She works at the market six days a week and sells on retail basis.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  

Rose aspires to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land and build her own house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas, bags of sweet and Irish potatoes, cassava and pumpkins.

loans.name: Mwari

texts.en:
Mwari is a married woman with six children.  Three attend school and three are adults.  She lives in her own house that has no electricity or piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has been selling cows at the market, to the general public. Mwari's main challenge has been unstable market prices. 

Mwari joined Yehu to gain access to funds.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cows.

loans.use: to purchase cows.

loans.name: Scolastica

texts.en:
Scolastica appreciates for her previous loan that improved her standard of living. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Scolastica would like a loan to buy more household consumables, like wheat and maize flour, rice and sugar. 

She thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to buy more wheat and maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and Maggie.

loans.name: Elías Alberto

texts.es:
Elías es un joven emprendedor de 25 años de edad, está soltero, estudió hasta segundo año de bachillerato, y solo sus padres dependen de él.
Elías es empleado y también se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, lo aprendió de su padre pues desde pequeño lo llevaba al campo, él viaja en bus para llegar al trabajo y se tarda una hora y 30 minutos en llegar. 
El préstamo que solicita a CrediCampo lo utilizará para ayudarle a su padre con sus problemas de salud, ya que se encuentra enfermo y es un hijo que está agradecido por todo lo que ha hecho por él en la vida y por eso le urge ayudarle.
Elías sueña con que su padre mejore de salud, y poder trabajar juntos para salir adelante.
texts.en: Elias is a 25 year old enterprising young man. He is single. He studied up to second year of high school, and only his parents depend on him. Elias is employed and also works growing corn and beans. He learned this from his father because since he was young he used to take him to the fields. He travels by bus to get to work, and it takes him one hour and 30 minutes to arrive. The loan he is requesting CrediCampo is to help his father with health issues because he is now sick. He is a son who is grateful for everything he has done for him in life, and therefore it is urgent that he helps him. Elias dreams of having his father get better and be able to work together to move forward.

loans.use: to help his father with his health issues.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and Maggie.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish, rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and maggi to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, manure, and spray fertilizer to help with her coffee crops.

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
José de 37 años  de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado por cuestiones económicas ya no pudo culminar sus estudios y se dedicó a trabajar la tierra junto a su padre; ya que por la falta de recursos económicos tenía que trabajar y llevar el sustento de su hogar.

 Actualmente está casado vive en su casa junto a su esposa, quien se dedica a los oficios del hogar y a atender una pequeña tienda que como familia han decidido instalar para  ayudarles con un ingreso extra, con ella han procreado 3 hijos, la menor de ellas está estudiando 7°grado y tiene 13 años, el segundo tiene 11 años y estudia 5° grado, la última  tiene 9 años y estudia 2°grado, en total son 4 personas que dependen del cliente.

José se decidida a el comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 5 años, comenzó con este rubro ya que él trabajaba en un mercado ayudándole a un amigo; pero cuando tuvo la experiencia necesaria como para hacerse cargo de un negocio decidió ponerlo y hasta el momento el siente que le ha generado una buena ganancia aparte de esto también trabaja la agricultura ya que solo vende 4 días a la semana los otros días los dedica a este rubro en la temporada de invierno en verano vende todos los días frutas y verduras.

Con el crédito el cliente realizara una mejora en su vivienda reparara el piso, comprara arena, cemento, hierro, alambre, y cancelara la mano de obra del albañil ya que con el que cuenta actualmente es de tierra él lo quiere hacer de cemento para poder tener una mejor higiene en su familia. 

En un futuro desea poder tener su casa más grande y que su pequeña valla creciendo cada día mas y más, también desea poder tener un comercio más grande en la venta de frutas y verdura, desea que sus hijos puedan culminar sus estudios y sean profesionales que cada quien desempeñe un trabajo de acuerdo a la carrera que estudien y puedan formar un hogar muy estable como con él que él los ha crecido, comenta que se esforzara para cumplir a sus hijos con todos los costos de sus estudios y para poder hacer más grande su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old. He attended school until 6th grade and could not complete his education for financial reasons. He began to work the land with his father since, due to a lack of economic resources, he had to work and bring in income for his family.

He is currently married and lives with his wife, who performs household duties and runs a small store that the family decided to open to earn some extra money. They have three children, one who is 13 and in 7th grade, one who is 11 and in 5th grade, and one who is 9 and in 2nd grade. A total of four people depend on Jose.

Jose has made a living by selling fruits and vegetables for the past 5 years. He began while working in a market helping a friend but, when he had enough experience to start his own business, he started working for himself. He feels that he has earned a good income from this. He also works in agriculture, since he only sells fruit and vegetables four days per week. On the other days and in the winter, he tends to the crops. In the summer, he sells the fruits and vegetables.

With the loan, Jose will make improvements to his home by repairing the floor. He will purchase sand, cement, iron, and wire, and pay a bricklayer. His floor is currently earth, and he would like to install a cement floor to improve the health standards for his family.

In the future, he hopes to purchase a larger house and grow his business. He also would like to have a larger business selling fruit and vegetables. He hopes that his children can finish school, become professionals, have a career in the field that they study, and form a stable home like the one he has provided for them. He comments that he will strengthen himself so that he can pay for his children's education and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, iron, and wire, and to pay a bricklayer to repair the floor of his home.

loans.name: Emilio Baltazar

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y actualmente está acompañado.

Emilio se dedica a al comercio de totopostes y tustacas, lo aprendió por un amigo, él vio que deja ganancias y por eso ha seguido en esa actividad, y también se dedica al transporte escolar. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para mejorar su negocio, para comprar más productos y mas bandejas para la elaboración de totopostes y tustacas. 

Él desea que su negocio crezca cada vez más y que su hijo siga sus pasos para que en futuro tengan más ingresos y una fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Emilio is 32 years old. He completed high school and is currently married. Emilio makes a living by making totopostes (baked corn tortilla) and tustacas (baked corn and cheese dough). He learned this business from a friend.

He saw that this business provides income, so he has continued with this business. He also drives a school bus.

He will use the loan to improve his business and to purchase more products and baking sheets to make totopostes and tustacas.

He hopes that his business continues to grow and that his son follows his footsteps to earn more money and have a job in the future.

loans.use: to improve his business and to purchase more products and baking sheets to make totopostes (baked corn tortilla) and tustacas (baked corn and cheese dough)

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
SABOUGNOUMA est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de TAGAN. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne cinq enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente d’habillements  à l’image de DENIBLE  qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à TAGAN dans la Sous préfecture de KANGARE (Région de Sikasso, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat  vente d’habillements : pagne wax et balle de friperie.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a un an. Elles sont à leur deuxième  prêt solidaire. 
DENIBLE, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 20 pièces de pagne wax et de 1 balle de friperie.  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à  SELINGUE en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 40.000FCFA  somme qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en: Sabougnouma is a group from the Benkadi association of Tagan. The group brings together women who know one another through parentage and neighborhood ties. The women are, on average, 41 years old. Married, with an average of five children, they run different businesses such as the buying and selling of clothing, as Denible, the first person standing from the left to the right of the photo, does. The women live in large traditional families in Tagan, in the sub-prefecture of Kangare (Sikasso Region, Republic of Mali). They have been working in small business for several years and are very sought after in their business of buying and selling clothing, including wax pagnes (colorful print fabrics) and bundles of second-hand clothing. In order to meet the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program one year ago. They are on their second group loan. Denible expects to use her loan to purchase 10 units of wax pagne and one bundle of second-hand clothing. She stocks up in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her products in Selingue at retail for cash and for credit to a mixed clientele. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her clothes-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Ziyoda

texts.ru: Зиёда молодая женщина, у которой не сложилась семейная жизнь. Ей сейчас 22 года и она уже разведена. Зиёда живет с матерью и маленькой дочерью в районе Дж.Руми. Она целеустремленная женщина и планирует начать бизнес в сфере продажи авиабилетов, который она считает прибыльным. У нее есть опыт в этой области и теперь она хочет создать свой бизнес в этом направлении. Для открытия своей точки продажи авиабилетов Зиёда просит кредит. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку. Ведь кредит поможет ей начать свое дело и зарабатывать на жизнь.
texts.en: Ziyoda is a young woman who has had difficulties in her family life. She is 22 years old and already divorced. She and her young daughter live with her mother in the J. Rumi district. She is a determined woman and plans to start a business selling airline tickets, which she thinks will be profitable. She has experience in this area of work and would like to start her own business. Ziyoda has asked for a loan so that she can open a store to sell the tickets. She hopes for financial support because the loan will help her start a business and earn a living.

loans.use: to start a business selling airline tickets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 61 años de edad, no tuvo el privilegio de estudiar ya que por la zona muy remota donde ella vivía y la falta de recursos económicos con que contaba su familia le impidieron poder aprender a leer y escribir, ella está casada y con su esposo procrearon 4 hijos de los cuales ya todos formalizaron sus familias; actualmente ella vive con dos nietas ya que la madre de ellas está en otro país al igual que el esposo de María. Ellos con el deseo de salir adelante arriesgaron sus vidas para tener una mejor fuente de ingresos y dejando a su familia atrás para superarse económicamente.

María se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, ya que no pudiendo estudiar ella junto a sus hermanos trabajaba junto a sus padres cultivando los granos básicos, también ella los últimos 10 años de su vida se ha dedicado al cuido de ganado, con esto ha podido tener una fuente de ingresos extra ya que con la venta de los animales y el producto de ellos ha podido ir saliendo adelante con los gastos de su hogar.

Ella solicita el crédito para la agricultura pagara mano de obra, comprara pesticidas y abonos para sus cultivos y también comprara un cerdo el cual lo cuidara y tendrá en crecimiento para luego venderlo y así tener un ingreso a mediano plazo con dicha venta. Con la compra de todos los insumos ella ahorrara, ya que ahorita el precio está más barato que cuando ya la temporada de siembra aumenta el precio de los productos es más alto. 

En un futuro María desea tener una gran producción de granos básicos y que todos los esfuerzos que ella ha realizado hasta ahorita le sean recompensados, desea que sus hijos sean tan felices como ella lo ha sido con sus familias y además ella desea poder tener las fuerzas para seguir trabajando muy duro.
texts.en:
María, 61, never had a chance to go to school or learn to read and write because her parents couldn't afford the fees.  She and her husband have 4 children, all grown now with families of their own.  She lives with two grandchildren because their mother, like María's husband, is working in another country.  They chose to leave their families behind and work abroad because that was their best option for getting ahead and better supporting their families.

María has a farming business.  She and her brothers and sisters grew up on a farm, working alongside their parents to grow the crops that kept the family.  María also raises cattle, work that she's been doing for the last 10 years or so.  The cattle and the products they produce cover her everyday expenses.

María is applying for a loan that she will use to pay expenses--labor and supplies--for her next crop and buy a pig.  She will raise the pig and sell it, an investment that will provide her with an income in the medium term.  Buying the supplies she needs now, when the prices are relatively low, will help her as well.

María hopes that her next harvest will be a good one and that she will see a good result for all her hard work.  She also hopes that her children will be as happy with their families as she has been with hers.  Finally, she wants the strength to keep working hard.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Afërdita

texts.en:
Afërdita is grateful to all Kiva lenders for their support and for the loan that she had previously obtained in order to purchase various materials for her work. Since she has a lot of customers and requests for her work, she was able to satisfy their needs and tastes and generate more income. 

She is once again asking for a loan in order to purchase additional and newer materials to continue to serve her customers well. By doing so, she will be able to ensure that she will generate enough income to contribute to her family and provide them a better life. She is very happy to have this chance for a second loan and is grateful for any support she is given.

loans.use: To purchase additional and newer materials to continue to serve her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee-growing business.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan, hombre casado y padre de 3 hijos adultos, continua dedicado al comercio y reparación de equipos celulares; él ofrece los teléfonos de mayor tecnologia desde en compañia de su hijo, quien estudió para ello, y en su negocio cada vez deben ofrecer su mejor servicio para sostenerse en él.  En un local ubicado en la zona central de la ciudad, diariamente desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, trabajan vendiendo de contado y comprando a proveedores de las empresas de celulares. Su principal mercado está en una zona comercial y lo conforman transeuntes, y personas que trabajn en las oficinas de su alrededor. Hace 3 años Juan se encuentra vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en esta organización ha recibido 3 finaciamientos, mediante el cual ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo,incrmentar sus activos y lograr un posicionamiento en el sector. Su meta es lograr caa vez mejor calidad de vida y su mayor desafio es lograr impactar el mercado incrementando sus ventas, para generar mucho mas ingresos. Este es el segundo finaciamiento que solicita a Kiva mediante el que comprará nuevos celulares y accesorios que marcan su venta como diferenciadora en el sector donde se encuentra, y esto es justamente la razón de éxito de sus anteriores inversiones.
texts.en:
Juan is a married man who has 3 grown children.  He is continuing with his business selling and repairing cell phone equipment.  He offers phones with the best technology for sale, along with his son, who studied this trade.  So that he can support himself with the business, he always offers the best service. 

He and his son work each day from 8am until 6pm in a shop located in a central area of the city.  They sell on a cash basis, and they make their purchases from the suppliers of the cell phone companies. Juan's main market is in a commercial area, and is comprised of passers-by and people who work in the surrounding offices.  

Juan has been involved with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo for 3 years, and he has received 3 loans from this organization, through which he has managed to increase his working capital, increase his assets, and position himself in the market.  His goal is to keep improving his quality of life.  His main challenge is to impact the market, increasing his sales so that he can generate more income. This is the 2nd loan that he has requested from Kiva.  Through this loan, he will buy new cell phones and accessories that will distinguish his business from the others in his area, which is exactly the reason that his previous investments were successful.

loans.use: to buy new cell phones for his family business, with his second loan through Kiva

loans.name: Daniel Esau

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 21 años de edad, está estudiando la universidad, su pareja es abogada, con él vive su hijo que está pequeño, y de él depende solo dependen dos personas. 

Daniel es comerciante, tiene un negocio de reparación y venta de celulares y computadoras, ya tiene cuatro años en este negocio, el negocio está a 30 minutos y viaja en bus. 

El préstamo lo utilizará para mejorar el negocio, para comprar más productos y herramientas, mejorará su condición de vida pues tendrá más ingresos.

Él planea que su negocio crezca y poner otro local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Daniel, 21, is a university student.  He has a young son who lives with him and who he supports.

Daniel has a retail business repairing and selling cell phones and computers.  He has operated the business for four years.  The business is 30 minutes away and he travels there by bus.  

Daniel will use the loan to buy the products and tools he needs to improve the business.  The investment will, in turn, provide him a larger income.

Daniel wants to grow his business and set up another store in the city center.

loans.use: to pay for improvements to his phone sales and repair business.

loans.name: Gonzales A Group

texts.es: German, tiene 32 años de edad, es soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en una zona productora del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva frijol, chile, tomate y café. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Solicita el tercer ciclo de préstamo que es por 8,000 lempiras y es en forma grupal. Con el cual va comprar fertilizantes para sus cultivos y sacar mejor producción para ayudar con el estudio a sus hijos y que tengan mejor vida. El grupo se llama Gonzales A, formado por 3 miembros que viven en la misma comunidad, se dedican a la agricultura y solicitan un monto total de préstamo por 16,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y sembrar café, maíz y frijol. En la foto esta Olbin a la izquierda, Carlos y German a la derecha con camisa negra.
texts.en:
German is 32 years old, single, and has 2 children. He lives in a productive farming zone of San Pedro Sula municipality. German has always dedicated himself to agriculture, cultivating beans, chiles, tomatoes, and coffee. He sells his harvests in the local market.

He is in his 3rd loan cycle, requesting 8,000 lempiras of the total group loan. With this he will purchase fertilizers for his crops and achieve better production, thereby helping his children in their studies and to have a better life. 

The group is called “Gonzales A,” and it's composed of 3 members who live in the same community. They are dedicated to agriculture and are requesting a total of 16,000 lempiras to purchase manure and to sow coffee, corn, and beans.

In the photo, Olbin is on the left, Carlos in the center, and German on the right, wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: buy fertilizers for cultivating coffee, corn, and beans.

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, es un hombre con deseos de trabajar y muy emprendedor, actualmente pasa un tiempo con su papá y otro momento con su madre. José tiene un hijo de tan solo 4 meses de edad que actualmente por situaciones económicas no puede tenerlo cerca de él, aunque lo ve todos los días.

José es un hombre con deseos de trabajar, él le ayuda a vender a su madre en una pequeña tienda que posee. Mucho tiempo atrás José tenia una tienda, luego de trasladarse de lugar decidió quitarla, hoy quiere poner de nuevo a funcionar ese negocio.

El crédito que él está solicitando, lo necesita para surtir la tienda de su madre, comprará productos para vender como: azúcar, sal, golosinas, bebidas, etc. De esa forma podrá ayudar a su niño con la alimentación y el estudio.
 Su sueño es sacae adelante a su hijo y que sea una persona de bien.
texts.en:
José, 37, is enterprising and hard-working.  He lives with his father part of the time and with his mother other times.  He has a 4-month old son who doesn't live with him because he doesn't have a place of his own, but he sees the boy every day.

José wants to work and he helps his mother with her small corner shop.  He had a store of his own years ago but closed it when he moved.  He now wants to start a similar business.

José is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his mother's store.  He will buy sugar, salt, snacks, drinks and other products.  The investment will allow him to support his little son.

For the future, José hopes his son will be a good person and have a chance to get on in the world.

loans.use: to stock his mother's general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood to sell

loans.name: Juana Patricia

texts.es: Juana tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17 años, 11 años y 20 años de edad. Juana es una mujer trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo junto a su compañero de vida van sacando adelante a sus hijos. Ella se dedica a la prestación  de servicios domésticos desde hace 12 años. Juana ha tomado la de decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir un pozo de absorción para tratamiento de aguas grises. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, grava, hierro y ladrillo.
texts.en: Juana is 38 years old and lives in her own house along with her husband and their three children who are 17, 11 and 20 years old. Juana is a hard working woman who, with much effort and along with her spouse is getting her children ahead. She has been dedicated to lending her domestic services for 12 years. Juana has decided to request this loan from FUSAI since she wishes to build an absorption well for greywater treatment. With the amount requested, she will buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, iron and brick to build an absorption well.

loans.name: Nermin

texts.en:
Nermin wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which she used to purchase materials for her handicraft business. With the materials she was able to maintain her business and increase the products she was able to sell to her clients and generate more income. 

She really enjoys her work and loves that she is able to earn an income from this type of work. Now she is requesting another loan for her handicraft business so that she can again purchase additional and different materials. Her goal is to continue to expand her business in the future and once again she promises to pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To purchase additional and different materials for her handicraft business

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
María de 40 años de edad, solo estudio quinto grado, está acompañada y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 viven con ella y solo dos estudian, su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura ya que fue el oficio que heredo de su padre siembra sandia y maíz,  también cuida de sus animales que dice son también para él una fuente de ingresos y una ocupación para sus hijos.

Necesita el dinero para comprar abono, pesticidas, foliares y pagar el alquiler de la tierra. Le gustaría que sus hijos estudien, pero sobre todo que aprendan a trabajar y sean personas responsables con sus familiares y demás compromisos.
texts.en:
María, 40 years old, only studied to fifth grade. She is in a relationship and has four children, 3 of which live with her and only 2 study. Her life partner works in agriculture because that was the profession he inherited from his father. He plants watermelon and corn. He also takes care of the animals which he says are also a source of income for him and an occupation for the children.

She needs the money to buy fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the rent on the land. She would like her children to study, but above all she wants them to learn to work and be responsible people with their family and other commitments.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides and to pay the rent on the land.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesús

texts.es: Nelson de 36 años de edad, estudio poco, no dice cuántos años pero toda su vida se ha dedicado  a trabajar, en el 2000 viajo a estados unidos para  construir su casa y ahora vive junto a su esposa e hija, la cual es menor de edad y tiene dos molinos de nixtamal, los  cuales le general los ingresos diarios para su familia; uno de ellos se dañó y por eso necesita el dinero para pagar la reparación ya que aprendió de su padre quine desde hace 25 años tiene molino y sabe que es una buena fuente de ingreso, son diarios además agrego que en otros empleos tiene que esperar mucho para ver su dinero. Le gustaría que su hija estudiara pero más le gustaría tenerla cerca de él siempre, ya que dice no soportaría que se fuera de su lado.
texts.en: Nelson, 36, doesn't know exactly when he left school, but he knows he didn't get far and that he's had to work most of his life instead.  He went to the United States in 2000 to earn enough money to build a house.  He now lives with his wife and young daughter.  He has a business milling maize to make nixtamal, the dough that is commonly used for making tortillas.  The business is his main source of income, but one of the milling machines is damaged and he is applying for a loan to repair it.  The business can be frustrating at times because he often has to wait to be paid.  For the future, Nelson hopes that his daughter will finish school.  He adds, though, that he'd like her to be always near because she's very dear to him.

loans.use: to pay for equipment repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and Maggi cubes (bouillon cubes) to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothes

loans.name: Pedro Audilio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 24 años de edad, es un joven muy dedicado al trabajo agrícola y muy responsable, lastimosamente solo estudió hasta tercer grado y no continuó por falta de recursos económicos. Actualmente vive con su compañera de vida quien se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Pedro siembra maíz, frijol y maicillo desde pequeño cuando su padre lo llevaba a la milpa, hoy en día también quiere criar pollos criollos y unos cerdos pues ha  visto que no es suficiente para los gastos solo producir granos básicos, y por eso está viendo otras alternativas para obtener ingresos y que no le falte nada a su familia.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar 3 sacos de abono, 2 sacos de sulfato de amonio, una caneca de herbicida, grano certificado e insecticidas para la siembra que ya pronto se acerca.

Él sueña con que su familia esté unida y que no leas falte la alimentación.
texts.en:
Pedro, just 24 years old, is a very responsible young man who is very dedicated to agricultural work. Sadly, he only studied to the 3rd grade; he couldn't continue for lack of economic resources. At present, Pedro lives with his life partner who is dedicated to domestic chores.

Pedro has sown corn, beans, and sorghum since he was very young, when his father used to take him to the fields. Today, he also wishes to raise creole chickens and some pigs, because he has seen that just producing basic grains is insufficient to cover his expenses. For this reason, Pedro is looking at other alternatives for obtaining income. He doesn't want his family to lack anything.

Pedro needs the solicited loan to purchase 3 sacks of manure, 2 sacks of sulfate of ammonium, a container of herbicide, insecticides, and certified grain for the planting which is very nearly at hand.

His family is united around their dream that they should never lack food to eat.

loans.use: buy 3 sacks of manure, 2 sacks of sulfate of ammonium, a container of herbicide, insecticides, and certified grain for planting.

loans.name: Maida Ester

texts.es: Maida de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia cerca de una zona muy transitada desde hace 5  años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida, Maida desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima para variar su menú como: frijoles, carnes, arroz, pollos, verduras, etc. todo por mayor y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su hijo lo necesario sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Maida, who is 52 years old, lives in her own house with her family group. She is a woman who is hard-working and responsible so that her family doesn't lack what is necessary for subsistence. Now she has been working for five years selling food near her home, close to a zone with a lot of traffic. She has a lot of regular customers, since she provides a plate of food at a very good price. Maida wants to enlarge her stall, that is, to buy tables and chairs and more basic ingredients to vary her menu, such as beans, meats, rice, chicken, vegetables, etc. She will buy everything wholesale and will have a little more income, but she doesn't have enough income to make this investment. This is why she is applying for a loan to buy the items listed and thus obtain better earnings to give her son what is needed without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy beans, meat, rice, chicken, vegetables, etc. wholesale

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María de 43 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar debido al nivel de pobreza que había a nivel familiar y la distancia en que estaba la escuela.  Hace 20 años se acompañó y tiene un hijo mayor, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, cuida a un joven que quedó huérfano y además es incapacitado todo el tiempo ha tenido que depender de la agricultura su compañero de vida tiene que caminar más de 3 kilómetro para llegar a su trabajo. 

Ella necesita el dinero para comprar abono y para pagar el alquiler de las tierra, ya que la mano de obra la pone su esposo y su hijo, a ella le gustaría que su hijo tenga otro tipo de empleo aunque se siente muy orgullosa de sus cultivos y se siente agradecida con el apoyo de la institución que le lleva solución a su problema económico.
texts.en:
María, 43 years old, did not have the opportunity to study due to the level of poverty that existed for her family and the distance to the school. She has been in a relationship for 20 years and has an older son. Her partner works in agriculture. She takes care of a young boy who became orphaned and is also disabled. She has always had to depend on agriculture. Her life partner has to walk more than 3 kilometers to get to work.

She needs the money to purchase fertilizer and to pay the rent on the land, since the labor is done by her husband and her son. Although she feels very proud of their crops, she would like for her son to have a different type of work. She feels grateful for the support of the institution that brings her a solution to her financial problem.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the rent on the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Bonnie peppers, fish, spare ribs, rice, charcoal, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa. El posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que el realiza es excelente y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles; él es un hombre muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesto, Juan  está solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y así el  podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. He has a sewing workshop in his home where he makes different kinds of clothing. Recently he has made a lot of clients because his work is of excellent quality and he sells them at affordable prices. He is a responsible and honest man who is very dedicated to his work.

Juan is requesting a loan to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and everything related to sewing. He can then continue to fulfill the needs of his clients and can enjoy a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric, tread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari to expand her business.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es:
Victorino de 48 años de edad, es un hombre muy dedicado al trabajo agrícola y muy responsable, lastimosamente solo estudio hasta 4° grado y no siguió por falta de recursos económicos. Actualmente vive con su esposa su padre y sus 2 hijos de 5 y 8 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos , sus hijos le ayudan a producir los granos básicos maíz, frijol, maicillo y caña de azúcar.

Victorino se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde que tenia 12 años de edad, cuando su padre lo llevaba a la milpa para enseñarle el trabajo. Ademas hoy en día quiere producir caña de azúcar, para producir el famoso atado de dulce, que puede sustituir a la azúcar procesada.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar 2 sacos de abono, 2 sacos de sulfato de amonio, una caneca de herbicida, grano certificado e insecticidas para la siembra que ya pronto se acerca.

Victorino quiere seguir produciendo granos básicos, y poco a poco ir diversificando su producción.
texts.en:
Victorino is 48 years old. He is a man very dedicated to agricultural work and is very responsible. Unfortunately, he finished only fourth grade and did not continue due to a lack of economic resources. Currently, he lives with his wife, his father and his two children who are 5 and 8 years old. His wife is dedicated to domestic work. His children help him produce basic grains like maize, beans, sorghum, and sugar cane.

Victorino has been dedicated to planting maize, beans and sorghum since he was 12 years old when his father took him to the field to teach him the work. Additionally, today, he wants to produce sugar cane in order to produce the famous sweet that can be substituted for processed sugar.

He needs the loan to buy two bags of fertilizer, two bags of ammonium sulfate, a bucket of herbicide, certified grain and insecticides for the approaching harvest.

Victorino wishes to keep producing basic grains and gradually diversify his production.

loans.use: to buy two bags of fertilizer, two bags of ammonium sulfate, a bucket of herbicide, certified grain and insecticides for his planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean 600 young cacao trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for resale.

loans.name: Francisca De Jesus

texts.es: Francisca de 60 años de edad vive sola en casa propia. Ella posee una tortillería en su residencia, ya tiene muchos años con el negocio y se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues tiene un excelente servicio, es muy amable con las personas que la visitan siempre tiene una sonrisa en el rostro para ellos, además tiene gran agilidad para la elaboración de las mismas y atiende a los clientes en poco tiempo. Francisca  le solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor para seguir produciendo mas tortillas. Ella tiene la esperanza que de esta forma tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Francisca is 60 years old and lives alone in her own house. She makes and sells tortillas in her home and has been doing this for many years. She has a lots of clients as she gives excellent service and is very friendly with the people who visit her. She always has a smile on her face for them. She also makes tortillas very well and attends to the clients rapidly.

Francisca is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to purchase corn wholesale so she can continue to make her tortillas. In this way she hopes to enjoy a higher quality of living.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Victoriano, age 40, is a cacao farmer of the beautiful village of San Jose. He together with his wife Secundina, raised their four children. His wife spends most of her time sewing and doing crafts. She also loves to harvest cacao when it is ripe and to clean the farm when that is required.

Victoriano got inspired in doing cacao farm with the assistance given and shown by other farmers. As a farmer he faces challenges with cleaning. He presently holds an outside employment that gives him limited time to properly manage his cacao farm. He also cultivates different types of cash crops such as corn, beans and rice.   

Victoriano is requesting the loan to hire workers to assist him in cleaning his cacao trees, as it’s now time for harvesting corn. With his employment elsewhere his time is limited.

His future goal is one day to focus mainly on farming, and expand much on cacao as a permanent crop, and also educate his four children to a level where they could help themselves.

loans.use: to clean his 400 mature cacao trees.

loans.name: Marina Estela

texts.es: Marina de 50 años de edad vive con sus tres  hijos y su esposo en casa propia, ella tiene un puesto de comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Es una mujer luchadora que su empeño es dar lo mejor de si misma, para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario para la subsistencia. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. La cliente desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, mas materia prima arroz, pollos, carne, frijoles, fruta, verduras, etc. para variar su menú y tener un poco de mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Marina is 50 years old, and lives with her three children and her husband in a house that they own.  She has a food stand close to their home, which she has run for many years.  With the earnings from her sales, she is able to cover her household expenses.  She is a fighter whose goal is to give her best so that her family does not lack anything.  She is satisfied that she has regular customers given that she is located in a well-trafficked area.  

The client wishes to expand her food stand by purchasing tables, chairs, and more raw materials (rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.) to vary the menu and increase her earnings.  However, she does not have the necessary funds to make this investment, which is why she approached INTEGRAL to request this loan to be able to purchase said items, and in so doing, improve her earnings so that she can bring more stability to her finances.

loans.use: purchase rice, chickens, meat, beans, fruit, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Chrispo

texts.en:
Chrispo is living with his wife and their five children in Nairobi's expansive Mukuru informal settlements. He has lived in the area for thirty years, and has seen many outbreaks of sanitation related illnesses. The effects of these outbreaks challenged him to look for alternative sanitation facilities in his area. 

Chrispo recently saw a Fresh Life Toilet and was impressed by the impact it brought where it was set up. He wishes to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets so that he can replicate the effects of good sanitation in his neighborhood. He however, needs to raise funds to facilitate the purchase of the toilets. He hopes that the income raised from running the franchise will help him repay his loan and provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase and run two Fresh Life Toilets.

loans.name: José David

texts.es:
José tiene 35 años de edad, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica los oficios domésticos y al comercio, tiene 2 hijos los cuales uno de ellos esta en la escuela, y el mas pequeño permanece en casa con su madre, por lo tanto ellos son las únicas personas que dependen de José.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre con la intención de que aprendiera este oficio para cuando él tuviera su hogar le sirviera de mucho,  es asi que desde entonces José ha trabajado en la agricultura pero, además trabaja con una persona que tiene un camión y lleva tierra a un lugar donde  hacen tejas, de esta manera tiene otra fuente de ingresos, y el trabajo de la agricultura le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos y viaja a pie.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita  para el alquiler de la tierra donde el cultiva el maíz, ya que ha decidido preparar dos hectáreas de tierra, el año pasado solo cultivó una hectárea y le dio mucha.

Sus sueños son que Dios le preste vida para seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa, darle a su esposa un buen futuro y darle el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old. He is married and his wife does the domestic work and does business. He has two children. One goes to school and the youngest one stays at home with his mother. They are the only people dependent on José.

José has been a farmer since he was 12 years old. He was taught this by his father so that he would have work to support his family. So José works in agriculture. He also works with a person who owns a truck transporting dirt to a place where they make tiles. So he has an extra source of income. The place that he farms is a 15 minute walk from his house.

José needs a loan to pay for the land on which he grows corn. He has decided to prepare two hectares of land. Last year he cultivated one hectare and he got a good harvest. His dream is for God to grant him time to continue cultivating the land to support his family, providing his wife with a good future and education for his children.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the land where he grows corn.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María Angélica tiene 55 años de edad, vive en el Caserío Laynas, una zona rural del distrito de la Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de Chicha de Jora, una bebida que tradicional de la costa del Per que se elabora en base al maíz, cuenta con clientela en la zona, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de maíz amarillo para la preparación de sus productos y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María Angélica is 55 years old.  She lives in the village of Laynas, a rural area in the Matanza district.  It is a place where the people are devoted to agriculture, livestock and trade.  The town has basic services like water and electricity.  It is located in the province of Morropon which belongs to the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

She works preparing and selling Chicha de Jora, a traditional drink of Peru's coast that is base from corn.  She has a customer base in the region.  Her business is located in her home.  She has requested a loan of 800 nuevos soles to purchase yellow corn to prepare her products.  This way, she will increase her earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase yellow corn to prepare her products.

loans.name: Lucia De Jesus

texts.es: Flor de 30 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Flor es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Flor is 30 years old, and lives in a house that she owns with her spouse.  She is known for being an honest, hardworking, and above all else, an enterprising woman.  Many years ago, she was able to open a small store in her home.  Thanks to God, her hard work and her dedication, her business is very well-known in the area, and she has many customers.  For Flor, it is very important to keep her business active as it is her primary source of income.  

For this reason, she has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to purchase merchandise for her store such as eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, sweet bread, and other items that will be attractive to her customers.  This way, she hopes to reach her dreams of keeping her business active and continuing to work for a better future.

loans.use: purchase eggs, candy, sugar rice, milk, beans, sweet bread and other products.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela tiene 52 años de edad, vive en el Distrito de Morropon, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras, limón ácido en el exterior del Mercado, de su distrito, cuenta con clientela conocida en la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 300 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de verduras para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mariela is 52 years old, and lives in the district of Morropon.  It is a place whose citizens work in agriculture, livestock and commerce.  It has basic services such as water and electricity.  It is located in the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura region on Peru's northern coast.

She works selling vegetables and sour lemons outside of the market in her district.  She has regular customers in the region.  She has requested a loan of 1300 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to purchase a large amount of vegetables to sell to her customers, which will allow her to increase her earnings for her family.

loans.use: purchase a large amount go vegetables to offer her customers.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.es:
Cleofe tiene 46 años de edad, vive con esposo, sin hijo a su cargo en casa propia, en el distrito Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la Agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral desde hace 6 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de útiles escolares para sus hijos y de esta manera poder enviarlos al colegio con sus útiles completos.
texts.en:
Cleofe is 46 years old, lives with her husband, without any young children to care for, and she lives in her own home located in the district of Oyotún. This community is dedicated to agriculture, business, and livestock and is located in the province of Chiclayo, in the region Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. 
She has worked for the past 6 years raising and selling animals. She works out of her home and is asking for a loan of $375 to purchase school supplies for her children and to be able to send them to secondary school with all the necessary supplies.

loans.use: purchase school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to hire workers to clean his two acres of cacao trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay to rent land where he will grow corn.

loans.name: Hermanos Dom Group

texts.es: Marcos, tiene 38 años de edad, esta soltero vive con sus padres y hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá.  Marcos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijol y papas. La mayor producción es de papas y la vende en la misma zona. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 7,000 lempiras en forma grupal para comprar semillas de papa nueva y abono para la siembra de papa. Su objetivo es darle buen mantenimiento y obtener más ganancias. El grupo se llama Hermanos Dom y lo integran 4 miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura, quienes solicitan un préstamo grupal por 25,500 lempiras para comprar semillas y abonos para el cultivo de papas. En la foto se identifican a la izquierda esta  Marcos, Gilberto, Jesús y Santos a la derecha.
texts.en:
Marcos is 38 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and siblings in the municipality of Intibucá. Marcos has always farmed, growing corn, beans and potatoes. His biggest crop is potatoes and he sells them in his area.

Marcos is requesting a loan of 7,000 HNL as part of a group, to buy new potato seed and fertilizer for his potato crop. His objective is to care for his plants and produce a good profit.

The group is called "Hermanos Dom" and has four members who live in the same community. They have requested a loan of 25,500 HNL to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow potatoes. In the photo from the left is Marcos, Gilberto, Jesús and Santos to the right.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio, age 52, is a certified organic farmer of MMC. He lives in the beautiful village of San Antonio. Together with his wife, they have raised their ten children. Presently all his children are getting some level of education. His wife enjoys spending her time attending to the children as well as harvesting cacao.
 
Antonio got inspired to plant cacao with assistance given from a local association. He presently manages his three acres of mature cacao trees, and is planning to expand into planting more cacao. He also cultivates other types of farm corps, such as corn and beans. Antonio holds outside employment, which gives him limited time to spend on the farm. With the help of his wife and harvesting and hiring workers to properly clean his farm, his farm is a success. He sees production this year, and it has given him more encouragement to expand.

Antonio is requesting this loan to hire workers to clean underbrush for planting more cacao tress. If cacao tree are not clean they don’t produce, he stated. Cleaning has played an important role in having the tree become productive and happily growing.

His future vision is to quit the other jobs and focusing mainly on the farm.

loans.use: To plant new seedlings and clean 1,000 cacao trees

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Esperanza” meaning “Hope” is composed of eight women who are quite supportive of each other. They work hard each day to improve their lives and for this reason, the ladies are requesting loans from Kiva investors. Their ultimate goal is to sustain and grow their small businesses, providing them with enough income to eliminate poverty in their lives and to move forward.

This Trust Bank has gradually grown and appreciates the monthly meetings with a Loan Officer from Friendship Bridge. During these meetings, the women not only make payments on their loans, but also participate in non-formal educational trainings on relevant subjects like health and nutrition, effective business practices and indebtedness, women’s and children’s rights, as well as self-esteem.

Because of these loans and the non-formal education trainings, women who are clients of Friendship Bridge can empower themselves and begin to move out of poverty. Manuela is an excellent example of someone who has planned wisely and used her loans successfully. She is the 35-year-old Secretary of the Trust Bank and is married with two sons. Manuela is the owner of a restaurant in the center of her town, Santa Clara La Laguna. She hopes to take out a new and higher loan because in the summertime, she has more clientele in her restaurant. She plans to buy indispensable items like firewood to cook on, rice, noodles, juices, soft drinks, and other necessary products. With the knowledge that she has gained during the monthly trainings during the non-formal educational sessions, the loans and her eight years of experience, Manuela and her family are enjoying a higher quality of life.

The “Esperanza” Trust Bank has high hopes of continuing to improve their lives and is most appreciative to each Kiva investor for funding their loans. The ladies are committed to using the funds wisely and repaying their loans on time. They face a brighter tomorrow as empowered women eliminating poverty. Thank you Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy indispensable items like firewood to cook on, rice, noodles, juices, soft drinks, and other necessary products.

loans.name: La Fuerza 1 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group La Fuerza (the force) 1, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). The group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Santa makes her home there in a simple rented structure with her husband and three children.

Santa is excited to be taking her 14th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling water and ice by purchasing a freezer to keep her wares cold. Also she will supply bags of ice and boxes of water to other businesses. Santa will use the profits to reinvest and to save. She wants to finish building her home and to give her family a better future. Because of this she is making this business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy a new freezer, purified water and ice to resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 20 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal en una finca, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el  necesita invertir por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. el cliente tiene buenas referencias  por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The borrower is 20 years old and lives with his family in the house they own.  He works growing corn and sorghum and also works as a day laborer on a farm. He has worked as a farmer for many years and this has given him a lot of experience which allows him to have the best harvests.  He sells his crops in the area around his community since he has many customers that prefer his quality, good prices, and good service.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, insecticides, and herbicides.  The borrower has good references from those who know him and he is very responsible.  He is sure that he can repay the loan on the established schedule.  He is sure that this will help bring financial security to his household.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, insecticides, and herbicides.

loans.name: Bud

texts.en:
Bud, 48 years old, lives with his wife and son in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He has been rendering taxi service to local people for more than four years and his wife works as a cook at a petroleum import company.  Their son attends high school.  

Bud is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy planks, nails, and paints to complete fence repairs.  Recently, a drunk driver crushed his fence and broke the planks in to pieces.  Stray dogs and cattle are now able to intrude and steal food, so it is necessary to repair the fence as soon as possible.  The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy planks, nails, and paints.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding her four children.  There are only a few people earning money and contributing to household expenses, as both of her sons do not work.

She has been saving money for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but mostly savings are spent on household expenses.  Now, she wants to buy a new auto rickshaw for one of these idle sons but she does not have enough cash for the purchase.  Therefore, Nabila has requested a loan for her son, so he can buy a new rickshaw with the savings contribution.  She hopes that her son will drive the auto rickshaw with full devotion and earn sufficient income.

Nabila is a 44-year-old woman, living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Nabila is very happy after receiving this loan; she thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Francisquenses Group

texts.en:
San Francisco El Alto is a town located in the southwestern highlands of Guatemala. It is renowned for the production of high quality textiles and also serves as the commercial hub of the entire region. The Friday market, possibly the biggest in Central America, is quite popular and traders from all corners of Guatemala come here, many arriving the night before with some starting to sell by candlelight before dawn. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Franciquenses”, meaning “people from San Francisco”, is located here and made up of ten women who range in age from 23 to 64 years. They all have a common goal, which is to improve not only their own lives, but those of their families. 

Andrea is a 28-year-old member of the Trust Bank. She has had six years of formal education. She is a hard-working mother of three sons who she describes as “her reason for living”. Her ultimate goal is to offer them a better future and she works arduously day-by-day to make this a reality. Andrea, like 80% of the women in her Trust Bank, invests her loan in the purchase of thread and cloth so that she can create pants, jackets, sweatshirts and sweatpants, as well as other articles of clothing. Her father and her sister also assist Andrea in her work, with the expectation that there will be increased clientele with increased inventory. Everyone in the family will beneﬁt.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Franciquenses”, thanks KIVA investors for providing them with the capital in the form of their loans. The ladies want to share that they will work hard to take advantage of this valuable opportunity to move ahead and improve their lives. They look forward to sharing their stories with KIVA investors in the future. Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase thread and cloth so that she can make clothes

loans.name: Lilian Rosa

texts.es: Lilian Rosa tiene 19 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es una joven soltera, que con mucho carisma, esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante y cumplir sus metas propuestas. Solicita el crédito para poder pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios y así lograr obtener su título. Su plan futuro es conseguir un empleo en donde pueda aplicar sus conocimientos adquiridos y desempeñarse como profesional.
texts.en:
Lilian Rosa is 19 years old and originally from the city of León.  She is single.  With a lot of charisma, effort, and dedication, she has been able to move forward and achieve her goals.  

She is requesting this loan to pay for her final modules of study so that she can earn her degree.  Her future plan is to get a job where she can apply the knowledge she has gained and become a professional.
