loans.use: to pay for her final modules of study so that she can obtain her degree.

loans.name: Bertha Elisabet

texts.es:
Bertha Elisabet tiene 32 años de edad tiene dos menores hijos, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa en el distrito de Nueva Arica, una comunidad tranquila, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, pavos, cerdos, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de los mismos y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bertha Elisabet is 32 years old and has two young children.  She lives in the house she owns with her spouse in the Nueva Arica district, a tranquil community located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.  

She works raising and selling animals such as ducks, roosters, hens, chickens, turkeys, and pigs.  Her business is located in the back part of her home.  She is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals so that she can have a good production to offer her customers.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed to fatten her animals.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe, age 63, is a certified organic cacao producer of MMC. He lives in the beautiful village of San Pedro, Columbia. This village is known for its famous Maya ruin called “Lubantun”; it accessible for both local and international visitors. Felipe, together with his wife Petrona, raised their 14 children. Presently he only has one son who is getting educated, and he wishes for him to continue and become professionally employed.

His wife enjoys spending her time at home, and when needed, she goes out to harvest cacao.

Felipe got motivated and start planting cacao as a hobby; he was born a farmer, he stated. He earns household income farming by producing different types of crops, such as beans, corn, and rice. Cacao farming has been one of the productive crops, he stated, but the recent market price went down, so he lost interest in cultivating and expanding more. 

With the assistance of MMC purchasing wet cacao (which means freshly harvested from the farm) to scale, he got inspired and motivated in the business. Aside from other farm crops, he presently manages his two acres of producing cacao trees. 

Felipe is requesting this loan to assist him in hiring workers to clean his mature cacao trees. Cleaning plays an important role for better production, he stated.

His future vision is to expand more on grafted cacao.

loans.use: To hire workers to properly clean his cacao trees

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en: Mr. Enkhtaivan, 39 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been making and selling Mongolian traditional boots to local people since 2004. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. Their two daughters are both educated at kindergarten. He is requesting a loan of 4 000 000 MNT to buy leather in large amounts from China so that he can continue to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage. If the business is successful, he can hire more people (currently he has 5 employees). The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy leather in large amounts.

loans.name: Sopheara

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of two from Kampong Cham province in Cambodia, Sopheara has been farming rice to support the daily food and school expenses of her children.  Sopheara has been in this business for more than ten years, and besides farming, she raises chickes and pigs for resale to earn additional income. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund and she used this loan to buy more land for rice farming.  She hopes to make more income so that she can purchase more animals such as cows.

loans.use: to buy more land to grow rice.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Vista Hermosa Group

texts.en:
The town of Momostenango is located in the eastern highlands of Guatemala. This is a cold area and well-known for the production of warm jackets, ponchos and blankets. Many of the town’s population are also engaged in animal husbandry.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Vista Hermosa”, meaning “Beautiful View”, is located in this area and has already completed two loan cycles with the organization. For this new loan cycle there are 10 women, and 4 are new members. Martina is one of these new members. She is 34 years of age and has requested a loan to increase her sale of delicious prepared food items, especially during the popular Easter week celebrations. She would like to purchase new kitchen utensils, pots and pans of various sizes, and pitchers for drinks. Martina travels to two nearby markets to sell her delicious foods.

Martina’s dream is to move ahead in her life and be able to meet the basic needs of her four children. Especially important to her is the education of her little ones, because Martina realizes that education is the key to a more prosperous future. At the monthly meetings of the Trust Bank, a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer offers the ladies educational training on relevant topics like effective business management and accounting, nutrition and health, as well as women’s rights and self-esteem. 

The 10 members of the Trust Bank look forward to progressing through this new loan cycle. They want to express their appreciation to KIVA investors for their generosity and compassion. They look forward to paying back their loans fully and on time. Armed with these small loans and education, they face a brighter future for themselves, their families and their town of Momostenango!

loans.use: To purchase new kitchen utensils, pots and pans of various sizes, and pitchers for use making her food.

loans.name: Nining

texts.en:
Nining runs a small stall where she sells mobile phone airtime credits. She lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Nining is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Nining began working with Ruma two months ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for many years. For many days now, his rickshaw has not been working properly because of regular use. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. So, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore, Nasreen has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Nasreen is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Vuthy is 19 years old. He is a student who lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

Now, he would like to apply for loan of USD 3,150 to pay for his tuition fee. This loan helps him to attend college since his parents have no ability to pay for his tuition fee. 

In the future, Vuthy hopes that he can become a good doctor.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fee.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a married woman, with one child who is not in school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

For the past five months, Mejumaa has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and price fluctuation as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Mejumaa wants to purchase for her business wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase for her business wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, bread, milk, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lann

texts.en:
Lann is a married mother of four children, one of whom is still in school. She is 41 years old and has been growing cassava with her husband for around 20 years. Rice farming is a secondary business for the family. 

This is Lann's first time borrowing money from VisionFund Cambodia. She will use the loan to buy one more plot of land, to grow cassava, to make more income.

loans.use: to buy land for cassava planting.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Asuncion Group

texts.en:
Juchanep is a rural community in the department of Totonicapán in the southwestern highlands of Guatemala. The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Asunción”, is located here. The Trust Bank consists of 14 women who are mostly indigenous. They wear traditional “traje”, which usually consists of a blouse called a “huipil”, a skirt called a “corte”, and a belt called a “faja”. These colorful items mostly are handmade, sometimes with the use of a simple backstrap loom, and then painstakingly embroidered with designs, symbols and stories that date back to antiquity. They identify the region that the wearer originates from.

The women of the Trust Bank are eager to begin their new loan cycle. The President of “Asuncion” is Feliciana, who is a 55-year-old widow. She has three children, and is committed to help them in every way possible. Feliciana employs three women and works in textile production. She specializes in “ikat”, which is the dyeing of patterns by means of binding threads or cotton yarn called “labores” that are then colored with brilliant dyes. This technique is called “jaspeado” in Guatemala, and each village has its own unique, beautiful designs. 

Feliciana is requesting a new loan which she will use to purchase a large quantity of thread and yarn as well as supplies to dye it with. This hard-working woman travels each week to deliver her orders, and usually delivers 50-60 bundles of thread (with 25 units in each bundle). She manages her money wisely and there is a good cash flow.

A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer visits the Trust Bank on a monthly basis. Besides making payments on their loans, the Loan Officer gives educational training on useful and relevant subjects like nutrition and health, effective business practices and indebtedness, as well as women’s rights and self-esteem. Other topics include hygiene and nutrition.

Kiva investors are greatly valued and appreciated by the women of the Trust Bank. The loans that the 14 ladies are requesting will be used in their businesses to increase their income and grow their businesses. In this way, they will be able to improve their quality of life and that of their families. It will also be useful for them to take advantage of future business opportunities by having funds available. 

Feliciana, along with her partners, are most grateful to those in KIVA who are helping them make their dreams come true. They are committed to repaying their loans promptly and completely. They face a brighter tomorrow, armed with their small loans and newly acquired knowledge. Thank you Kiva investors!

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of thread and yarn, as well as supplies to dye it.

loans.name: Sumaira's Group

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 32-year-old married woman, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She belongs to a poor family, her family passing their lives by hand-to-mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells ladies and gent’s clothing. He has been running this business for many years, and cherishes his whole family. This is his misfortune that he could not build up a good relationship among his customers, this is the reason he is unable to generate sufficient income for his family.
Now with the increase in needs, he considers it necessary to grow the business as well, but the lack of capital is the major problem for him.  
Therefore, Sumaira took a loan for her husband’s clothing business. With the help of this loan, he will purchase more clothing to sell. 
Sumaira thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Suryono

texts.en:
Suryono lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. He is married and living with two people in the family home. 

Suryono began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children. 
Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. He is a cobbler and an expert in his profession. He has been manufacturing shoes for many years. This is the reason he has lot experience in his profession. He sews leather and rexine shoes through machines, after that, attaches its sole through stitching by his hands. In this way he is getting income for his family. He has been making shoes at home, now he established a shop to continue his business on a wide level. He does not have the cash in hand to buy initial raw materials for making shoes.
Therefore, Shamim requested a loan for her husband so he can buy initial raw materials for making shoes.
She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Ikhsan

texts.en:
Ikhsan runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He has been running this stall for one year.  Ikhsan lives in Garut, a semi-urban area about four hours from Jakarta. Ikhsan is single.

To increase the family income, Ikhsan also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Ikhsan is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers. This is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income. To provide this new service, Ikhsan is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Estrellas Celestes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS CELESTES” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Karolina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de sacos y chalecos, venta de pantalones, venta de comida, tejido de macramé, confección de cortinas, servicio de publicidad, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Karolina es integrante, ella indica que es el tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que era socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de macramé; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace trece años por iniciativa propia, ya que ella conocía la técnica de tejido y la utilizó como estrategia de negocio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana por mayor) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y capacitación que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The Estrella Celestes communal bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani regional center.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Karolina is the president.  The business activities that the members engage in are varied and include making jackets and vests, selling pants, selling food, weaving macramé, making curtains, public service, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they will take out will benefit small business people where Karolina is a member.  She states that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for three years.  She joined by invitation from a friend who was a member of the institution.  She currently has a business of woven macramé.  She says that she started this business 13 years ago on her own initiative.  She knew the technique for weaving, and she used it as a business strategy.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wool wholesale).  She will get it from the distributors in the city of El Alto.  After making items, she will sell them at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is in a common-law marriage and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the health services and the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wool wholesale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
This is Mwaka. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to purchase food ingredients for her food-preparation business.  
She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs . 
She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of food ingredients for her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is married, with three school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Umazi has operated a clothes-selling business for the past five years. She sells in a shop to her town-dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the loan, Umazi wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mufino

texts.en:
Mufino runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He has been running this stall for one year. Mufino lives in Indramayu, a semi-urban area about six hours from Jakarta. Mufino is single.

To increase the family income, Mufino also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Mufino is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers. This is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income. To provide this new service, Mufino is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 25 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones. Actualmente vive con sus padres y un hermano, el cliente se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y maicillo. El cliente  desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
The client, age 25, is a man who is very responsible with his obligations.  He currently lives with his parents and a brother.  The client is a farmer, and every year he grows the main basic grains of the area like corn and sorghum.  

The client wishes to increase his sales.  That is why he visited the Integral offices to request a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, among others.  He wishes to have the requested help because he does not have other monetary income.  This way he will continue bringing home the daily bread without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, and pesticides, among others.

loans.name: Kelegna Group

texts.fr:
BENSO est un groupe de l’association KELEGNA (WAHABIAKING) de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 26 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne deux enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales à l’image de ADA  qui est la seule personne assise de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles au quartier  WAHABIAKING de Ouelessebougou, dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de céréale : mil, maïs et riz. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a trois ans. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. 
ADA, excelle dans la vente de céréale. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs de maïs.  Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnant et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend son article à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de céréales.
texts.en: Benso is a group from the Kelegna association (Wahabiaking) de Ouelessebougou. The group brings together women who know one another through parentage and neighborly ties. They are 26 years old on average. Married with an average of two children, they run different businesses, such as the buying and selling of grains, as Ada, who is the only one seated in the photo, does. They live in large traditional families in the Wahabiaking neighborhood of Ouelessebougou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). They have been in small business for several years and are very sought after in their business of buying and selling grains, including millet, corn and rice. In order to meet the growing needs of their clientele, the members of the group decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program three years ago. They are on their fourth group loan. Ada excels in the sale of grains. She expects to use her loan to purchase 5 bags of corn. She stocks up in surrounding villages and locally from wholesalers, and sells her items in Ouelessebougou at retail for cash and for credit to a clientele composed of men and women. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA, a sum which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her grain-selling business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She has been in her business for years now and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for a loan to buy mobile chargers and extensions for her business.

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase power extensions and mobile chargers.

loans.name: Francy Yuliana

texts.es:
Ella es Francy Yuliana Nacida el 29 de noviembre, ella es una joven con muchas aspiraciones y muchas metas por cumplir, ella cuenta que una de las primeras metas cumplidas  fue haber terminado el bachiller en el año 2011, luego de haber obtenido este título  quiso entrar a hacer un básico en primeros auxilios en el año 2012, luego que termino ese curso, ella quiso hacer un técnico  como auxiliar de enfermería, actualmente se encuentra estudiando y ya va a entrar a tercer semestre, la joven dice que después de culminar el técnico quiere entrar a una universidad a estudiar enfermería superior, por que a ella le gusta todo lo relacionado con la salud. 
 
Le Gustaba ayudar a gente que lo necesite, Por qué  quiere estar  bien en un futuro  económica mente, esta joven no solo piensa en un futuro para ella por que También quiere  que los padres estén lo más mejor posible  y que ella pueda Ayudarles en lo que ellos mas necesiten. 
Todo lo que ha sido planeado por ella quiere que en un futuro se refleje y que sea un motivo para salir adelante, es por eso que ella se ve interesada en tener el convenio de kiva ya que seria una ayuda económica para ella, poder ahorrar una parte de dinero para que con eso le pueda ayudar a los padres para poder pagar otros gastos que ella o los papas tengan.
texts.en:
Francy Yuliana was born on 29th November, and is a young woman with many aspirations and goals to accomplish. She says that one of the first goals she achieved was getting her high school diploma in 2011. Having obtained this, she wanted to start a basic course in first aid in 2012. After finishing that course, she wanted to do a technical course as an auxiliary nurse. She is studying this at the moment and is about to start her third term. The young woman says that after completing this technical course, she wants to go to university to study a higher degree in nursing, as she enjoys everything related to health.

She enjoys helping people in need. This is why she wants to achieve economical stability in the future, not only for herself, but also for her parents, so they can be as comfortable as possible and so she can help them with the things they need most.

She wants to achieve all her plans for the future and to get on. This is why she wants to get the Kiva loan, which would be a help to her economically. She could save part of the money to help her parents and to cover other costs they might have.

loans.use: to pay for a term's tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to care for her second season of crops.

loans.name: Gehobanis Antonio

texts.es:
Gehobanis tiene 33 años de edad, solo estudió hasta tercer grado de nivel académico, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico, tiene 3 hijos y solo uno estudia, por lo tanto su hijo y su pareja son los únicos que dependen de él.

Gehobanis se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, este trabajo lo aprendió de un tío suyo, por las tardes se dedica a la venta de pan, él anda en una motocicleta vendiendo pan por los cantones aledaños, su hermano es quien le ayuda en la venta.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita  para  comprar tres novillas, se las venden muy cómodas y quiere aprovechar esa oportunidad de comprarlas, esto le ayudará mucho ya que en un futuro podrás sacar ganancias.

Sus sueños son seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén del hogar, poder tener su propia panadería y así poco a poco ir adquiriendo sus propios negocios.
texts.en:
Gehobanis is 33 years old, only studied until the third grade, and lives with a partner who does household work. He has 3 children. One of them studies, therefore his partner and this son are his only dependents.

Gehobanis has worked in farming since he was 12 years old. He learned how to farm from an uncle. In the afternoons he sells bread by riding his motorcycle and selling bread in neighboring areas. His brother helps him sell.

He needs the requested loan to buy three heifers. They are being sold at a very reasonable price, and he would like to take this opportunity to buy them. This would help him greatly by increasing his future income.

His dreams are to continue farming, support his household, to have his own bakery, and as such begin acquiring his own businesses little by little.

loans.use: to buy three heifers

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en: Tatu is a married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.  For the past ten years, she has operated a food stall business, preparing various foods such as rice, flat bread, and beans, and sells to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge.  With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and charcoal for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.  She has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years, operating at the market where there are passersby and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  With the loan she is requesting, she wants to buy hair braids, shampoo, weaves, and conditioners for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair braids, shampoo, weaves and conditioners for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase onions, cooking oil ,and Maggi to expand her business.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad, aged 49, is a responsible mother and living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap goods such as iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste papers, etc. He has been purchasing scrap goods from the common people and sells them to the recycling factories. Nowadays, due to an increase in household expenses, he does not have enough cash on hand to buy scrap goods and does not have a stock of scrap to sell to generate income.

Therefore, Irshad has requested a loan for her husband, so he can buy scrap goods, establish his enterprise, and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.

She is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take more loans after the payment of this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy scrap goods for reselling.

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. He has been running this stall for one year. Sandy lives in Indramayu, a semi-urban area about six hours from Jakarta. Sandy is married.

To increase the family income, Sandy also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Sandy is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers. This is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income. To provide this new service, Sandy is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clean his 900 mature cacao trees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more women's clothes and resell them

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clean his 750 cacao trees

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 31-year-old married woman, and she has five children. She is living in a populated area. Her husband is a market vendor and sells seasonal vegetables in a central bazaar. He knows his customers' needs and he has reliable providers. He purchases vegetables from wholesalers and sells to the cooperative stores.

He chose this business because it is profitable and brings a stable income. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis so that he could maximize his sales and could get maximum reward for his efforts. But insufficient cash on hand is a major problem for him.

Therefore, Shakeela has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy additional vegetables to supply to the retailers. In this way he would be able to generate additional income for his family and could cherish his children in well manners.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is 63 years old and married. She runs a falafel restaurant, which she has been doing since 1995. Falafel, known in some foreign regions as a vegetarian burger, is a deep-fried ball made from ground chickpeas and fava beans. It is a traditional Middle Eastern food, usually served wrapped in flat bread. Falafel balls are topped with salads, pickled vegetables, and hot sauce, and drizzled with tahini-based sauces; they may also be eaten alone as a snack or served as an appetizer.

To improve her business, Najah requested her first loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use for necessary maintenance and development of her restaurant, in addition to renewing its required tools to keep her business up to date. She is looking forward to her business development.

loans.use: to make necessary maintenance and development for her restaurant, in addition to renewing its required tools to keep her business up to date

loans.name: Usep

texts.en:
Usep lives in West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about 3 hours from Jakarta.  Usep is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Usep began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Cici

texts.en:
Cici runs a small stall which sells mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Cici lives in West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Cici is married and living with three people in the family home. Seen in the picture: Cici with one of the RUMA agents.

Cici began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To clean her cacao trees and transplant new seedlings

loans.name: Kousar's Group

texts.en:
Kousar is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. She runs a small boutique at home; she sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from the market at a low price, sews it, and then sells it for a higher price in her community. The ladies of the town like her garment collection and selection a lot. The demand for her clothing is due to the attractive designs and colors she uses.
 
She wants to increase the variety of clothing she has available on a daily basis. She has requested a loan so that she can buy a greater variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Kousar wishes for the bright future of her children, and her dream is to provide a better education for her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Note: Kousar is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en: Zainabu is thankful for the help she got from Kiva and she appreciates the support.  Today again, she comes to you requesting another loan of KES 20,000 to buy fresh fish and cooking oil for frying them, so that she can sell and get income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and cooking oil for frying them

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale and groundnuts for peanut butter

loans.name: Tri

texts.en:
Tri runs a small stall which sells groceries and mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Tri lives in the West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Tri is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Tri began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Martono

texts.en:
Martono runs a small stall which sells snacks, groceries, mobile accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. Martono lives in the West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Martono is single. 

Martono began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Deni

texts.en:
Deni runs a small stall as a tailor and sells mobile phone airtime credits. Deni lives in the West of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Deni is married and lives with three people in the family house. Seen in the picture:  Deni with his wife and son. 

Deni began working with Ruma one month ago because he want to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 32-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She wants to provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible without a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have enough money to fix the problems of the rickshaw's body. Therefore, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband can buy the moto rickshaw body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to provide better living standards to her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy a body for a moto rickshaw

loans.name: Sroeun's Group

texts.en: Sroeun is 46 years old and married with four children; two of whom are still in school. The family lives in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. Their primary income is from rice farming. Growing vegetables and raising pigs is their secondary business. This is Sroeun's fourth loan with VisionFund and she is now leading a group of two female members including herself. Sroeun used her portion to buy cows for raising to make extra income, as she hopes to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy cows for raising.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Saima's Group

texts.en:
Saima is a 31-year-old married woman. She is living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She does embroidery work by hand at home to financially support her family.

She belongs to a poor family. Her husband’s income is very poor so she decided to start embroidery work at home. She had been learning these arts in her childhood; now she adopted it as an occupation.

She enabled herself to be independent and earn sufficient income. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase thread, silk, fancy, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. Saima is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili operates a food stall business and sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. 

She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation, but she dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruit for the business. 

She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business. She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions, and fruit.

loans.name: Seangheng's Group

texts.en:
Seangheng is a resident from Koh Sotin district, Kampong Cham province. She lives in a wooden house with her husband and three children. All of the children are still in school. 

The couple has been farming rice and growing corn and sesame to support the family for around 20 years. 

Introduced by a loan officer, Seangheng formed a group of three female members to apply for loans from VisionFund. She needs the money to buy fertilizers and rice seeds and also to pay for labor fees. 

She hopes to expand her business so she can make more money for the family to live better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds and to pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Abel De Jesús

texts.es:
Abel es un joven de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato y se acompañó recientemente, su pareja se dedica al trabajo doméstico y cuida unas niñas en una casa del municipio, aún no tiene hijos y por lo tanto solo su compañera de vida depende de él.

Abel     se dedica a la agricultura desde hace tres  años, este trabajo se lo enseñó su padre que decidió enseñarle este trabajo  ya que hoy en día es un poco difícil conseguir trabajo entonces, el lugar donde realiza sus trabajos agrícolas le queda a una distancia de 15 minutos y viaja a pie, trabaja en un horario de 6 a 10 de la mañana.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita  para el alquiler de la tierra donde el cultiva el maíz, ya que ha decidido preparar la tierra  con tiempo porque ahorita están alquilando en zonas que son muy buenas para el cultivo. El crédito le servirá de mucho ya que si paga antes le saldrá mas barato el alquiler.

Sus sueños son seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa, poder darle a su pareja un buen futuro y cuando tengan hijos poder darles lo mejor.
texts.en:
Abel is 24 years old, studied until high school and recently began living with his partner, who does housework and takes care of children in a house in town. He does not have children and therefore his only dependent is his partner.

Abel has been farming for three years. His father taught him this job since it can be difficult to find work these days. Abel walks 15 minutes to the site where he farms. He works from 6 to 10 in the morning.

He needs the requested loan to rent land to grow corn. He has decided to prepare the planting ahead of time, because right now they are renting in areas that are very good for farming. The loan will be a great help because if you pay early, the rent is cheaper.

His dreams are to continue farming, support his household, give his partner a good future, and when he has children, be able to give them the best.

loans.use: to pay rent for the land where he will farm corn

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es: Ana tiene 39 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 18 y 7 años de edad. Ana es una mujer trabajadora responsable y con muchos sueños de seguir adelante. Ella se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Ana solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de una fosa de absorción para las aguas negras para lo cual necesita materiales como: arena, cemento, grava, hierro y piedra.  Espera poder contar con este financiamiento  y así poder proceder lo antes posible a la construcción.
texts.en:
Ana, 39, lives in her own house with her husband and her two children, ages 18 and 7.  Ana's a hardworking and responsible woman who dreams of getting ahead.  She has earned a living providing domestic services for a long time.

Ana's asking FUSAI for this loan to build an absorption pit for wastewater, for which she needs materials such as sand, cement, gravel, rebar, and stones.

She hopes to get the loan so she can proceed with construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, gravel, rebar, and stones to build an absorption pit

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi operates a fish selling business. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business. With the 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase two sacks of fish for resale. 

She appreciates the support from Kiva and Yehu Microfinance Trust.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Meet Dina, a farmer living in the remote area of Nandi Hills, an area which is very fertile. She is married and has four children, all of whom are school age. She has been practicing farming for the past 15 years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and a variety of crops. In farming, she loves milking her dairy cows and the process of taking the milk to the collection centre. Her biggest challenge is lack of enough labourers to help her in picking tea.

Dina chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they will give her a loan for a water tank, where she can store water for her farmwork and her household needs. During the training she learned that the money lent to her will help improve her livelihood. Through this loan there will be a continuous supply of water to her farm. Growth will be evident, which will result in more income. Her family and her children will benefit from this income because they will go to school comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase a Kentank water tank.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Sakina is a 54-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of seven children, and equally responsible for all of them.  She belongs to a very poor family, and that is why she could not afford the educational expenses of all her children. Her son owns a blacksmith shop in which he manufactures iron accessories such as doors, windows, tables etc. He also provides door-to-door services to his customers. Due to the increase in the iron prices, he is unable to buy sufficient welding materials such as iron accessories, welding rods, soldering rods, etc. to carry on his business. To fulfill the demand of his customers and to run his enterprise efficiently, he needs some capital to buy the described materials.  Sakina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her son, so that he would be able to buy the kind of iron accessories, welding rods and soldering rods needed to carry on his business.

loans.use: to buy iron accessories, welding rods, and soldering rods for manufacturing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies to help protect and look after her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients including rice, potatoes, and sugar, as well as utensils

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née en 1981 à OUELESSEBOUGOU, FATOUMATA vit avec ses 4 enfants et son époux dans une  famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la préfecture de  KATI (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI). 
FATOUMATA n’a pas eu la chance de progresser à l’école, très vite elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat vente d’habillements.      
FATOUMATA est à son premier  prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso qui sera utilisé pour acheter une quantité importante des tissus et wax. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises au BURKINA FASO   et effectue ses ventes au comptant, à crédit et en détail, à domicile, dans les marchés et dans les foires  environnantes à une clientèle composés d’hommes et de femmes. 
FATOUMATA  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et réinvestir dans les activités d’achat vente d’habillements.
texts.en:
Born in 1981 in OUELESSEBOUGOU, FATOUMATA lives with her husband and four children as a nuclear family in N’TENTOU in the KATI district (Koulikoro county, Republic of Mali). FATOUMATA wasn't lucky enough to go to school, and she quickly became interested in income-generating activities - particularly the purchase and sale of articles of clothing. 
FATOUMATA is seeking her first personal loan through Soro Yiriwaso, which will be used to purchase a large quantity of cloth and wax. 
She buys her merchandise in Burkina Faso and makes her retail sales for cash and credit - door to door, in markets and local fairs - to a customer base of both men and women. FATOUMATA hopes to generate a monthly profit of 100,000 FCFA which will be used to help her husband meet the family's needs, to reimburse the loan, and to invest in the clothing trade business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Maclaren Group

texts.en:
Rehema's age is in her early thirties, and she is single. She has two boys and one girl who are in school. For twelve years now, Rehema has been managing a genge (grocery stall), selling fruits, vegetables, and charcoal. She starts working from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. per working day, and is able to make a fair monthly return. 

This is Rehema's 13th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, to restock more fruits, vegetables items, and sacks of charcoal. 

Her business has improved, and it made her monthly return raise. Rehema is thankful to everyone who has supported her family and business. She used the business profit to buy a plot of land, and covered school fees and family food expenses. 

Rehema will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal for her store. She dreams of building a family house to stay away from renting stress. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Maclaren, which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for her store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married mother and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She has operated an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia operated a fish-selling business. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Patricia dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Supriyanto

texts.en:

Supriyanto began working with Ruma one month ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Onn's Group

texts.en:
Onn is 64 years old and married with six children; three of whom are under her supports. The family has been farming rice for over forty years, and this is their primary source of income. 

During her spare time, Onn works for labor wage at a local construction company to earn additional income. This is Onn's second loan with VisionFund. Given her good repayment schedule in the previous loan, she was appointed to be a group leader for this loan. 

Onn will use her portion to spend on her farmland, such as to buy fertilizers and seeds, and pay for labor fees. She hopes to make higher profit so that she can expand her business by buying more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto tiene 42 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado de educación Básica, en este momento está casado, su esposa se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, uniformes Escolares y deportivos, por el momento solo tienen una hija quien todavía no asiste a la escuela.

Rigoberto tiene experiencia en la fabricación de uniformes de todo tipo, desde hace aproximadamente dieciocho años,  aunque antes vivía en la ciudad y por motivos de la delincuencia emigró hacia la comunidad rural  donde está trabajando  muy tranquilo sin problemas, Rigoberto  estudió dos años la costura con la visión de vivir de ella, y así fue como su esposa se ha involucrado de lleno con él, se ha convertido en una administradora más del taller, juntos trabajan más de ocho horas diarias con la ventaja que el taller lo tiene en la misma casa donde residen.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo invertirá para comprar telas, hilos, zíppers, necesita mucho del crédito ya que tiene que comenzar a elaborar gran cantidades de uniformes que le han encargado de las escuelas.

Su sueño es tener un local aparte donde pueda instalar el taller, poder emplear a más personas y abrir fuentes de ingresos. Pero la única forma de cumplir el sueño es obteniendo el préstamo de lo contrario no podrá hacer realidad su sueño.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 42 years old and completed up to ninth grade at school. He is married; his wife works making clothes and school and sports uniforms. The couple just has one daughter now and she is not old enough to go to school yet.

Rigoberto has experience making all types of uniforms. He has been doing this for around 18 years. He previously lived in the city but, because of the crime levels there, he moved to a rural community where he works in peace with no problems. Rigoberto studied tailoring for two years, with a view to making a living with this trade. Rigoberto's wife has also joined him in this work - she manages this workshop and together the couple works eight hours per day. One advantage of their work is that the workshop is in their home.

This loan from "CrediCampo" will be invested in materials, threads and zips. Rigoberto needs this loan a lot as he has to begin making a large quantity of uniforms ordered by schools.

Rigoberto's dream is to have his own premises for setting up his workshop, to employ other people, and to have other sources of income. The only way that he can achieve his dream, however, is with a loan. Without it, his dream will not become a reality.

loans.use: to buy materials, threads and zips for making clothes and uniforms.

loans.name: Yuhesti

texts.en:
Yuhesti runs a small stall which sells snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Yuhesti lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Yuhesti is married and living with five  people in the family home. 

Yuhesti began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a 40-year-old married woman representing herself by raising her hand. She is living with her three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband is a shoemaker by profession. He makes shoes by hand, and his handmade shoes are very famous in his hometown. Many manufacturers like to give him orders for making shoes and remain on a waiting list. 

Previously, he had been providing services only to his clients for shoemaking. Now that he has gotten a lot of market experience, he wants to buy materials for shoemaking so that he can earn better than in the past. 

Lubna wants to build her house, to provide a better education to her children, and to help establish her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for shoemaking.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en:
Ade runs a small stall which sells stationery and mobile phone airtime credits. Ade lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Ade is married and living with six people in the family home. 

Ade began working with Ruma one month ago because she wants to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is a 38-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past four years. She is very knowledgeable on the techniques of stitching. She sews garments from nearby factories and her husband brings cloths from the factory. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

To help her continue business operations, she has requested a loan to buy a sewing machine. Her previous sewing machine has become out-of-order due to continuous work. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenue to help with personal expenses. Salma thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hajra

texts.en:
Hajra is at the age of 40, living with her husband.

Her husband is a catering services provider for ceremonies. He provides the decoration lights and wedding tents for weddings, birthdays, and engagement ceremonies. He does not consider it a profitable business because this is a seasonal business. 

Now the marriage season is going to peak, but most of his tents have become clumsy due to the lack of usage for a long time. He wants to buy new wedding tents to provide better services to his customers.
 
Therefore, Hajra has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy new tents and decoration lights to provide the decoration services. 
Hajra thanks Kiva and it's field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tents and decoration lights for the catering services.

loans.name: Al Daly Group

texts.en:
Nadia is the featured borrower of Al Daly group. She got along with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends. They aim to develop and improve their beloved families' socioeconomic situations.

Nadia is a 45-year-old married mother of five children, who has been working as a hairdresser from her house for fourteen years now, to help her husband in increasing their income and covering their children's increasing needs.

Nadia has a very good reputation in her region, and she is well known for her special talents. Her income combined with her husbands' aren't enough to cover their family's needs, that's why she is working hard to find additional income that will provide her with a daily income. 

For this reason, she asked Al Majmoua's support through an acquired loan, which she will invest in starting a new daily income business that has to do with food. She will start selling fresh meat and chicken, and will work hard on developing this business properly, and making sure that she will keep her beauty business running too.

Nadia is the first lady from the left with a red top. As for the other group members, Fatima is the first from the left and Rodayna is the lady at the center.

loans.use: to start a new business, selling fresh meat and chicken.

loans.name: Zyad  Al- Soninais Group

texts.en:
Zyad Al-Sonina is a group consisting of four women, living in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 230,000 YER from AL-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Katiba is a 39-year-old married woman with six children. She is the leader of the group. Despite her miserable condition, she didn't surrender and decided to help her husband with family expenses. Katiba has started up her many-year business as a dressmaker. She earns a good amount of money, most of which goes to family expenses. She wants to improve her business, but doesn't have enough money. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more sewing materials.

Katiba looks forward to opening a special store for her business and expanding it to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Brendah

texts.en:
Brendah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Brendah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities such as sugar. 

To help expand her business, Brendah has requested a loan of 850,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essentials for the shop like sugar, milk and other items for sale, and will help Brendah to generate greater profits and add more items that will increase her capital. Brendah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another retail shop. 

Brendah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more essentials for the shop like sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Dilbarkhon

texts.en: Dilbarkhon is a kind woman, married and has four children. Her husband Asadkhon is a migrant from Russia. Dilbarkhon is the main supporter of her family. She has been busy selling dried fruit she buys in bulk. She sells the dried fruit at a local market. Dilbarkhon manages the business alone. She works hard from early morning till late evening six days in a week to earn a living. She needs to car for her business. She transports her goods from her house to the local market and also buys dried fruit from other regions and transports it to her house where she keeps the goods. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 Somoni to buy a car for her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business

loans.name: Sweden Group

texts.en:
Habiba is in her mid-30's and married with four children, all of whom are still in school. She has been running two projects, a pharmacy and selling chicken broilers. She has been in her business for four years now. She works from 7:30 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Habiba's first loan from Tujijenge, Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy medicine for her pharmacy. She dreams of opening a retail food shop. Habiba will share this loan with her loan group, Sweden, which has five members. Members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Liliana Esther

texts.es: Liliana de 46 años, habita con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 14, 17 y 23 años, en el sur de la ciudad, en un popular barrio, que concentra actividades comerciales, infraestructura financiera y de equipamiento, que poco a poco ha surgido como una necesidad de ayudar a la población de habitantes de los barrios del sur oriente, para que dispongan de servicios útiles para aumentar su nivel de vida y desarrollo familiar. Liliana hace 2 años, a través de su madre, gestora de su idea de negocios, recibía,  desde un país vecino productos de consumo femenino, como suéteres, jeans, sandalias etc., para venderlos y agregar ingresos que le facilitaran un mejor vivir.  Posteriormente,   tomó las riendas de este negocio en sus manos y logró conseguir más clientes, a quienes venderle a créditos, de los cuales la mayor parte son trabajadores de empresas, y propietarios de negocios y hoy  sus mas apreciados compradores.  Liliana vende de contado y tiene como sueño progresar, en su local o punto de exhibición para incrementar sus ventas posicionándolo. Su meta es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener su propia casa; aun así debe superar su mayor desafío, que es lograr suficientes recursos,   para alcanzar esta meta de manera oportuna. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una nevera, un aire acondicionado un equipo de sonidos, todo esto con el fin de atraer más a su clientela en su punto de contacto y poco a poco hacer su sueño de prosperidad una realidad. .
texts.en: Liliana is 46 years old, she lives with her 3 children who are 14, 17 and 23 years old, in the south of the city, in a popular neighborhood. People here work in business, finance and packaging, and little by little there has been a growing need to help the population in the southeastern part of town in order to provide them with basic services to improve their quality of life. Liliana received women's products 2 years ago from a neighboring country, with the help of her mother who helped her start her own business selling sweaters, jeans, sandals etc. Through the sales, she will be be able to earn more money and have a better life. Later, she took charge of the business and she was able to gain more customers, who she sells to on credit, and who for the most part, are workers in companies or owners of businesses and are her most valuable customers. Liliana sells on cash and wants to be able to progress in her endeavors by having a storefront or area to exhibit her products to increase sales. Her goal is to be able to send her children to school to have a career and have their own home. But first, she needs to confront her biggest obstacle: limited resources. She is currently asking for a loan with Kiva and she will use it to purchase a refrigerator, an air conditioner and sound equipment with the goal of attracting more costumers to her store and little by little make her dream of prosperity a reality.

loans.use: purchase a refrigerator, an air conditioner and sound equipment.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association KOTOGNOGONTALA (BAMANANKING) de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne trois enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de GNINE qui est la première personne debout de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à BAMANANKING  dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali).  
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : poivres, tomates, choux et oignons.   
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a six ans. Elles sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. 
GNINE, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une quantité importante de condiments alimentaires de différentes sortes (poivre, tomate, oignon et choux).  Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses aliments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
BENKADI is a group of the KOTOGNOGONTALA (BAMANANKING) association from OUELESSEBOUGOU. It comprises women who met one another through family and neighbourhood connections. They have an average age of 33. Married, and with three children each on average, they have different businesses such as the buying and selling of condiments - as in the case of GNINE, standing on the far left in the photo. They live in large traditional families in BAMANANKING in the Kati district (Koulikoro county, Republic of Mali). They have been small traders for several years and are much sought after in their condiment trading activities: peppers, tomatoes, cabbages and onions. 
With the objective of meeting their clientele's growing needs, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program six years ago. They are seeking their seventh mutual loan.
GNINE, a group member and well known in OUELESSEBOUGOU, excels in the sale of condiments. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of different foodstuffs (peppers, tomatoes, onions and cabbages). 
She buys them in Bamako and locally from wholesalers, and sells her foodstuffs in OUELESSEBOUGOU in small quantities, for cash and credit, to a customer base of both men and women. She is hoping for a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA which will allow her to reimburse the loan and to reinvest in her condiment trading activity.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married mother who lives in Kisauni. She sells food and is helped by her family.

She always struggles to improve her food-selling business, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken, and food packaging materials.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken, and food packaging.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience has operated a beauty salon business. The major challenge she faces is business seasonality.

With the loan, she wants to buy weaves, conditioners, and hair braids for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy weaves, conditioners, and hair braids for her business.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гульноре 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей дошкольного возраста.  У Гульноры среднее образование, она оптимистично идет по жизни, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Гульнора в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 3 года  назад с покупки скота на 7,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульноры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется одна дойная корова. Для содержания скота есть сарай. Гульнора реализует молоко среди местных жителей, ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульнора обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом на покупку дойной коровы. На оставшиеся средства хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения, ядохимикаты и семена хлопка. Доходы от кредита Гульнора планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Gulnora is 30 years old, married and raising three children of pre-school age together with her husband. Gulnora has secondary education. She is optimistic about life, knows exactly what she wants and achieves everything on her own. 

As a main income for her family, Gulnora works with livestock breeding, after having started three years ago with the purchase of livestock for 7,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulnora's persistent work, her farm currently has a dairy cow. She has a barn to keep livestock in. Gulnora sells milk to the local residents. The monthly incom is 10,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Gulnora turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase a dairy cow. For the remaining money she would like to purchase mineral fertilizers, pesticides and cotton seeds. Gulnora plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock, and plans to save money for renovating her house.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow, as well as mineral fertilizers, pesticides and cotton seeds

loans.name: Iyut

texts.en:
Iyut runs a small stall where he sells groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Iyut is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Iyut began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Slamet

texts.en:
Slamet runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Slamet is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Slamet began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro (middle) is a young farmer, 22 years old, who lives in a rural community in one of the poorest states of Mexico. With the help of his father Santos (left), and his brother Julio César (right), he will use the loan to buy 8 head of cattle, fatten them and sell them to increase the household income. The family has been working with a NGO to obtain the technical expertise and built the necessary infrastructure to develop a silvopasture system. 
With this project, Alejandro will develop a more sustainable cattle-raising method through a silvopasture system. In addition, he will improve the living conditions of his family, and contribute to the conservation of an area of high environmental value. 
His goal is to save money, obtain the technical knowledge, and in the future have his own butcher´s shop where he can sell the meat from his cattle.

loans.use: to buy 8 head of cattle to develop a sustainable farming ecosystem.

loans.name: Zulayho

texts.ru:
Эту жительница района Хамадони зовут Зулайхо, которой уже исполнилось 49 лет. Она замужем за мастера строителя и у них четверо дочерей и трое сыновей. Их семья большая и дружная. Зулайхо в данный момент арендовала 7 га участка орошаемой земли и планирует начать земледельческую деятельность. Как и любой сельский житель она знает как производить посевные работы. 
Для купли семян и минеральных удобрений, Зулайхо не хватает капитала и поэтому она берет кредит. Она надеется во время провести весенний посев и получить хороший урожай для продажи. Зулайхо домохозяйка и нигде не работает, но благодаря кредиту у нее будет работа.
texts.en:
This resident of the Hamadoni region is called Zulayho. She has already turned 49. She is married to a master carpenter, and they have four daughters and three sons. Their family is large and friendly. 

Zulayho currently rents an irrigated plot of land of 7 hectares. Like the other residents of the village she knows how to carry out sowing work. Zulayho does not have enough capital to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers, and therefore she takes a loan. She hopes to carry out the spring sowing on time, and to receive a good harvest to sell. 

Zulayho is a housewife and never had a job, and thanks to the loan she does not need to have a job either.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one currently in school. For the past three years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair styling. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair extensions andhair relaxer for the salon. This will attract more clients and will help Lydia generate greater profits and increase more items in the salon. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and construct a house of her own. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more hair extensions and hair relaxer for the salon

loans.name: Estar Rose

texts.en:
Estar Rose is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Estar Rose has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Estar Rose has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh passion fruits for making juice, and will help Estar Rose to generate greater profits, expand her business and own a restaurant. Estar Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop.
