Estar Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh passion fruits for making juice

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman and has children. She lives in a rental house that has no electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Uchi

texts.en:
Uchi has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support from Yehu and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Twenty-one-year-old Sima is an ambitious and enthusiastic entrepreneur from northern Iraq. Sima is full of energy, splitting her time between her work and her studies at university. She is lucky to have the support of her family, who are very proud of her achievements, watching her attentively to see what endeavors she will take on in the future.

Sima is the managing partner of a beauty salon that she owns in partnership with her brother. A salon is one of the few types of socially acceptable businesses for females to own and operate in her community, and one of several in Sima’s town. Despite the restrictions and competition, Sima’s eagerness and assertiveness has quickly made her salon one of the most famous beauty salons in her town.

Though she is young, she takes her business seriously, as it is the main source of income for her family, and most importantly, the only source of income to cover her tuition and expenses at the university. In addition to providing for her and her family, her business provides employment to five individuals, four of whom are women. 

Eventually, Sima hopes to have a chain of beauty salons that extend beyond her own community. Until then, she continues to expand her salon. As a growing business with high potential, Sima has qualified for a WLIFT loan in the amount of 20,000. With these funds, Sima plans to expand her salon’s space and services to include anti-aging treatments and massage therapy. She predicts that this expansion will allow her to reach 5-10% more customers, increasing her income and stability. 

As a participant in the WLIFT program, Sima is participating in the modular business training offered by the program and will also participate in one-on-one coaching as well as be connected to a business mentor.  An entrepreneur who is under the age of 30, Sima also qualifies for the youth loan category on the Kiva platform.

loans.use: to expand her salon’s space and services to include anti-aging treatments and massage therapy.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is married and has  kids who attend school. She stays in her house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a spare parts business. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. In addition, she operates a crop farming business, which is her other source of income. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 48-year-old, married mother of six children, who has run her convenience store since 2000 in order to provide her family members with the necessary standard of living, especially since her husband doesn't work at all and she has to make sure that everything is under control.

Khadija is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, to increase her business merchandise with special offer products, especially the summer beverages that are highly requested by her customers.

Khadija used to bake and sell the special traditional Saj bread, but the store and its development took a lot of her time, so she couldn't take good care of her special bread business. But, today, she is willing to renew her business sections and let the bread be an important section of her store, in addition to the fruits and vegetables that are now competing with cereals, soft drinks, sweets, canned food, and detergents.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special offer products, especially the summer beverages that are highly requested by her customers.

loans.name: Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Pili, who is single, is a mother of two sons who are in school. She is in her early thirties and makes her family's living by making and selling snacks like chapati, donuts, and vitumbua with tea. She has been in this business for three years now and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Pili is from Tujijenge Tanzania. This is her first loan request, which she will use to rebuild her business place to a large size and buy plates and other saving dishes. She plans to change her business to the restaurant level. She dreams of providing her kids with a better education. Pili will share this loan with her loan group "Green Tomalin," which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to rebuild her business place to a large size and buy plates and other saving dishes.

loans.name: Pekeshe

texts.en:
Pekeshe operates a beauty salon to earn a living and support her family, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers are her customers.  

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to add stock of hair braids and shampoo to her beauty salon business. 

She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to add stock of hair braids and shampoo to her beauty salon.

loans.name: Sokrun's Group

texts.en: A young mother of two, Sokrun has been growing cassava for six years to support her family. This is the primary source of income for the family. When free, Sokrun works for others for labor wages. Given her good performance, Sokrun has been appointed to be a group leader leading a group of two female members to apply for their second loans from VisionFund. Sokrun plans to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her cassava plantation, hoping that the crop will give a good yield and can be sold for a higher price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Irina

texts.ru:
Ирина уже 15 лет занимается торговым предпринимательством. Она арендует места на одном из рынков Хуста, а также в местном торговом центре, реализуя одежду для женщин, а также одежду больших размеров. В бизнесе помогают дочь и муж. Ирина — очень трудолюбивая. Бизнес построила правильно с самого начала, прибыль получает хорошую и конкуренцию преодолевает с честью. 
На сумму в 20 000 гривен Ирина хотела бы закупить товар для весеннего сезона. Для семьи Ирины главный приоритет — это бизнес, ведь они все живут за счет него. Поэтому Ирина намерена вкладывать в это дело и дальше, чтобы постепенно расширять свое дело по мере возможности. К тому же, дополнительные средства будут как нельзя кстати, когда сын окончит школу и поступит в ВУЗ.
texts.en:
Irina has worked in retail for 15 years. She rents a stall at one of the markets in Khoost, and also at the local shopping mall, selling women's clothing and also plus size clothing. Her daughter and husband help with the business. Irina is very hardworking. She built the business right from the very beginning. She receives a good income and overcomes competition in an admirable way. 

For the loan amount of 20,000 hryvnia, Irina would like to purchase goods for the spring season. For Irina's family this business is the main priority, as they all live on it. Therefore Irina inteds to invest in this activity and in the future expand it stepwise, as far as possible. Moreover, the additional funds will be very helpful when her son graduates and starts university.

loans.use: to purchase spring clothing for selling

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 62 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Trinidad, Santa Bárbara. Lleva más de 4 años de tener su propio negocio de pulpería y vende arroz, azúcar, manteca, harina, productos de limpieza, lácteos, carnes, embutidos, churros, dulces, refrescos, etc.  De donde obtiene sus ingresos. Solicita el sexto ciclo de préstamo el cual es por 10,000 lempiras para surtir de productos como granos básicos, embutidos, productos de aseo, churros, refrescos, etc.  Su meta es ver crecer el negocio y estar unida a su familia.
texts.en: María is 62 years old, married, has two children, and lives in the municipality of Trinidad, Santa Barbara. She's had her own grocery store for over 4 years and sells rice, sugar, lard, flour, cleaning products, dairy products, meats, sausages, churros, sweets, beverages, etc. It's her source of income. She's requesting a sixth loan, in the amount of 10,000 lempiras, to stock her store with staple foods, sausages, cleaning products, beverages, etc. Her goal is to see her business grow and stick by her family.

loans.use: To stock products such as staple foods, sausages, cleaning products, churros, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Banat Al Dayaa Group

texts.en:
Banat Al Dayaa is a group composed of three friends: Hanadi, Randa, and Amina. They decided to join hands, form a group, trust each other, and acquire a group loan from Al Majmoua in order to financially support each other. Each member has a special financial need, and the loan will be a great advantage to pull them out of their situation.

Amina is the leader and featured member of this group. She is a Palestinian refugee who seeks to work hard to develop her living and improve her family's socioeconomic situation. She is a 30-year-old single lady, who is standing at the far left side of the picture wearing a purple top. She is currently employed in a vet center with special farming skills, according to her acquired experience in this domain. She once bought sheep and raised them until she sold them and made a good income. This also happens to be her hobby.

Amina's monthly income is not sufficient to provide a healthy life for her family members, which is why she decided to invest in her skills and start her own business. In fact, she decided to join the group and acquire a loan in order to open a small shop where she is going to sell special food spices which are not available in the region where she lives. It is a very good step forward to start such a requested business. This will allow her to launch her own business and develop it over the time, which will allow her family to have a better socioeconomic situation.

Concerning the other group members, Randa is the woman standing on the right in the picture with black and red top, while Hanady is the woman standing in the center.

loans.use: To open a small shop, where she is going to sell special food spices that are not available in the region where she lives, and it is a very good step forward to start such a requested business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy products such as perfumes, powders, deodorants and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 20 años de edad vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo, adicional a eso también trabaja como jornal en una finca, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el  necesita invertir por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. el cliente tiene buenas referencias  por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
The client, 20, lives with his family in his own house.

He earns a living growing corn and millet.  He also works as a day laborer on a farm.  He has been working in agriculture for several years and it has given him a lot of experience, which allows him to get the best harvests.  He sells his harvest on the outskirts of the community.  He has a lot of customers who prefer him because of the quality of his products, his good prices, and above all his good service.

He needs to invest, so he's requesting a loan to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

People who know the client give him good references, and he's very responsible.  He's certain he'll be able to pay back the debt by the deadline.  He also trusts he'll bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Taibakhon

texts.en:
Taibakhon was born in 1960. She is very kind woman. Taibakhon is divorced and has a son who is 24 years old. 

Taibakhon works in two jobs. She works in a college, as a teacher of chemistry, and in a hospital, as a nurse. She is a hard-working woman and she performs her jobs well. Taibakhon uses her salary to buy food products and clothes for herself and her son. 

She lives poorly, in an old house, since she has a small salary. She is going to repair her house, but she does not have the money. 

Taibakhon is asking for a loan of TJS 7,500 (somoni) to buy building materials to repair her house, such as cement, wood, and paint. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to repair her house, such as cement, wood, and paint.

loans.name: Mimi

texts.en:
Mimi runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Mimi lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta.  Mimi is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Mimi began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Claudia Maria

texts.es:
Con el carisma, la amabilidad, la hospitalidad y la imponente Catedral de la Gran Sultana, Granada, en el centro de la Cuidad nos dan la bienvenida con los brazos abiertos sus habitantes y con ellos también Doña Claudia Almanza, una señora de 42 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos, 2 de ellos ya independientes; dedicada a la comercialización de calzado en general (damas, caballeros, niños y niñas), pero sus inicios los obtuvo elaborando rifas de pequeñas cantidades de dinero, luego se trasladó a la compra y venta de sandalias he ahí la base de su negocio; sus metas próximas son la compra de nuevos estilos de calzado para satisfacer toda necesidad y gusto de sus clientes en esta temporada de Semana Santa. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de nueva mercadería como calzado deportivo y sandalias de plataformas; estimando que el crédito a solicitud será de mucha ayuda porque podrá incrementar sus ventas y consigo su negocio; sus planes a futuros es  la expansión de su local por el mercado de la Ciudad de Granada y a nivel nacional.
texts.en:
In the center of Granada, the city's inhabitants welcome us with open arms, charisma, friendliness, hospitality and the imposing Cathedral of the Great Sultan. Claudia Almanza is among them; she is a 42-year-old woman who is the single mother of five children, two of whom are already independent. She makes a living by selling shoes in general (for women, men, boys and girls), but she started out selling raffle tickets for small amounts of money. She then switched to buying and selling sandals and based her business on that. Her immediate goals are to buy new styles of shoes to satisfy her customers' every need and taste in this season of Holy Week. 

She is asking for a loan to buy new merchandise like sneakers and platform sandals. She thinks that the loan requested will be a lot of help because she will be able to increase her sales and thus expand her business. Her plans for the future are to expand her stall in the market of the city of Granada and at a national level.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise like sneakers and platform sandals.

loans.name: Teguh

texts.en:
Teguh runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. He has been running this stall for one year. Teguh lives in Cirebon, a semi-urban area about seven hours from Jakarta and he is single.

To increase the family income, Teguh also works as a dealer.  He joined Ruma one month ago to increase his income and he feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Teguh is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income.  To provide this new service, Teguh is required to print out receipts for customers.  A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To purchase a printer to provide receipts for bill payments

loans.name: Nenden

texts.en:
Nenden runs a small stall selling groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Nenden lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Nenden is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Nenden began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Irwan

texts.en:
Irwan runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Irwan lives west of Bandung, a semi-urban area about three hours from Jakarta. Irwan is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Irwan began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Aris

texts.en:
Aris runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Aris is single and lives with six people in the family house.

Aris began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo es padre de dos hijos, Pablo es novio de una mujer divorciada que es la madre de los niños. Pablo vive en La Paz en una casa de acabado fino en modalidad de anticretico que cuenta con todos los servicios hasta gas domiciliario. Pablo es comerciante de electrodomesticos (microondas, televisiones, hornos, etc.) y necesita dinero para comprar más electrodomesticos puesto que Pablo se preocupa por traer marcas garantizadas y su clientela esta aumentando Pablo es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar por lo que necesita su ayuda
texts.en: Pablo is a "father" of two children. He is the boyfriend of a divorced woman who is the mother of these children. He lives in La Paz, in a house with a high quality finish whih he is renting with a view to buy, and which is fully equipped, and even has household gas. Pablo sells electrical appliances (microwaves, televisions, ovens, etc.) and needs money to buy more electrical goods, since he wants stock guaranteed brands and his customer base is growing. Pablo is the sole breadwinner in his household, which is why he needs your help.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for his retail business.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi operates a grocery and vegetable-selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a farmer who lives and does farming in Nandi Hills. She is married and has two children,and has been doing farming for 20 years with her primary source of income being from milk, tea, eggs, and a retail business.

She said that she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because the interest rates on their loans are affordable. During the training she learnt how to develop a culture of saving and how to improve her farming activities. Through this poultry loan, her income will increase and so will her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 24 years old and a married mother of one daughter whose age is under six years old. To support her small family, Mom and her husband do rice farming on their two hectares of land. This is Mom's second loan with VisionFund. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for the rice farm and keep some amount of money to pay for labor fees. She is hoping that the rice will yield be high and give her more profit so that she can fulfill her dream of having more farmland.

loans.use: To pay for labor fees and to buy rice seeds and fertilizers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, aged 46, used the previous loan to buy tomato herbicides and weed her gardens. The season was favorable and she managed to use her proceeds to re-invest in her dairy project. These businesses have enabled her to increase her monthly income despite the challenges of weather changes and price fluctuations. She maintains her dream of having a healthy family and a better farm enterprise.

Florence is requesting a loan to weed her tomato garden.

loans.use: to weed her tomato garden.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and sell Barefoot Power's solar lighting products

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and she has kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives in a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and fees for her kids.

She operates a stall selling fruits and vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenges of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Abdulatif Group

texts.en:
Abdulatif is a group that consists of four ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 220,000 YER from AL-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Hadyah is a 49-year-old married woman with four children who lives with her family in their own house in Sana'a, Yemen. She is the leader of the group. She lives in a very old house which needs to a renovation. Unfortunately, the family doesn't have enough money for that. She works as a housewife and works very hard in order to improve the living standards of her family. She didn’t give up because of the miserable condition of her family, but instead decided to assist her husband in renovating their house. For this reason, she decided to apply for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase construction materials as cement, bricks, and wood.

Hadyah looks forward to finishing all the renovation of the first floor and building the second floor.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials as cement, bricks, and wood.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba was born in 1962. She is a woman who always tries for the well-being of her family. Her husband is a businessman. He sells dried fruits. Matluba and her husband bring up two sons. They are adults. 

Matluba has her own business deal. For more than 20 years, she has been busy, selling women's and children's shoes. She sells in a local market where she has her own selling place. 

Every season, Matluba renews the assortment of her goods. She is asking for a loan of TJS 7,500 (somoni) to buy women's and children's shoes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's shoes.

loans.name: Nigina

texts.en: Nigina was born in 1980. She is married and has four children. Nigina is a hardworking woman and always tries for the well-being of her children. Five months ago, she began own sewing business deal. Little by little, she developed her business. She sews national women's dresses in her house. Nigina tries to provide high quality service to her clients. She needs to purchase an embroidery machine. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somoni to buy an embroidery machine for her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for her new business

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi has been operating a fruit and vegetable selling business. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and stiff competition from other operators. 

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards and she appreciates the support

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Tieng's Group

texts.en:
Tieng is 47 years old and a married mother of five children, two of whom are still in school. To support the family, Tieng does rice farming while her husband works as a motor taxi driver. Together, they can earn on average around US$7 a day. After netting off expenses, they are able to save around US$3 a day. 

Tieng decided to request her first loan from VisionFund, planning to get the money to buy fertilizers for her rice farm. Her husband will also pay for motorbike repair.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for motorbike repair

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
She is married and a mother of five children. They both live in a three bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finances to start up a business of her own and cater for her family needs, sickness and death of family members, and family problems involving land disputes.

She has taken and successfully repaid her loans and says with this new loan requested, she will expand her business activities by buying more clothes for her shop, adding more chicks to her poultry farm, and also expand the sales of her firewood. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding because she has experience gained from the previous loan; she has good and strategic business sites and has regular customers who buy from her. With this activity, she plans to supply the best to her community.
 
With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family's needs, ensure her children's education, expand her business and also save some to undertake a bigger investment. She prefers loans form GHAPE because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, the members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed, and also social needs of members are catered for at GHAPE.

loans.use: to buy bananas, beans, cocoyams and secondhand dresses and fowls for her poultry

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her restaurant where she sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food, meat, chicken and other foods for the restaurant. This will help Florence to generate greater profits and expand her business into a bigger restaurant. Florence hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a hotel in Kayunga town. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food, meat, chicken and other foods for the restaurant,

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is married with five children and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 12 years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income from poultry farming. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation, thieves, seasonality and defaulters. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Raymande

texts.en:
Raymande is separated from her husband and is a mother of six children. She lives with her children in a two bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the northwest region of Cameroon.  She has faced so many challenges in life, including inadequate finances to start up a business of her own as well as catering to her family's needs, family problems, and overcoming the sicknesses and deaths of family members.

She has taken and successfully repaid four loans and says with this new loan requested, she will expand her small business activities by buying airtime cards for retail  and food items, like beans, maize, rice, tomatoes, and onions, for her small store. She holds a positive view of her business succeeding, because she has experience gained from the previous loans. She has a good and strategic business location and has regular customers who buy from her. With this activity, she plans to supply the best to her community.
 
With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her family needs, ensure her children's education, expand her business, and also save some money to undertake bigger investment. She prefers loans from GHAPE because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals. Also, members are trained on marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Finally, GHAPE also assists with the social needs of members.

loans.use: to buy airtime cards for retail and food items for retails

loans.name: Karla Paola

texts.es: Karla, tiene 21 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos, vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Hace 4 años decidió dedicarse al comercio para obtener ingresos, vende ropa como blusas, camisas, pantalones, calzado, accesorios para damas como ser aretes, cosméticos, etc. Ha solicitado el tercer ciclo que es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisetas, calzado y otra mercadería que le pidan sus clientes. Su plan es hacer crecer el negocio, crecer como persona y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Karla is 21 years old and lives in the town of Macuelizo, Santa Barbara with her common law partner and two children. Four years ago she decided to open a business to obtain income. She sells clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants, footwear, and women's accessories such as earrings, cosmetics, etc. She is requesting a loan for 10,000 Lempiras to buy clothes such as blouses, pants, shirts, footwear, and other goods her customers request. Her plan is to expand her business, grow as a person, and help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, pants, shirts, footwear, and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.en:
Odilla is married and a mother of five children. She lives with her family in a two-bedroom house in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are the death of her elder brother, after she had spent much money in the hospital for medication and hospital bills, an untimely death in her family, inadequate finances to effectively carry out her business, and an accident that led to the death of her junior brother.

She has taken and repaid her loans successfully four times and says with this new loan requested that she will expand her spare part store by buying more parts from Douala and Nigeria. She will also buy feed and medication for her fowls. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been doing it for long. She is a trustworthy person who controls the store. Her business is situated at a strategic point and she has regular customers who buy from her store for resale. With this business activity, the community will have reliable parts for their vehicles at cheaper rates, and the parts obtained from her stores are installed in the customer’s vehicle without the payment of installation fees.

With the profit from this loan, she will cater for her children’s education, complete her house under construction, and expand her business by adding other items she can’t afford now. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals, and the social nets in the organization among members.

loans.use: to buy motor parts for retail, fowls, feed and medication

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les sept  membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Sabalibougou l’un des quartiers du district de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Sabalibougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’habits (pagnes wax, brodés et  bazins),de boissons, d’encens, du poisson, des légumes, des produits cosmétiques et de la restauration.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1ercycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Sabou (femme assise en 1ème position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habits (pagnes wax, brodés, bazins) et d’encens.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes wax à Bamako auprès des grossistes. La revente se fait en détail dans le quartier à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Sabou espère avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
Most of the seven members of the Benkadi group are married and live in monogamous households. On average, they are 36 years old and have five children. They all live in Sabalibougou, a neighbourhood in the Bamako district, and know each other through being neighbours and thanks to their businesses at the Sabalibougou market. 

The group members run businesses selling outfits (wax and embroidered pagnes and damask cloth), drinks, incense, fish, vegetables and cosmetic products, or catering businesses. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first solidarity loan cycle.

Sabou (picture sitting on the far right) is renowned for the outfits (wax and embroidered pagnes and damask cloth) and incense she sells. She will use her loan to buy 20 wax pagnes in Bamako. She will then resell her products to individuals in her neighborhoods, mainly women. 

Sabou hopes that this loan will help her make an average of 50,000 CFA francs per month, which she will use to reinvest in the business and care for her children.

loans.use: to buy traditional wax pagnes.

loans.name: Blue Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid-thirties is a widow with one child, who is still in school.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily, and is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Halima's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to start selling fabrics and also bought  items for her food business.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to start selling soft drinks.  She dreams of improving her life and her business.

Halima will share this loan with her group, Blue (comprised of two members), who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling soft drinks.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet  is married with three children and two of her children go to school. She has a beauty salon business and has been in this business for five years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She works at the market six days out of every week and on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more braids, weaves and hair oils. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and electricity outages. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She decided to join MCDTSACCO because she wanted to acquire more capital for her salon business.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more  braids, weaves and hair oils.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane est un célibataire de 26 ans et sans enfant qui vit chez son père à Bougouni dans le quartier Faraba.
Après des études supérieurs où il sort avec un diplôme de Maîtrise en Droit Publique, Souleymane n'ayant pas eu un emploi en rapport avec sa formation, décide de s'installer dans les activités d'achat et de vente de téléphones portables et accessoires qu'il a commencé depuis qu'il était étudiant. Avec une expérience de 6 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour avoir un fonds de roulement consistant, il décide de prendre un autre prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso qu’il a connu à travers son père pour acheter 20 téléphones portables de plusieurs marques,10 batteries 10 chargeurs et 10 façades. Il est son troisième prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso. Et tous les 2 prêts précédents  ont été correctement remboursé.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali).
Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui servira à agrandir son entreprise, payer son prêt et à aider son père assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Souleymane is 26 years old and single.  He has no children.  He lives with his father in the Faraba neighborhood of Bougouni.  After his graduate studies in Public Law, Souleymane did not have a job related to hist training, so he took up the purchasing and selling of mobile phones and accessories full-time that he had been doing since he was in school. He now has six years of experience in this field and knows his business quite well.

In order to have a constant source of working capital, and after being introduced to Soro Yiriwaso by his own father, Souleymane has decided to take another loan. This is his third loan with Soro Yiriwaso and he has duly repaid his two previous loans.  He will use this new loan to buy 20 cellular phones from several manufacturers, 10 batteries, 10 chargers and 10 cases.  He buys his merchandise in Bamako, the capital city of the Republic of Mali.

Thanks to this loan, Souleymane is expecting to make a monthly profit of 60,000 CFA francs, which will be used to expand his business, repay his loan and help his father with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy cell phones and accessories.

loans.name: Somaya

texts.en:
Somaya is a 55-year-old married mother of three children. She is a Palestinian refugee who has worked hard as a tailor since 1980, supporting her husband, who has a small grocery store, in their living and providing their children with the necessary standards of living. Their combined income is barely enough to cover all the family’s expenses, which is why she also provides vocational training in a certain Palestinian institution to increase her income.

Somaya lives and works in a refugee camp, since most Palestinians are limited with certain working domains and sectors in Lebanon. That’s why they work hard to improve their living with what’s available. She has always been a determined person who wants to help and improve the family’s situation.

Somaya is already Al Majmoua borrower in good standing with a good payback history. Her house needs are very important to her, because she wants to keep it a healthy living place, so her previous loan was invested for her house’s renovation and maintenance. She is also acquiring this current loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua in order to continue renovating and expanding her living place.

loans.use: to continue renovating and expanding her living place

loans.name: Maye

texts.fr:
Cette femme fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 2 juillet 2011 et qui regroupe des membres très solidaires. La plupart pratiquent comme activité le commerce. 
Maye, âgée de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons. Elle fait comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de tissus et de draps. 
Avec le prêt elle envisage d'acheter 50 draps à raison de 11000f un drap.Elle revend un drap à 20000f. Elle va aussi acheter avec le reste de l'argent des pièces de tissu "Khartoum" pour diversifier sa marchandise.
Avec les bénéfices elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille en leur achetant des habits et renforcer la nourriture. Elle va réinvestir aussi sur son commerce.
texts.en:
This woman belongs to a finance group created on July 2, 2011, which includes very solidary members. Most are active in retail.

48-year-old Maye is married and a mother of five, including two boys. Her business is the retail of clothing and sheets.

With this loan, she plans to purchase fifty sheets costing 11,000 XOF each; she retails them for 20,000 XOF. She will also purchase pieces of “Khartoum” fabric costing with the rest of the money to diversify her merchandise.

With the profit, she plans to improve her family’s living conditions by purchasing clothes and improving their alimentation. She will also reinvest in her retail business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and sheets.

loans.name: Coop Isabane 2014B Gp1 Group

texts.en:
Fransina is 37-years-old. She is a mother of two children. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production.  She needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.  In the picture, Fransina holds a book, as the only sign of identification.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Sabin

texts.en:
Sabin is one of the best welders in Northern Rwanda. He has been running his shop for more than 15 years, and is known for providing quality craftsmanship and customer service.  There are several new hydroelectric powers being built where Sabin is from in Musanze District, and he has positioned himself as the primary local welder on many of these products.  Sabin is in a perfect position to drastically expand his business, but he needs one new machine to handle the demand: a horizontal metal lathe.

A loan from Kiva would allow Sabin to purchase this machine, making him the second person to own such a machine in all of Rwanda. 

In addition, Sabin is one of African Entrepreneur Collective's most active entrepreneurs.  Since he is a more experienced welder, Sabin voluntarily mentors some of AEC's younger welders, helping them make strategic decisions and grow their own welding businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a fabrication machine so that he can make all of the inputs for his construction projects in house.

loans.name: Coop Isabane 2014B Gp4 Group

texts.en:
Faustin is married with three children. His wife is a farmer as well. They have been rice farmers for the past nine years. Faustin will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production. On behalf of the group members, they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Esdora

texts.en: Esdora is 44 years old. She is divorced and bringing up three children. Esdora is the only provider for her children. She is a very sociable woman. Esdora worked in Russia some years ago. She is in Tajikistan now and began her new business selling perfumes and dishes three month ago. She sells her goods in a store that is located near her house. Esdora is going to increase the working capital of her new business. She is asking for a loan of 8,000 Somoni to buy perfumes and dishes or her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy perfumes and dishes to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 44-year-old hard working man living in Masindi, Uganda. He owns a butcher shop and does farming to supplement his income. He ventured into these businesses to earn a living and his major clients are hotels (restaurants). He has a vision of educating his children, although he faces a difficulty with customers who don't pay him on time.

Moses intends to use the loan to buy cows for slaughtering to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr: Afin d'augmenter son stock de céréales(mais), Afiwa âgée de 55ans et mère d'un enfant sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour atteindre son objectif. Elle espère assurer une bonne scolarisation à son enfant et réinjecter une partie du profit dans son activité. Avec une ancienneté de 03ans dans l'activité, elle exerce son commerce au marché.
texts.en: In order to increase her stock of cereals (wheat), Afiwa, a 55-year-old mother to one child, is requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to reach her goal. She hopes to be able to ensure a solid education for her child and to reinvest part of the profits into her business. With three years of experience in this business, she works at the market.

loans.use: to buy bags of cereal

loans.name: Moch's Group

texts.en: Moch is a villager from Battambang province and she is 43 years old. She has four children, one of whom still relies on her. To deal with the daily cost of living, she does rice farming as her main source of income. She has been involved with this business for ten years, earning a decent income. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for many years. Her past loans that she has successfully repaid, have enabled her to improve her living conditions. Now, she leads a group to get a new loan. She and her co-borrower are each applying for a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. She will spend her loan to pay for land plowing fees and to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She believes that this loan will help her to keep improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for land plowing fees and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
Nak, a resident of Thmor Koul district in Battambang province, is 28 years old and a mother of four children. To making a family living, she does vegetable transplanting for her cash-crop business, and also works at a job for supplemental  income. She has been engaged in this business for six years. 

With all previous loans repaid, Nak is now requesting her sixth loan with her joint borrower from VisionFund. Nak is seeking 600,000 KHR, while her group partner is requesting 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire portion to buy pesticide for her cash-crop. 

Nak hopes that her business will continue improving her family's living conditions at a good pace.

loans.use: To buy pesticide for her cash-crop

loans.name: Trust Camara Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Trust Camara group. They are in the Dansoman district in the greater-Accra region in Ghana.

Obed is married and is 47 years old; he has had a business selling soft drinks for six years now. He operates this business in a small bar that he had erected at his residence. He works all day, all night, and he is doing very well. 

Obed dreams of having plenty of drinking bars to serve a very big spectrum of the population, therefore, he is working hard to reach his goal. 

He is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks and orange drinks to sell to his customers. 

The other members of this group work in a variety of businesses including, soft drinks and hair products sales.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and orange drinks to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Overflowing Group

texts.en:
These six members led by Esther as the representative, are part of the group called Overflowing The businesses that the members of this group are engaged in include selling second hand clothing, groceries, cement and gari (cassava flour). They will need a total amount of GHS 11,100 to expand their businesses. The loan will benefit this group of micro-businesswomen, of which Esther is a member. Esther says that she joined ID-Ghana four years ago and became a founding member of this group. This is her eighth loan request to Kiva and her fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. 

She currently has a business selling second hand clothing. Esther will use her part of this loan, GHS 2400, to increase her capital. She will buy two bales of second hand clothing to sell to customers. She will sell them by hawking to her customers. This work allows her to make an income for her family. Esther is 50 years old, married and has four children. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Esther replied that she likes the health insurance services and the training sessions. She says her loans have made it possible to take care of her children and her needs, by saving part of her profits and reinvesting the other part in her business.

loans.use: To buy second hand clothing to sell

loans.name: Pmr Group

texts.en:
Rosalina is the featured borrower of PMR group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, because they have been close friends since they arrived to Lebanon and started to work as housekeepers to help their beloved families uphold the necessary standards of living.

Rosalina is a 54-year-old married mother of two children. She works as a housekeeper to make sure that her beloved children will get the best education, which will be their best weapon for a brighter future. She is devoted to her children and misses them a lot. She hopes that one day they will unite back together forever. But, in the meantime, her main goal is to provide them with the best education. Her low income isn't enough to cover both her living needs in Lebanon and her family’s increasing needs back at home, in the Philippines. As a result her acquired loan will be sent to her children to pay for their increasing educational fees.
 
Rosalina is the beautiful lady in the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Pia Mae, the first from the left, is 28 and the married mother of two children. Arjay, with a grey top standing at the far right side of the picture, is 34 and the married mother of one child.

All of them are motivated to work hard to improve their families’ socioeconomic situations through assisting them in attaining a good level of education. They believe that being a united team at Al Majmoua is a ray of hope; they will work on acquiring the necessary loans in the future to cover their children's educational installments.

loans.use: to pay for her children's additional educational fees

loans.name: Nelly Grilanda

texts.es:
Nelly Grilanda tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y cultivo de plátano,que lo comercializan en el mercado de su distrito, ha solicitado un prestamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el cultivo de plátano y de esta manera generar tener una producción para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelly Grilanda, age 36, lives with her husband and children in the Buenos Aires district.  It is a community that devotes itself to agriculture, commerce, and working with livestock.  It is located in the Morropon Province in the Piura Región on the northern coast of Peru.

Together with her husband, he raises cattle and grows bananas that she sells in the market in her district.

She has requested a loan for 1,000 soles to buy fertilizers for her banana crop.  This way she will have a timely production to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the banana crop.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en: Hamadi appreciates the support for his previous loans, which helped him to improve his business .Now he comes to you requesting a loan to buy another audio speaker for the business. He dreams of expanding his business to meet his customers' needs on demand.

loans.use: to buy another audio speaker for his business

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama operates a stall selling grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр занимается сельским хозяйством и выращиванием овощей на своем земельном участке. Дело свое любит, но без трудностей не бывает. Не всегда получается сдавать весь урожай после того, как он собран и тогда приходится снижать цену на товар и это бьет по карману. Но Александр не сдается, упорно трудясь и вкладывая в свое хозяйство силы и финансы. Недавно за счет увеличения дохода и полученной прибыли он смог дополнительно купить для бизнеса микроавтобус Мерседес. 
Сумма в 15 000 гривен ему нужна для того, чтобы закупить картошку на посадку. Как раз сейчас идет сезон высаживания картошки, поэтому хочет не упустить момент и купить побольше картофеля, чтобы потом получить урожай побогаче и доход побольше.
texts.en:
Alexander works in agriculture and grows vegetables on his plot of land. He loves his business but it is never without difficulties. He is not always successful in selling his entire harvest after he gathers it so then he must lower the price of his goods, which puts a strain on his resources. But Alexander does not give up - he works hard and invests all of his strength and finances into his business. Not long ago, thanks to an increase in his income and received profits, he was able to also purchase a Mercedes minibus for his business.

He needs 15,000 hryvnia (UAH) to buy potato seedlings for planting. As it is currently right in the middle of the season for planting potatoes, he wants to seize the opportunity and buy more potatoes. This will then bring him a more bountiful harvest and more income.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Villarrica, es estudiante de la carrera de Derecho, donde él está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Juan de aquí a 4 años se ve trabajando en su profesión y ayudando a las personas que necesiten de él.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su universidad, con lo cual podrá cubrir ese gasto y seguir estudiando. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Villarrica and is studying for a law degree. He is putting forth his best effort so that he can become someone in life.

Juan has been working four years at his profession and helping people who need him.

The requested loan will be invested in his university fees, which will cover his expenses and allow him to continue studying. He is grateful for the opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Oysha

texts.en: Oysha is widowed. She lives with her sister in the south part of Tajikistan. She has her own business. She has sold food items for more than 21 years. She has great experience in this field and runs her business well. Oysha has regular customers; for this, she thanks good service and high quality of food items. Particularly, she sells candies and chocolates. Oysha’s sister helps her with managing her business. She is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy candies and chocolates for the household. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy candies and chocolates for her household

loans.name: Washinton

texts.es:
Washinton vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo y se dedica a la agricultura. Paucartambo se característica por tener paisajes hermosos y ser la ciudad folclórica del departamento del Cusco. La mayoría de los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y crianza de animales. En el mes de julio se celebra la festividad de la virgen de Carmen y llegan de diferentes lugares del Perú para esta fiesta que se extiende por tres días.

Washinton durante todo el año se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, trigo, cebada, avena, habas y otras cosas, él es uno de los prestamistas del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” y tiene varios años participando. En esta ciudad no existe entidad financieras permanentes como la Asociación Arariwa entonces él se presta dinero desde hace varios años atrás entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para compra abono.

Washinton está agradecido por el apoyo brindado y se compromete a pagar con mucha responsabilidad y puntualidad las cuotas.
texts.en:
Washinton lives in the city of Paucartambo and works in agriculture. Paucartambo is known for its beautiful countryside and for being the department of Cusco's city of folklore. The majority of the residents earn their livings in farming and livestock production. In the month of July, the festival of the Virgin of Carmen is celebrated, and people come from all over Peru for this three-day party.

Washinton works throughout the year in farming; he has several fields of crops where he grows potatoes, wheat, barley, oats, broad beans, and other things. He is one of the borrowers of the "Nuevo Amanecer" [New Dawn] communal bank and has been for several years. In this city, there are no permanent financial entities like Asociación Arariwa, so he has borrowed money for several years. At this time, he needs the loan to purchase fertilizer. 

Washinton is grateful for the support provided, and he promises to make his loan payments responsibly and punctually.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ermitaña

texts.es:
La socia Ermitaña tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de elaboracion de helados y tambien la socia vende yogures,la socia vende a las diferentes tiendas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de venta de helados y yogures.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos como leche y azucar. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ermitaña is 49 years old and married. She has two children. Ermitaña makes a living making ice creams and selling yoghurts. Ermitaña sells to different stores, working from 8am until 6pm. Through this business, she has been able to help her children to prosper. Ermitaña's dream is to expand her business. She is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies such as milk and sugar.

Ermitaña is happy with this loan and promises to make her repayments,

loans.use: to buy supplies such as milk and sugar.

loans.name: Luz Marlene

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito El Oro De Montecristi que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Luz, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  20, 18 y 14 años, los dos menores  estudian en colegio. Su esposo es maestro pintor.
Doña Luz es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudarle a su marido con la dura carga del hogar desde hace 10 años empezó un pequeño negocio en su casa, ella vende sodas, aguas, jugos entre otras bebidas, a pesar de que su negocio no es muy grande sus ganancias le permiten darles a sus hijos para sus estudios y en ocasiones para solventar los gastos de alimentación cuando su marido no tiene trabajo.
Este crédito es para comprar aguas, sodas, jugos, energizantes entre otras bebidas que vende. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos financia su pequeño negocio. Sus sueños es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios
texts.en:
The Credit Group El Oro de Montecristi which gets together every fifteen days in the Montecristi canton. Montecristi is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its artesan crafts, which are renowned at an international and national level. It is also the place where the famous straw hats come from. This is where Señora Luz lives; she is 43 years old, married and has three children of 20, 18 and 14 years old. The two younger children study in high school. Her husband is a master painter. 

Doña Luz is a very good mother and wife, and in order to help her husband with the large responsibility of their home began a small business in her home 10 years ago. She sells sodas, water, juices and other beverages. Despite the fact that her business is not very big, her income permits her to provide for her children for their studies and on occasion to settle the costs of food when her husband does not have work. 

This loan is to purchase water, sodas, juices and energy drinks among other beverages that she sells. This is her third cycle in the Credit Group and she likes it because it is thanks to the loans that she finances her small business. Her dream is that her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase water, sodas, juices, energy drinks and other beverages.

loans.name: Sichan's Group

texts.en: Sichan is a villager from the Battambang province and a married mother of five children, currently only one of whom is reliant on her. She grows rice as the main source of her income, which she has occupied for ages. She also earns extra income from her spare job as a paid worker for a fee. This is the sixth time that she is borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely paid back her past loans already. Now, she leads a group of two to get a new loan. She is seeking a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting a loan of 500,000 KHR. As a leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income greater than before.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Dayanna Katerin

texts.es:
Ella es Dayanna Katerin, el mundo del arte gráfico y la publicidad es un mundo fascinante donde pone a filo la creatividad, entrar a este mundo es entrar a  medios gráficos y hasta la Internet, es una profesión muy amplia, y hasta divertida, porque esta carrera no es un trabajo de oficina, es un trabajo más de acción, imaginar y hacer lo que ella quiera, un publicista es como un general, porque el es quien creativa mente planifica y gráfica como una empresa va ha atacar en esta guerra comercial, es como un juego pero en la vida real, ella es la que conduce esa batalla, estudiar esta carrera es casi un sueño, las expectativas de esta carrera es aprender, dibujar, graficar, diseñar, animar, pintar, agarrar una cámara claro esta también  la parte teórica como marketing. 

Estudiar esta carrera es para aquellas personas que sienten que cuentan en el haber con una gran habilidad para crear, para bocetar ideas en diferentes soportes, ya sea a través de un ordenador, en papel o por medio de maquetas. 
Esta carrera transmite unir la creatividad con las artes digitales, brinda los conceptos necesarios para tener experiencia en el desarrollo de la comunicación visual. Enseña a manipular los distintos aspectos de una imagen y a desarrollar el aspecto creativo a través del logro de un objetivo puntual en relación al diseño publicitario.

Muchas personas no pueden estudiar lo que les gusta ya que los costos son altos, pero esta institución cuenta con muchos beneficios  de gran ayuda como lo es KIVA, que ofrece un subsidio  y ayuda a que se pueda estudiar pagando una mensualidad un  poco mas económica, que para katerin seria de gran ayuda para que pueda terminar este semestre con total satisfacción y muy animada por la carrera que escogió.
texts.en:
Her name is Dayanna Katerin. The world of graphic art and advertising is a fascinating world with cutting-edge creativity. To enter this world is to enter print media and even the Internet. It is a very broad profession, and even fun, because this profession is not an office job. It is a job with more action, imagination, and allows Dayanna to do whatever she wants. A publicist is like a general, because they creatively plan and plot like a company is going to attack in this trade war. It is like a game but in real life. She is leading this battle. Studying this career is almost a dream. The expectations for this profession is to learn, draw, graph, design, animate, paint, and grab a camera. There is also the theoretical element, such as marketing. 

Studying this profession is for those who feel they have the great ability to create; to sketch ideas in different media, either through a computer, on paper or through models. This profession conveys to unite creativity with digital arts. It provides the necessary concepts to have experience in the development of visual communication, to manipulate various aspects of an image, and develop the creative side through the achievement of a target pony in relation to advertising design.

Many people can not study what they like because the costs are high, but this institution has many helpful benefits such as KIVA, which offers a loan and helps one to study by paying a more affordable monthly payment, which for Katerin would be very helpful. It would help her finish her semester with complete satisfaction and very happy about the career that she has chosen.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school

loans.name: Loem's Group

texts.en: Loem, 50 years old, is a villager from Battambang province. She is a widowed mother of five children. The main source of her income is from rice farming which she has been involved in for 30 years. This current business has returned her with a decent income to support her household. Now, she is seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she formed a group of three members, all of whom are in their first loan cycle. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. Loem will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She strongly hopes that this purchase will boost her crop yield so they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Rowe Erdulfo

texts.es:
Rowe  vive en el distrito de los Aquijes, es un joven que trabaja muy duro cada día, labora en un fundo agrícola como vigilante y en algunas oportunidades trabaja como obrero lo cual le permite y este trabajo le permite tener ingresos para poder salir adelante; el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable.

Rowe está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá comprar un cama y una cómoda, ya que actualmente duerme en una cama de fierro, la cual se encuentra muy oxidada, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño: Tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Rowe lives in the district of Los Aquijes. He is a young man who works very hard every day. He works at an agricultural country estate as a security guard and sometimes he works as a laborer at an estate. This job allows him to have income so he can get ahead. He believes that thing are going well for him in his job because he is very responsible.

Rowe is grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to the help they have provided that will be able to buy a bed and a chest of drawers. He currently sleeps on an iron bed, which is very rusted. In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working to make a reality of his biggest dream: To have his own business.

loans.use: to buy a bed and a chest of drawers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, flour, and sugar to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, pure water and cigarettes to expand her business.

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is a 37-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, while the third is yet too young to attend. Living in a village of the Sangke district, Sambath has been farming rice for 11 years, and sometimes she also works for others for a fee. She can earn about 45,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Having repaid her previous four loans, Sambath is now leading her group to request a new one. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza vive en la ciudad de Camaná, es madre de un pequeño de 2 años de edad, al cual quiere mucho y por quien trabaja muy duro como obrera agrícola, para poder salir adelante. Lorenza trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día como obrera agrícola y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy amable y sobre todo responsable.

Lorenza está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para poder construir un muro de seguridad en su vivienda y poder realizar la nivelación de su terreno, de esta manera podrá mejorar su vivienda y tener una mayor seguridad para su pequeño, así ella seguirá trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener toda su casa construida”.
texts.en:
Lorenza lives in the city of Camaná. She is the mother of a 2 year-old child who she loves very much and for whom she works very hard to be able to get ahead in life. Lorenza works around 8 hours a day as an agricultural worker and believes her work is going well because she is very kind and overall responsible.

Lorenza is very grateful to the Kiva lenders as thanks to the assistance that they have provided her, she will be able to buy construction materials to be able to build a security wall in her home and level the ground. in this way, she will be able to improve her housing and have more security for her child. She will continue working to to make her great dream a reality: "to have her whole house built".

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es: Doña María, tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene 8 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá junto a 4 de sus hijos y su esposo. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultiva papas y hortalizas como  brócoli, coliflor y otros. Las papas son vendidas en el mercado local de la  comunidad. Esta solicitando el quinto ciclo de préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar semillas y abonos para dar mantenimiento y sembrar papas, con el propósito de incrementar la producción y ventas para ayudar a crecer a sus hijos pequeños.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old, married with eight children and she lives in a small village in the city of Intibucá with her husband and four of her children. She has always worked in agriculture. She grows potatoes and vegetables like broccoli, cauliflower and others. The potatoes are sold in the local community market.

She is requesting her fifth loan which is for 15,000 Honduran Lempiras. With this loan she will buy seeds and fertilizer to plant and grow potatoes, with the intention of increasing production and sales to help her raise her small children.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer to plant and grow potatoes.

loans.name: Sendiya

texts.ru:
Сендия — из Виноградово. У нее  - свой магазинчик, где семья торгует разными товарами. Не так давно Сендия смогла купить в магазин морозильную камеру, что помогло существенно расширить ассортимент товаров в магазине. Недавно в семье Сендии родился еще один сын, что всегда связано с дополнительными доходами. 
За счет полученных от КИВА средств Сендия хотела бы улучшить свои жилищные условия, так как хочется большего комфорта в доме для детей. Она планирует сделать ремонт в котельной и на кухне, а именно, покрасить стены, облицевать керамической плиткой пол, сделать потолки на кухне и в котельной.
texts.en:
Sendiya is from Vinogradovo. She has her own tiny shop where her family sells different kinds of merchandise. Not long ago, Sendiya was able to buy a freezer for her store which helped her to fundamentally expand the assortment of merchandise in her store. Recently, another son was born into Sendiya's family, which is always connected with additional income.

With the received money from KIVA, Sendiya would like to improve her living conditions, as she wants to make her home more comfortable for her children. She plans to do renovations on her boiler room and kitchen, specifically painting the walls, covering the floor with tiles and fixing the ceiling in both rooms.

loans.use: to renovate her boiler room and kitchen.

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es: “VIRGEN DE GUADALUPE” está conformada por socios dedicados a diversas actividades del comercio minorista y a prestar servicios. Felicitas tiene 51 años de edad es conviviente con 03 hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de anticuchos alitas tripitas en forma ambulatoria. Años atrás de dedicaba a la venta de golosinas en las afueras de un centro educativo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más pollo tripitas y platos tenedores descartables. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Felicitas es la primera persona sentada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
"Virgen de Guadalupe" is composed of partners who make their living at various retail and service occupations. Felicitas is 51 years old and is in a civil union with 3 independent children. She sells kebabs of tripe and chicken wings as a street vendor. Years ago she also sold candy outside an educational center. The loan will be used to buy more chicken, tripe, and disposable plates and forks. 

The group is thankful to the Kiva investors for the offered loan. Felicitas is the first person seated on the right side.

loans.use: to buy more chicken, tripe, and disposable plates and forks

loans.name: Caritas Felices Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo”CARITAS FELICES” se encuentran muy contentos por encontrarse pasando el 07 ciclo. Walter tiene 32 años de edad es soltero dedicado a brindar servicios de taxi hace 02 años. Y a la vez es regidor de la zona en el cual radica. El crédito lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su auto. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Walter es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho.
texts.en:
Members of the group "CARITAS FELICES" (Happy Faces) are very happy to be going on their 7th cycle.

Walter is 32 years old, a bachelor, and has worked at providing taxi services for the past two years. He is also an alderman in the area where he lives.
