The loan will be invested in maintaining his car. The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan provided. Walter is the second person standing on the right side.

loans.use: to maintain his automobile.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: El señor Edwin  tiene 37 años, tiene un hijo de la edad de 22 años, ella se dedica a la venta  de variedad de productos de uso personal en su anaquel que se encuentran en la zona de Alto San Antonio, este préstamo es su primera secuencia con la institución,  el  señor Edwin  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería para su negocio como desodorantes, dentífrico dental, jaboncillos, etc, para surtir  su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que el  señor Edwin  necesita equiparse bien de productos ya que esta época es de mucha  venta de sus productos, el  señor Edwin  es una persona trabajadora desde muy temprana edad empezó a trabajar vendiendo distintos productos y ya con el tiempo desea tener una tienda donde pueda Ofrecer sus productos al por mayor.
texts.en: Edwin, 37, has a 22-year-old son. He sells a variety of personal use items in his mobile shelf, located in the area of Alto San Antonio. This loan is his first time working with the lending partner institution, and he will use the money to buy merchandise such as deodorant, toothpaste, soap, etc to stock his business. Edwin needs to stock up on products because this time of the year is high in sales. Edwin is a hardworking person who started to work very young selling different products. With time, he wants to have a store where he can offer his products wholesale.

loans.use: to buy different products

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra papa, cebada, trigo, manzanas, membrillos y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la agricultura y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas.(Este préstamo es parte de una de las linea de créditos de la Asociación Arariwa "Credi Yapa", que permite a los prestatarios con un buen historial crediticio recibir un especial préstamo: un pequeño préstamo y además de su préstamo regular.)

 
Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto works in agriculture and has various lands of crops where he grows potatoes, barley, wheat, apples and quince among other crops. He has already worked many years in agriculture and he has done well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. For this opportunity he needs a loan to buy seeds.
 
This loan is part of the “Credi Yapa” line of credit from the Asociacion Arariwa, which allows borrowers with a great credit history to receive a special loan. This small loan is given in addition to the regular loan.

Luis Alberto appreciates and values this loan and agrees to comply with the monthly payments with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Mireya Lili

texts.es:
San Miguel de los Bancos el Cantón del Amor, un Cantón de clima cálido húmedo, el mismo cuenta varios sitios de descanso que son muy visitado por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, como tradición tienen las fiestas del Cantón en las cuales se realizan bailes populares y la famosa quema del castillo la gente en este Cantón es muy amable y tranquila con todos sus visitantes. 
En el mismo vive trabaja y tiene el negocio la señora Mireya una mujer luchadora de 49 años ella es madre soltera por lo que tuvo que luchar muy duro para salir adelante junto con su hijo, el hoy en día ya es un profesional gracias al esfuerzo de la mamá ella como muchos en este Cantón se dedica al negocio de la producción de pollos, un negocio que aprendió por su propia iniciativa, trabaja un promedio de 12 horas diarias entre en negocio y el empleo que tiene como profesora de escuela. 
Solicita este préstamo para invertir en el negocio para arreglar y ampliarlo para incrementar la producción de pollos, con esta inversión mejoraran los ingresos económicos y continuara con la construcción de su vivienda, la señora Mireya agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo y las oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
San Miguel de los Bancos, the canton of love, has a warm, humid climate. It has several places for leisure that are popular with tourists from Ecuador and abroad. The canton has traditional festivals during which popular dances and the famous "burning of the castle" [a pyrotechnics display] are performed. The people of this canton are very friendly and easygoing with all their visitors. 

In this canton, Mireya lives, works, and has her business. She is a determined, 49-year-old woman. She is a single mother, so she had to fight very hard to provide for herself and her son. He is now a professional, thanks to the efforts of his mother. 

Like many in this canton, Mireya is in the business of chicken production. She learned the business on her own, and she works an average of twelve hours a day between this business and her job as a teacher in a school.

She is requesting this loan to invest in her business, to repair and expand it in order to increase her production of chickens. With this investment, her income will improve and she will continue with the construction of her house. Señora Mireya thanks Fundación Alternativa and Kiva for the support and the opportunities provided.

loans.use: to invest in, repair, and expand her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aida tiene 21 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive en el domicilio de sus padres, su principal actividad es la venta de verduras y hortalizas que la realiza en un mercado de Monteagudo, trabaja  para poder salir adelante e independizarse,  asi mismo quiere obtener mas ingresos para pagar sus estudios,  ya que por falta de recursos económicos, dejo de estudiar para ponerse a trabajar cuando estaba cursando la carrera de administración de empresas en una universidad de chuquisaca, ahora no tiene dependientes y trabaja junto  a su madre, como no tiene muchos recursos se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para invertir en la adquisición de verduras al por mayor para su venta posterior y así también poder agarrar otro puesto de venta en el mercado central que le permita mejorar sus ingresos y por ende pueda tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Aida, 21, is single and lives in her parents' house.  Currently she has no dependents and she works with her mother.  Her principal job is selling vegetables in a market of Monteagudo.  She works so she can get ahead and go out on her own.

Aida also wants to earn more income to pay for her studies.  She was studying business administration in a university in Chuquisaca, but she had to stop going to school and get a job because she lacked the financial resources.  

She doesn't have a lot of money, so she needs to request a loan to buy vegetables wholesale.  She also wants to secure another sales stall in the main market so she can improve her income and, consequently, have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables wholesale

loans.name: Rumalda Juliana

texts.es:
Rumalda vive en la ciudad de Huaraz, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y empeño en su pequeño negocio de venta de alfalfa desde hace 10 años, con lo cual ha podido sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos; Rumalda ofrece su producto al frente  una tienda de su ciudad y trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es amable con sus clientes.

Rumalda esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar fardos de alfalfa para poder ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y así seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa”
texts.en:
Rumalda lives in the city of Huaraz.  She's a woman with a great desire to get ahead.  Every day for 10 years she has worked with a lot of effort and dedication in her small business selling alfalfa, and has managed to get her three children ahead.  Rumalda sells her product in front of a store in her city and works around nine hours a day.  She believes the business is going well for her because she's friendly with her customers.

Rumalda's very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy bundles of alfalfa to sell to her customers.  That way she'll be able to improve her income and continue striving to achieve her big dream of finishing building her house.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa wholesale

loans.name: Jhon Alexander

texts.es: Jhon con  27 años de edad, es un joven que tiene muchas aspiraciones para su futuro, desde hace aproximadamente dos años inició su propio negocio de venta de mercancías por pedido, lo que le ha representado buenas ganancias a través de una red de mercadeo.  Jhon sueña con incrementar las ventas y tener un buen inventario en mercancías para satisfacer las necesidades y gustos de sus clientas.  El préstamo que Jhon ha solicitado los invertirá comprando ropa de marca reconocida en el mercado, con ello atraerá muchos nuevos clientes que gustan de lo moderno y  de muy buena calidad.  Ambiciona seguir incursionando como comerciante a través de la red, donde cada día se unen para obtener grandes y mayores beneficios.
texts.en: Jhon, 27, is a young man with big dreams.  He started his own retail business, selling clothing to order, two years ago.  He says that he's one of a network of merchants that have teamed up to support one another and that he's now earning a good living.  Jhon wants to add to the range of merchandise he sells so that he can meet demand from his customers and increase his revenue.  He will use this loan to buy branded merchandise that sells well in this market.  The investment will attract new customers that only want up-to-date merchandise of good quality.  Jhon is ambitious for himself and the other members of the network who have banded together to build their businesses.

loans.use: to stock his retail clothing business.

loans.name: Aida Esperanza

texts.es: Aida es una señora separada de su esposo, ella tiene 35 años de edad y cuida a sus 2 hijas de  11 y 14 años que se encuentran asistiendo a la escuela, esta señora lucha constantemente para salir adelante junto a sus hijas, ella se dedica desde hace 15 años a la crianza  de animales menores como cuyes, pollos y chancho, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos en chanchera, dice que le va bien en este negocio ya que para mantener a estos animales no es muy costoso ya que les alimenta con papas, balanceado y en su mayoría les da desperdicios, la mayor aspiración de Aida es crecer en su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos para darle lo necesario a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Aida, 36, is divorced from her husband and she cares for her two daughters, ages 11 and 14 who attend school.  This woman struggles constantly to get ahead together with her daughters.  For 15 years she has been raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens and pigs.  She plans to use the loan to buy pigs for her pig pen.  She says business is going well since it is not too expensive to maintain these animals.  She feeds them potatoes, balanced animal feed and tablescraps.

Aida's greatest goal is to expand her business and increase her income so she can give her daughters everything they need.

loans.use: to buy pigs for her pig pen

loans.name: Neang Group

texts.en: Neang is 48 years old. She is a married woman who has seven children, in Prey Veny Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Neang is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of this group’s loan to buy the ground parts for a latrine. This loan can help her family live in good condition. In the future, she hopes that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts for a latrine.

loans.name: Nabirakan

texts.ru: Набиракан 62 года, замужем, есть 5 взрослых и самостоятельных детей, которые активно помогают по хозяйству. У Набиракан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Набиракан уже более 42 лет занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки скота на 5,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Набиракан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 5 лошадей и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Набиракан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку овец для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Набиракан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Nabirakan is 62 years old, married and has five grown-up and self-sufficient children who actively help her with her farm. Nabirikan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Nabirikan practices livestock breeding. She started this business more than 42 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nabirakan's hard work, she currently has 4 milk cows, 5 horses and 15 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Nabirakan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep to fatten up and later sell at the market for a high price. Nabirakan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock and to get a good harvest. She is also determined to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is married  They live at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operates a clothes-selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the KES 80,000 loan she is requesting she wants to purchase four bales of clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to boost the school operations by buying scholastic materials

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past five years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business. and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Zamirbek

texts.ru: Замирбеку 26 лет, не женат, детей нет. Замирбек ведет свой бизнес. Стартовав в 2008 году с суммы в 30,000 сомов (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Замирбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, а также земельная доля размером 1,30 ГА, на которой он ежегодно выращивает помидоры, перец, дыни и огурцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 13,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замирбек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на использование кредита на сбор урожая, а точнее Замирбек намерен купить минеральные удобрения, семена и клеенку для постройки теплиц.  Доходы от кредита Замирбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, постройку нового сарая, а также планирует накопить средства на завершение строительства жилого дома.
texts.en: Zamirbek is 26 years old, single and does not have any children. Zamirbek runs his own business. He started this business in 2008 with 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zamirbek's hard work, he currently has 3 milk cows on his farm, as well as a 1.30 hectare plot of land on which annually grows tomatoes, peppers, melons and cucumbers. His monthly income is 13,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing his business, Zamirbek turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan to plant crops, more specifically Zamirbek is determined to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and oil cloth for building a greenhouse. Zamirbek plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock and to build a new barn. He also intends to save money to finish construction on his house.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, seeds, and oil cloth for building a greenhouse.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru: Она Мамлакат. Ей 43 года. Она родом из района Шахритус. В Шахритусе большая часть населения занимается скотоводством. Причина, по которой такая деятельность является популярной это свежий воздух и благоприятный климат Республики Таджикистана. Мамлакат не хочет отставать от односельчан и обосновывает новый бизнес в сфере животноводства. Она хочет закупить несколько голов скота, чтобы начать бизнес. Мамлакату любит животных и ей нравиться ухаживать за ними. Она просит $2000, чтобы купить необходимое количество бычков и телят. Мамлакат намерена заняться таким бизнесом еще на долго и она просит ее поддержать в осуществлении планов.
texts.en: This is Mamlakat. She is 43 years old. She is a native of the Shahrituz District. In Shahrituz, the majority of the population practices cattle breeding. The reason why this business is so popular is that the Republic of Tajikistan has fresh air and an advantageous climate. Mamlakat does not want to lag behind her fellow villagers and wants to establish a new business in the sphere of livestock breeding. She wants to buy several heads of cattle in order to start her business. Mamlakat loves animals and lives to look after them. She is requesting 2000 USD to buy the necessary amount of bull calves and calves. Mamlakat is determined to run this kind of business for a long time. She is requesting that you support her in realizing her plans.

loans.use: to buy calves to start her new livestock breeding business.

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: A hardworking woman from a rural area needs financial support.  Bashorat was born in 1962.  She is married and has a child, and is a well-educated person. She also has businesses in sewing and farming. She has been busy with growing vegetables, such as potatoes and carrots. Bashorat has her own land and works hard to earn a living. Her husband helps her with managing the business. Bashorat does not have enough money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers to sow. She is asking for a loan of 3000 Somoni (TJS) to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 23 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past year, Agatha has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells raw food and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Agatha has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw bananas and charcoal to sell, and will help Agatha to generate greater profits and expand her business to add even a chicken business. Agatha hopes that in the future she will be able to own a chicken farm. 

Agatha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw bananas and charcoal to sale,

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado debido a la situación económica que vivían tubo que dejar la escuela para trabajar, esta acompañado, su pareja tiene una venta de tortillas, tiene dos hijos y nadie mas vive con ellos.

Rafael se dedica a trabajar de jornalero desde que tenia 10 años, trabaja en una ladrillera, este trabajo lo aprendió de su papá y unos tíos, trabaja desde hace 6 meses en una empresa de seguridad, su horario es de 24 horas dentro y 24 horas fuera, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la ladrillera la cual queda a 5 minutos de su casa, su  hora de levantarse es a las 4:30: am


El préstamo sera utilizado en la compra de una vaca parida, para tener leche y darle a sus hijos. Sueña que sus hijos estudien y se preparan, oportunidad que él no tubo, cambiar el techo de su casa ya que el que tiene esta deteriorado y  pagar el crédito a tiempo y dejar las puertas abiertas a futuros.
texts.en:
Rafael is 30 years old and only has a 5th grade education due to his family's financial situation while he was growing up.  He had to quit school in order to work.  He is married and his wife works selling tortillas.  He has two grown that don't live with him.

Rafael has worked as a brick layer since he was 10 years old.  He learned how to do it from his father and some of his uncles.  He has been working for a security company for 6 months and works half inside and half outside.  In his free time he works at a brickworks which is 5 minutes from his house.  He wakes up at 4:30 am.

This loan will be used to buy a milk cow so as to obtain milk and give it to his children.  He dreams of allowing his children to go to school, which is an opportunity that he didn't have.  He also wants to replace the roof of his house since it is in disrepair.  He wants to pay off his loan on time so he will be able to take out more loans in the future.

loans.use: buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Lay's Group

texts.en: Lay, 61, is a villager from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a married mother of six children. To cover her family’s expenses, she does rice farming as the main source of income and does paid-working jobs in order to add more income. She can earn about 19,400 KHR per day.  Including this loan, she is in her fifth loan cycle with one of her joint borrowers requesting a loan amount of 1,200,000 KHR each while the remaining borrower is in her sixth cycle with the applying loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR. Lay, who is the leader of this group consisting of three, will spend her portion to pay the farmland smoothening fee and to buy rice seeds. She hopes that her rice will gain more crop yield than before.

loans.use: to pay the farmland smoothening fee and to buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Margaret operates a stall at the market selling vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors. Her challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. 

With the 30,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Nin

texts.en:
Nen, 55, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Bovel district. She has seven children. To make a living, she has been farming rice, growing sesame, and planting corn for 15 years, and the current business earns her family about 70,000 KHR per day. 

Nen is just with VisionFund for this cycle and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is applying for a loan. As the leader, Nen is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Om- Saed Group

texts.en:
The members of the Om- Saed Group are five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and neighborhood ties. They requested a loan of 230,000 YER.

Fatima is the leader of the group and is 44 years old. She is a very vigorous woman and works as a housewife. She says that the furniture of her house is very old. She can't afford that. So Fatima decided to make improvements in her house through furnishing her house again. As a result of that decision, Fatima applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She hopes that her house will be soon in a better order. She will use the loan to buy new furniture for the house. She is happy and hopes to get a lot of support in order to finish the renovation of her house.

 Fatima hopes to renovate the first floor and build the second and furnish it in order to rent.

loans.use: To buy new furniture for the house

loans.name: Damjin

texts.en:
Mr. Damjin, 46 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between cities since 2010. His wife runs a pharmacy and their eldest daughter works at a mining company. Their son goes to high school while the youngest daughter is educated at kindergarten. 

He is requesting a loan of 5 000,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his truck- income generator. After repairing old parts of his truck, he will be ready for the work as lots of transportation requests come during this period of time. The borrower is a hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his truck

loans.name: Kunde

texts.en:
Kunde is a married woman  She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She operates a grocery vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town-dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, three crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, three crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Hoeung's Group

texts.en:
Hoeung is a villager from Kampong Cham province and she is 62 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming on two hectares of farmland. She can earn extra income via paid-working job to supplement her income. 

The first loan cycle, which she has fully repaid back, has helped her to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. Now, she is in a second-cycle loan and she is a team leader of a group consisting of seven members. She and her joint-borrowers are requesting a loan in the total amount of 8,200,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. 

As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that her rice farming will enable her to have enough financial support for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Alex David

texts.es: Alex, tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su hermano y madre en el municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. El se ha dedicado a trabajar como maestro para adultos, pero hace 3 años estableció una pulpería para obtener ingresos y ayudar a su familia. vende harina, jabón, manteca, arroz, huevos, condimentos, medicamentos comunes, frijoles, lácteos etc. Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo por 20,000 Lempiras para surtir con carnes, embutidos, granos básicos, condimentos, lácteos, verduras, productos de aseo etc. Su plan es hacer el local del negocio más grande, y quiere terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Alex is 29 years old. He is single. He lives with his brother and his mother in the municipality of Quimistán, Santa Bárbara. He works as a teacher for adult students, but 3 years ago he started a small grocery store to make an income and help his family. He sells flour, soap, shortening, rice, eggs, condiments, common medications, beans, dairy products, etc. He has requested his fourth loan for 20,000.00 HNL (Honduran Lempiras) to stock up on meats, lunch meats, basic grains, condiments, dairy products, vegetables, cleaning products, etc. His plan is to expand his business space, and he wants to finish his studies.

loans.use: to stock meats, lunch meats, basic grains, condiments, dairy products, vegetables, cleaning products, etc

loans.name: Kimsrorn's Group

texts.en: Originally from the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province, Kimsrorn is 38 years old and the mother of four kids. Currently, one of them is under her responsibility and still in school. To feed the family, she does scarf weaving as the main source of income and she can earn extra income from working factory jobs. She has been in the weaving business for 18 years and it has returned her about 38,900 KHR per day. This is the second cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has completely repaid her past loan. The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to support her business on time. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to start a new business selling vegetables. She hopes that this new business will return triple the income so that she can keep her kid in school.

loans.use: to start a new business selling vegetables

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 19 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her small outside restaurant, which sells fried chicken, Irish potatoes, and fried fish. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chicken, cooking oil, and plates for the business, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and expand the business into a bigger restaurant. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger restaurant. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken, cooking oil, and plates for the business,

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor es un joven entusiasta de 21 años de edad, lastimosamente solo estudió hasta quinto grado, y ya no pudo continuar por cuestiones de tiempo y dinero, actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres juntos con sus 3 hermanas.


Victor aprendió a cultivar cuando su padre lo llevaba a la milpa, luego decidió hacer sus cultivos por si mismo y cultiva una hectárea de granos básicos, y el trabajo lo hace con muchas ganas.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar 2 sacos de abono, 2 sacos de sulfato de amonio, una caneca de herbicida, grano certificado e insecticidas para la siembra que ya pronto se acerca.

Su sueño es formar su propia familia y darles un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Victor is an enthusiastic, 21-year-old young man.  Unfortunately he was only able to go to school up to the 5th grade due to having to work and earn money for his family.  He lives with his parents and his 3 sisters in their house.

Victor learned how to farm from his father and later decided to do it on his own.  He farms one hectare of basic grains and enjoys his work.

He is asking for a loan so he can buy 2 bags of manure, 2 bags of ammonium sulfate, one bottle of herbicide, high-quality seeds, and insecticides.  He will use these things to plant since the season for planting is coming up.

His dream is to start his own family and give them a good future.

loans.use: buy 2 bags of manure, 2 bags of ammonium sulfate, one bottle of herbicide, high-quality seeds, and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Julio Eduardo

texts.es:
Julio de 49 años de edad, solo estudio hasta 9º grado, esta casado y su esposa le ayuda a trabajar en la agricultura, solo 2 hijos viven en la casa, uno de ellos esta estudiando.

Julio actualmente trabaja  en la agricultura, trabajo que ha realizado desde que era niño y lo aprendió de un tío, ya que su padre falleció cuando era un niño, tenia que aprender la agricultura para ganarse la vida y ayudar a sus hermanos y su madre, también trabaja con  una bomba de agua, con ella riega cultivos ajenos, él estuvo un tiempo en Estados Unidos,se vino porque sus hijos eran adolescentes, al trabajo le ayudan su hijo mayor y su esposa.


Julio utilizara el préstamo para sacar un cultivo de maíz que ya tiene, donde él vive se trabaja a base de riegos y están por terminar el cultivo.
 

El sueño de Julio es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que salgan adelante, darles la ayuda necesaria para que formen sus vidas, es un gran reto, pero puede salir adelante.
texts.en:
Julio is 49 years old. He only studied through 9th grade. He is married and his wife helps him work in agriculture. Only 2 children live in their household, and one of them is studying.

Julio currently works in agriculture, which he has done since he was a boy. He learned it from an uncle because his father died when he was a boy. He had to learn agriculture to earn a living and help his siblings and his mother. He also works with a water pump, which he uses to irrigate other people’s crops. He lived for a while in the United States. He came back because his children were teenagers. His oldest son and his wife help him in his work.

Julio will use the loan to harvest a corn crop he also has planted. Where he lives, they work based on irrigation and they are ready to finish up with this crop.

Julio’s dream is to help his children get ahead in life, to give them the help they need to start their lives. It’s a big challenge, but he can get ahead.

loans.use: to harvest his corn crop.

loans.name: Oigul

texts.ru: Ойгул 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Ойгул - среднее-специальное образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Ойгул занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 2008 году с 30,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Ойгул на сегодняшний день имеет: 2 дойные коровы и свой парник, где выращивает помидоры, перец и огурцы. Кроме этого Ойгул работает медицинской сестрой. Ее общие доходы составляют примерно 13,000 сомов (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Ойгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений, семян элитного сорта, и клеенки для парника. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в постройку большого сарая, а в дальнейшем хочет приобрести автомобиль и построить новый дом.
texts.en: Oigul is 35 years old, married and together with her husband, is raising three children. Oigul has a secondary-specialized education. As the main source of income for her family, Oigul practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business in 2008 with 30,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Oigul's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows on her farm as well as her own hothouse where she grows tomatoes, peppers and cucumbers. Besides that, Oigul works as a nurse. Her monthly cumulative income is 13,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Oigul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizers, high quality seeds and oilcloth for her hothouse. Oigul plans to invest the earnings from the loan to build a large barn. She also wants to buy a car and build a new home in the future.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers, high quality seeds and oilcloth for her hothouse.

loans.name: Seang Leng's Group

texts.en:
Seng Leng is a resident of Chheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is aged 47 and a married mother of five children. Nowadays, only two kids are relying on her and they are school age. 

To make a living, she does rice cropping and a paid-working job at a construction site as the main source of her income. She has been involved in her current business since she was 20 years old. She and her joint borrowers are former borrowers with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), which was used to get the first loan before,  with a successful repayment. 

For this cycle, she and four of her co-borrowers are applying for 1,200,000 KHR each, while a remaining one is seeking for 800,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crop. She hopes that she can gain more income than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: José Eduardo

texts.es:
José tiene 70 años de edad, es una persona acompañada que estudió hasta sexto grado y vive junto a su esposa e hijo.

José se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, José se levanta a las 4:30 AM con su hijo y esposa que le ayudan en la actividades agrícolas durante la mañana, para llegar a la parcelas camina 6  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen y luego venden la leche. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesita para sembrar (abono, semilla,alquiler de tierra, veneno, etc. )

Él planea seguir trabajando muy duro para lograr sus propósitos.
texts.en:
José is 70 years old and lives with his partner. He studied through sixth grade. He lives with his wife and a son.

José works in agriculture, a vocation he learned from his parents. José gets up at 4:30AM with his son and wife, who help him with his agricultural activities in the morning. To get to his parcels of land, he walks 6km and works during the morning. His wife takes care of the home and milks the cows they own. They later sell the milk. 

He needs the loan to buy the agricultural inputs he needs in order to plant (fertilizer, seed, rent for the land, pesticides, etc.)

The plans to continue working very hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural inputs he needs in order to plant (fertilizer, seed, rent for the land, pesticides, etc.)

loans.name: Khorn's Group

texts.en: Khorn is a resident from Kampong Cham province and a widowed mother of nine children. Rice farming is the main source for her to earn income in order to support the family and she can earn extra income via a paid-working job for supplemental income. She has been rice farming for 37 years. She is a second-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a group leader in a group consisting of five members. She and her co-borrowers are requesting a loan in the total amount of 5,600,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to expand her rice farmland via this business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Thea's Group

texts.en:
Thea is a farmer who grows rice as her main source of income in the province of Kampong Cham. She is 37 years old and a widowed mother of two children. One is in school and one is still under school-age. 

She has been involved with the rice cropping business for 18 years and it has generated her about 36,100 KHR per day. This is the first microloan for Thea with Kiva's partner VisionFund and she is a leader. She and her co-borrower are applying for a new loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. 

Thea will use her potion of the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farming. She strongly hopes to upgrade her lifestyle so it's better than it was.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her rice farming.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom is 64 years old and the widowed mother of six children, one of whom is in school. The main source of her income is rice farming. She can also earn extra income via paid-working jobs during her spare time. She has engaged in this business for ten years and it has generated about 33,600 KHR per day for her. This is the second cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and this is the first cycle for her co-member. Presently, she and her co-borrower are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,000,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay the plowing fee and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides. She hopes to increase her rice more than before.

loans.use: to pay the plowing fee and to purchase fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a single mother of five children, three of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). She has been selling Cavendish bananas and sweet bananas and has been in this business for 18 years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas and sweet bananas. She also generates additional income from selling avacado and cabbages.  She works at the market seven days every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do farming.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary operates a grocery stall selling vegetables to town dwellers and neighbors at the market. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She faces the challenge of high cost transportation to her place of operation but she appreciates the support from Yehu and Kiva.

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María de 54 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos  estudio hasta 2º grado, ella era una de las mayores de los siete hermanos y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar ,ya que su familia era muy pobre. Está casada su esposo se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura y solo tiene 2 hijos que viven con ellos y están estudiando.


María actualmente se dedica a vender pupusas en su casa y hace pan para vender, tiene 20 años de realizar esta actividad lo que aprendió de su madre antes de morir, ademas de esto ella y su esposo trabajan en la agricultura, compra de ganado pequeño y lo venden en 2 años, su hija mayor les ayuda con la venta de pupusas.


María utilizara el préstamo para comprar aceite, maíz, chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, para elaborar las pupusas y  2 vacas, para así tener mayores ingresos económicos
 

María sueña con tener un negocio de pupusas grande, tener empleadas y así descansar, ayudar a sus hijos económicamente, tener un vehículo para salir a pasear con su familia.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. Due to scarce economic resources, she studied through 2nd grade. She was the oldest of seven siblings and she had to help her parents work because her family was very poor. She is married. Her husband works in agriculture. They only have 2 children who live with them and they are studying.

María currently sells pupusas [corn torillas filled with beans, or cheese, or meat, etc.] from her house and makes bread to sell. She has been doing this for 20 years. She learned this work from her mother before she died. In addition, she and her husband both work in agriculture. She buys young cattle and sells them after 2 years. Her daughter helps her sell the pupusas. 

María will use the loan to buy cooking oil, corn, pork, quesillo cheese [similar to mozzarella], and beans for making the pupusas and also 2 cows. This way she will have improved income.

María dreams of having a big pupusa business, of having employees so she can rest, of helping her children economically, and of having a vehicle so she can go out and have a nice time with her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, corn, pork, quesillo cheese, and beans for making the pupusas and also 2 cows.

loans.name: Roberto Antonio

texts.es:
Roberto de 59 años de edad, es una persona acompañada que estudió hasta sexto grado, vive junto a su esposa e hijos.

Roberto se dedica al trabajo agrícola, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, para llegar a la parcelas camina 5  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

El préstamo solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar una novilla ya que le servirá mucho para la producción y venta de leche.

Él planea para un futuro comprar mas animales pues le gusta mucho cuidar ganado.
texts.en:
Roberto is 59 years old. He is married and went to school up to the sixth grade. He lives with his wife and children.  

Roberto works in agriculture. He learned this trade from his parents. To get to his land, he walks 5 km and works during the morning. His wife takes care of the home. 

He needs the loan he has asked for from CrediCampo to buy a heifer which will be very useful for milk production and sale. In the future, he plans to buy more animals because he really likes to care for cattle.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en: Chreb is a resident from the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 25 years old and is a young mother of two children. To support the family, she does rice farming and paid working for extra income. She has been involved with this business for ten years and it has provided her with a decent income. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for four past loans with a successful repayment history. Now, she is leading a group of two members for requesting a loan. She is seeking loan for 1,400,000 KHR and her co-borrower is requesting loan for 1,300,000 KHR. As a leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes to collect a better yield than before and to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina, tiene 46 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 4 hijos, y vive en una aldea que pertenece a Atima, Santa Bárbara con su nuera e hijos. Ella siempre a generado sus ingresos, anteriormente realizaba trabajos en jornal, luego logro realizar sus propios cultivos de café, el que  vende en pergamino en el mercado local. El préstamo que solicita es el sexto ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y limpiar la finca de café. Su plan es mantener en buen estado la  finca y darle siempre lo mejor a su familia
texts.en: Reina is 46 years old. She is single because she is a widow. She has 4 children. She lives in a town that belongs to Atima, Santa Bárbara with her daughter in law and children. She has always earned income. Previously, she did day labor, and then she was able to have her own coffee crop, which she sells in parchment in her local market. The loan she is asking for is her sixth cycle and it is for 10,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizer and clear the coffee farm. Her plan is to keep her farm in good condition and always give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and clear the coffee farm.

loans.name: Nelly Esther

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Nelly en su negocio de variedades,  pues con su credikiva compró gaseosas, mecatos, útiles de papelería y medias para los estudiantes. Su financiamiento resultó muy productivo porque sus ventas se incrementaron; tiene ahora mas clientes y su negocio se encuentra mucho más surtido. Las ganancias obtenidas,  le permitieron hacer adecuaciones a su vivienda y esto resulta muy bueno para el bienestar de su familia y el suyo propio. Ella envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva : “Le doy gracias a esas personas que desinteresadamente nos ayudan, para sacar adelante a nuestro negocio y que sigan con esta labor. “  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará tintes, refrescos como gaseosas, accesorios femeninos como moños, papelería en general, desechables y en la compra de tres puertas para aumentar la seguridad de la vivienda.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Nelly with her shop. With her Kiva loan she bought soft drinks, pastries, and stationary supplies and socks for students. Her loan turned out to be very productive because her sales increased. She now has more customers and her business is much more well stocked. Her earnings allowed her to make some improvements to her house and this was very good for her family’s wellbeing as well as her own. She sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: “I thank those people who selflessly help us to get ahead in our business, and may they continue with this good work.” She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan, which she will use to buy inks, soft drinks, women’s accessories such as hair bows, stationary supplies, disposable items, and also to buy three doors to improve the security of her house.

loans.use: to buy inks, soft drinks, women’s accessories such as hair bows, stationary supplies, disposable items, and also to buy three doors

loans.name: Daniel Edgardo

texts.es:
Daniel de 46 años, solo estudio hasta 9º grado debido a que en aquel tiempo la mayoría de personas estudiaban hasta 9º grado, esta casado y su esposa se dedica a los trabajos de la casa, tienen 2 hijos y la mayor esta estudiando, dependen de él 4 personas.


Daniel actualmente trabaja en la agricultura, lo que ha hecho desde que era un niño, ya que desde muy pequeño anduvo con sus padres y se dedica a este negocio, ademas de la agricultura, se dedica a criar ganado de pasto y en el lapso de 1 año lo esta vendiendo.


Daniel utilizara el préstamo para comprar ganado y empezar a trabajar las tierras donde sembraran este año.
 

Daniel sueña con tener una vivienda mejor a la que tiene, tener un camión para transportar la cosecha, preparar a sus hijos academicamente para tener mejores oportunidades, sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y los prestamos puede hacer posible su sueño.
texts.en:
Daniel is 46 years old. He only went to school through the 9th grade, because at that time most people only went to school through the ninth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the home. They have 2 children and the oldest is in school. Four people depend on him. 

Right now, Daniel works in agriculture. He has done this since he was a child. When he was  little, he would go with his parents and work in this business. In addition to agriculture, he raises grazing cattle that he sells after a year. 

Daniel will use the loan to buy cattle and start working the land where they will plant this year.  
 
Daniel dreams of having a better house than the one he has, of having a truck to transport the harvest, and to prepare his children academically so they can have better opportunities. He knows that with God's help and the loans, he can make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy cattle and start to work the land where they will plant this year.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza is 40 years old. She is a married parent of a daughter. Firuza, as a responsible mother, tries to offer a good living standard for her daughter. She is a higher-educated woman. Firuza works in a school as a teacher. She is one of the best teachers, but she has a small salary. Firuza is going to organize her new business in order to find a new source of income. Firuza wants to start a business to sew national women's dresses. Firuza took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ for women with this aim. She got a certificate. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a new sewing machine for organizing her new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for starting her new business.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Savy is a mother of one daughter and is 43 years old. To strive for a living, she grows rubber trees as the primary source of income and works for others for a fee. Engaging in her current business for years, she is able to earn up to 38,300 KHR per day. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she leads a group for requesting a loan. She and her joint-borrower are requesting a loan in the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer for farmland. She hopes to collect a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Bat-Amgalan

texts.en:
Bat-Amgalan is 29 years old and lives with his wife and children in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. He has been working for seven yeares at a power station and has the position of furnace activity coordinator.  For extra income, he renders taxi service to the local people. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home looking after their children. 

Using his previous loan, Bat-Amgalan renovated his house. Now he is requesting a loan of 2200000 MNT to buy vacuum insulated windows and hardwood floors for better housing.  After that, his family will live in a more comfortable and warmer house where less coal is burned for heating and then less pollutants will be released.

loans.use: buy insulated windows and hardwood floors

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Meet Peter, a farmer living in the Kisii area of South Nyanza.  He is married and has 5 children, all of school-going age.  He has been involved in farming for the past 15 years, where like most farmers in Kisii, his main source of income is milk, tea, bananas, and cereals.  He enjoys farming because he is able to get quick and fast money through selling his products locally.  His biggest challenge is climatic or seasonal changes, and lack of capital.

Peter chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer affordable interest rates on their loans.  During the training, he learned how to manage his small income.  Through this loan, there will be an increase in milk production and thus more income which will help him give a better education to his children.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 26-year-old single man from a small village near Jenin city.  He works in a clothing store where he gets a low income.  Ahmad is also a student at a local university where he studies nursing.  He would like to finish his study and take the BA degree so he can find a job in the future.
 
Ahmad took a USD 1,000 oan from FATEN. This loan will help him to pay the university tuition installment for this semester.  By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to complete his study and take the BA degree. 

Ahmad appears in the photo.

loans.use: pay his university tuition

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With this loan for KSH 40,000, Doris wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Khen, 48, lives in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a married mother of eight children, two of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. Her family’s income is from farming a rice paddy of 5 hectares. She has been in this business for 15 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 60,000 per day and can manage to save about KHR 40,000 per day for the future needs.
 
Khen has been a member of VisionFund for seven cycles already and she completely repaid the previous loans. With these loans from VisionFund, she has successfully used it to better support her living. Now leading her group to ask for a new loan, Khen wants to use her portion to buy seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Yen is 30 years old and blessed with three children. Two of the children are in school and the remaining one is too young for schooling. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, Cheung grows rice on one hectare of farmland as the main source of income, and works as a factory worker to earn additional income. She has been occupied in this business for 12 years and earns about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Including this cycle loan, she and her joint borrower are the second-cycled borrowers for the amount of 4,000,000 KHR each with VisionFund.  Cheung is the leader of her group, and will spend her portion of the loan to renovate her house. She hopes that she will own a decent house for her family so that she does not have to worry during the rainy season.

loans.use: to renovate her house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy dry fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build his house

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en:
Jesca operates a vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With this KSH 40,000 loan, Jesca wants to purchase green vegetables, fruits and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
Feliciano de 55 años de edad, estudio hasta 3º grado, ya que sus padres no consideraban importante el estudio, pensaban que solo aprendiendo un oficio podían salir adelante, esta acompañado y su pareja se dedica a vender tortillas, con lo cual aporta para su hogar, viven con él 2 nietos y 1 hijo, dependiendo de él 3 personas. En total son tres hijos, pero solo uno vive con él.


Feliciano actualmente trabaja en la agricultura y es empleado en un cañal donde gana un dinerito extra, el oficio de la agricultura lo aprendió de un tío, ya que su padre falleció cuando el era un niño, debido a ello, desde temprana edad tubo que empezar a trabajar duramente, él compra ganado y en termino de un año lo vende, lo ayudan en este trabajo 2 de sus hijos mayores.


El dinero del préstamo sera invertido en alquilar las tierras donde trabajara este año y comprar laminas para el techo de su hogar.
 

Feliciano sueña con viajar a Estados Unidos,  para trabajar y ganar mas dinero y asi mejorar su vivienda, ayudar a sus hijos para que tengan lo necesario para subsistir, sabe que tener un crédito es un compromiso, pero haciendo esfuerzos puede salir adelante.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 55, has a 3rd grade education, because his parents did not think that school was important.  They thought that only by learning a trade could he get ahead.  Feliciano has a partner who has a business selling tortillas, with which she contributes to the household.  They live with a son and two grandchildren, so Feliciano has 3 dependents.  He has a total of 3 children, but only one lives with him.

Feliciano now works in agriculture, and he is also an employee in a sugar cane field, where he earns a bit of extra money.  An uncle taught him to farm, because his father died when he was a child.  Because of this, he had to start working very hard at a young age.  He also buys cattle, which he sells at the end of the year.  His two oldest children help him with this work.

Feliciano will use the money from this loan to rent some land where he can work this year.  He will also use the funds to buy sheets of corrugated metal for the roof of his house.

Feliciano dreams of traveling to the United States, so that he could work and earn more money.  This way, he could improve his house and help his children so that they would have everything they need to survive.  He knows that taking out a loan is a commitment, but by working hard he can get ahead.

loans.use: to pay to rent the land where he will work this year, and to buy some sheets of corrugated metal for the roof of his house

loans.name: Anny

texts.en:
Anny is a married woman. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Amy has operated a food kiosk business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000, Amy wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and wheat flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: buy flour and beans to sell

loans.name: Rey's Group

texts.en:
Rey, 48, is married and have nine children.  They reside in a rural village in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To support her family, Rey has been farming rice for 15 years. She and her husband can earn about KHR 50,000 per day and can save about KHR 34,000 each day for their future needs. 

Rey’s group consists of two members who are both female.  She has been with VisionFund for six cycles. Rey has completely paid back her past loans. Now she and her group member are applying for a new loan of KHR1,400,000 each.  Rey is the leader of her group, and is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Sorphea's Group

texts.en:
Sorphea is 47 years old, married, and blessed with one child. She is a resident from Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district.  For her family, cassava farming is the  only source of income, which earns them about 20,000 KHR per day to use for daily food consumption as well as other necessary expenses. 

Sorphea has been with VisionFund for the past five loans and has successfully repaid her loans.  Her living condition is getting better than before, as her crops have grown healthily and returns for her a decent income.  Now, she is teaming up in a group of two to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for leasing fee, plowing fee, and weeding fee. She hopes that she can gain a good income better than before so she can expand her cassava farming business to a larger scale.

loans.use: to pay farming labor fees

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Sorn is 46 years old and married with seven dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, earning a living through farming rice. Having been in this business for 15 years, she is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s need. 

This is Sorn’s first micro loan with VisionFund.  Leading her group to apply for this loan, Sorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Kampong Cham province, Saran is 42 years old and a mother of five children -- two of whom are in school and still rely on her. For the sake of her family, she farms rice as the primary source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income.  She has been involved in this business for twenty years and it has returned her 25,600 KHR per day. 

Saran has never been with VisionFund before. Now, she leads a group of three to get a new loan. She is seeking loan of 600,000 KHR and her co-borrowers are requesting loans of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to pay for plowing fee and to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to collect a better crop yield so that she is able to support her kids at school.

loans.use: pay plowing fee and buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sokhoern's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sokhoern is 44 years old and married with 10 children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She earns a living through farming rice for 15 years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day for her needs. 

This is the seventh loan for Sokhoern with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund has helped her better support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a new loan, she wants to use her portion to buy pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: buy pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Trop's Group

texts.en:
Trorp is a villager from Kampong Cham province and a married mother of nine children. She is 58 year-old and is a farmer who grows rice in that area for ages as her main source of income. She also earns extra income via maize planting. 

Trorp is seeking a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) as a first time borrower and is the leader of her group. She and her joint-borrower are requesting a loan for 1,400,000 KHR each.  Trorp will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to upgrade her living conditions to better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Genci

texts.en:
Genci is a 29-year-old father of a 6-year-old child.  He is looking to buy potato seeds for planting.  He lives in a field area that has a very cold, snowy and windy climate in winter and excellent soil that supports almost all the plantings.  This village is situated along the national road Tirana-Korca.   Agriculture and livestock are the most pursued activities among most of the villagers and they sell their products along the road where they have built their booths. The products that have given this village a name in Albania are the dried red onions and the white beans, particularly lima beans.  As for their desired animal, the villagers there say that is the cow.

Genci has two cows and a tractor.  He uses the latter to serve the residents around his area and of course plow his own agricultural land.

loans.use: buy potato seeds

loans.name: Poeun's Group

texts.en: Poeun is a 38-year-old married mother residing in Kampong Cham province and blessed two children, one is in school and one is too young for schooling.  To earn a decent income for her family, she plants rubber as the main source of income and also works for others for a fee. It is the business that she has occupied for ages. Now, she leads a group of two in her first cycle loan to get a new loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rubber trees. She hopes to increase her income from her business so as to improve her standard of living better than before.

loans.use: buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Savon's Group

texts.en:
Savon is a villager from the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She is 56 years old and a mother of four children. She struggles for a living via rubber plantation farming and her paid-working job. 

Savon is a former borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She has repaid back her past loan completely and it has enabled her to upgrade her lifestyle better than before. Now, she leads a group of five to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 6,900,000 KHR, of which 1,300,000 KHR is her loan portion.  Savon will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop.  She hopes that she will gain a better yield in return.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is a person with a higher education. She is 21 years old.  Adolat is married and is bringing up a daughter. She is a teacher in a local school in her region. 

Adolat is going to start a business to find additional income, as her salary is small.  She is going to organize a business in animal husbandry. She will raise sheep and sell them in a local market.  

Adolat took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ by a women's organization and got a certificate. She will manage her business alone. 

Adolat is asking for a loan of 900 Somonis to buy sheep. She awaits your support.

loans.use: start a sheep business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more jewelry for her business

loans.name: Tharn's Group

texts.en: A resident from Dambae district of Kampong Cham province and a married mother of eight children, Tharn is one of the breadwinners in her family which consists of eight children. She deals with her family’s hardship via cassava farming and her pay from working, which she has been occupied with for 10 years.  She earns about 16,300 KHR per day. This is the sixth-cycle loan for Tharn and fourth-cycle loan for her joint borrower. She has successfully repaid back her past loan and has improved her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she and her joint borrower are requesting a loan for the same amount of 1,500,000 KHR each. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to improve her rice farming to buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for plowing and labor costs. She hopes to gain a better yield than before and to improve her condition of living as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and to pay for plowing and labor costs.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe is a married woman with children.  She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are household consumables.

For the past two years, she has operated a basket weaving business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of expanding and establishing a poultry business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase sewing materials for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials for her business

loans.name: Marvorid

texts.en: Marvorid is a young and successful lady from a rural area. She is 23-years-old. Marvorid is married and has a little child. Her husband is a migrant in Russia.  Five years ago, Marvorid began her own business dealing with animal husbandry. She began her business with one cow. Little by little during the five years she has developed her business. Now she has three cows. She feeds them for some months and then sells at a local market. Marvorid is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy a cow to increase her working capital. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a cow to increase her working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Un maravilloso santuario precolombino como lo es la Isla Zapatera nos relata diversas formas de vidas de las tribus que habitaron el lugar, en la actualidad nos abre las puertas con un hotel de excelente condiciones para los visitantes como de igual forma lo hace Doña Esperanza una señora de 66 años edad, madre de 3 hijos ya independientes, donde los años no la afectan y sigue con los deseo de superación y seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida; hace 16 años inicio un pequeño negocio de ventas de granos de básicos (arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz), cosméticos y ropa, gracias a un crédito que adquirió en  KIVA logro incrementar su negocio.

Solicita un nuevo crédito para la compra de más granos básicos (arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz), ropa y cosméticos; estimando que el nuevo crédito a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda para seguir manteniendo su negocio y de igual forma hacerlo que crezca más.
texts.en:
Zapatera island is a marvelous sanctuary that reflects the diverse ways of life and the tribes that originally lived there.  Currently, its doors are open to us all due to an excellent hotel that is available to visitors.  Esperanza works in a similar way.  She is a 66-year-old woman and a mother of 3 grown children.  Her age doesn't keep her down and she is continuing with her goal of improving her quality-of-life.

She started her small business 16 years ago selling basic groceries (including rice, sugar, beans, and corn), cosmetics, and clothes.  She was able to grow her business thanks to a Kiva loan.

She is asking for a new loan so she can buy more basic groceries, clothes, and cosmetics to sell.  She believes that this loan will help her greatly to continue to support her business and help it to grow even more.

loans.use: buy more basic groceries (rice, sugar, beans, corn), clothes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is married and has two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling green groceries. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality of products that reduces her sales. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Irum

texts.en:
Irum is a 32-year-old woman who resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop.  He is the guardian of the family and responsible for fulfilling the needs of all the family members. Irum has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years.  She also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household. 
 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, i.e creams, hair brushes, and other accessories for her beauty salon, but due to financial constraints she is not capable of buying these items for her business purpose. Therefore, Irum has applied to Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan.  This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers.  It will also be helpful to her to earn the maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance, Irum is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more useful items for her beauty parlor

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma es una señora de 52 años, casada, madre de 3 hijos y abuela de 3 nietos, ella siempre ha tenido inclinación por la gastronomía y en la juventud hizo varios cursos libres, cuando se casó vinieron los hijos y se dedicó por completo a ellos, aplazando siempre los proyectos de estudiar, sumando a ello problemas graves de salud.
Hoy en día está orgullosa de sacar a los hijos adelante y disfruta de la compañía de los nietos, los problemas de salud se han estabilizado y  ha decidido retomar las ganas de estudiar y dedicarse a ella, pero ahora ve que la parte económica también podría hacerla desfallecer, aun así busca los recursos para poder lograr las metas propuestas, es por eso que irma desea el convenio con kiva, para que ella pueda terminar con felicidad el programa  de cocina que es cual le interesa bastante.
texts.en:
Irma is a 52 year old woman, who is married, a mother of three and a grandmother to three grandchildren. She has always leaned towards gastronomy and in her youth she took various elective classes. When she got married, the children came and she completely devoted herself to them, always putting off the plan to study, all combined with severe health problems. 

Today she is proud to support her children and she enjoys the company of her grandchildren. The health problems have settled down and she has decided to get back the desire to study and apply herself, but now she sees that the economic part could also make her fail. Even so, she is looking for the resources to be able to achieve the proposed goals. That is why Irma wants the agreement with Kiva, so that she can happily finish the cooking program, which is what interests her a lot.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Edwin Rene

texts.es:
Edwin tiene 39 años de edad, está casado y solo su esposa y los dos hijos dependen de él. 

Edwin se dedica a la agricultura, oficio que aprendió de sus padres, para llegar a la parcelas camina 7  Km y trabaja durante la mañana y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen para luego vender la leche. Él se levanta a las 4:30 junto a su esposa para realizar las actividades agrícolas.

El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar los insumos agrícolas que necesita para sembrar (abono, semilla,alquiler de tierra, veneno) y para adquirir dos novillas que le venden a buen precio.

Él planea para un futuro hacer una buena inversión con las ganancias de su trabajo y que no le falte nada a su familia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 39 years old, is married and only his wife and his two children depend on him.

Edwin makes a living in agriculture, a trade that he learned from his parents. In order to get to the plot of land, he walks 7 km and he works during the morning while his wife tends to the household duties of milking the cows they have, to then sell the milk. He wakes up at 4:30 along with his wife to carry out the agricultural duties.

He needs the requested loan to buy agricultural supplies required to plant seeds (fertilizer, seeds, land rental, pesticide) and to purchase two young female cows which are sold at a good price.

In the future, he plans to make a good investment with the profit from his work so that his family does not go without.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies needed to plant seeds (fertilizer, seeds, land rental, pesticide) and to buy two young female cows.

loans.name: Vilma Del Transito

texts.es: Vilma tiene 46 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 22 y 18 años de edad. Vilma se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace 6 años y es así como lleva el sustento a sus hijos  y mantiene el equilibrio de la economía de su hogar. Vilma solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea construir una fosa de absorción para el tratamiento de las aguas negras para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: arena, grava, cemento, hierro y piedra. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y así proceder a la construcción lo antes posible.
texts.en: Vilma, 46, lives in her own home with her two sons, ages 22 and 18. Vilma has provided domestic services for 6 years, which is how she cares for her sons and maintains the family's economic balance.
