Vilma asks for a loan from FUSAI because she wants to build an absorption trench for the treatment of wastewater. For that, she needs materials like sand, gravel, cement, iron and stones. She hopes to have access to this loan and be able to start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel, cement, iron and stones to build an absorption trench.

loans.name: Yerald Domingo

texts.es:
El camino arboleado que nos dirige a la comarca la Joya en Teustepe, nos abre paso al mundo de la agricultura boaqueña, a la tierra de donde pertenece el agricultor de maíz, frijol y trigo, don Yerald. Cultivador que desde sus 12 años cambio los libros y el colegio para unirse al entorno ganadero, siguiendo los pasos de su padre.
Entre chillidos  de vacas, las cuales ha comprado desde que comenzó a trabajar como agrónomo individual, los gritos de su hijo de cinco años jugando futbol y los golpes de la coba en la tierra lista para cultivar, Domingo, a sus 35 años, sueña con seguir incrementado su ganado, ampliar la producción de maíz y trigo, limpiar y mejorar el potrero para el crecimiento del pasto verde, y seguir comercializando su producto en cada casa de la comarca, pues cuando ya tenga ingresos suficientes, poder seguir extendiendo su mercado. Solicita el crédito para comprar Alambre de Pua, Grapas y lograr pagarle a su ayudante de la siembra.
texts.en:
The tree-lined path leads us to the La Joya region in Teustepe, opening passage to the world of Boacoan agriculture and the land where Yerald farms his corn, beans and wheat. He has been a farmer for 12 years, since he traded in his books and schooling to join the life of a cattle rancher, following in his father's footsteps. Amid the cries of the cows, which he began buying when he started this work, also arise the yells of his 5 year old son playing soccer and the beating of the hoe in the fields that are ready for planting.

Domingo, 35, dreams of increasing his cattle, increasing his production of corn and wheat, cleaning and improving the pasture so the green grass will grow, and being able to expand his market. He asks for the loan to buy barbed wire and staples and to pay his planting assistant.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire and staples, and to pay his farming assistant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sokhon's Group

texts.en:
Sokhon is a 43-year-old rural villager from the Moung Russey District of Battambang province, Cambodia.  She is married and blessed with one son who is still in school.  Rice farming is the only source of income to cover the daily basic needs of her family.  

This is the second-cycle microloan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the leader of a group consisting of four members that will get the new loan.  She utilized her past loan with success and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before.  The total amount of her entire group loan is 4,100,000 KHR, of which 1,200,000 KHR is her loan portion.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, and insecticides. She hopes to gain better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees, fertilizer, and insecticides

loans.name: Latofat

texts.en: The national Tajik women's dresses sewed by Latofat are wonderful. She is a 26-year-old woman who is married and has two children. Now, she is pregnant and awaits her third baby. Her husband is a kind man who tries to help her with all deals. They must comfort their children with all modern conveniences. She tries to provide them with a better quality of life. That’s why six years ago she began her own business sewing national women's dresses. She has her own workshop. Thanks to her good service, she has managed to gain many customers. She also has five students who learn sewing from her. Since she’s had her business, her family’s quality of life has been improving. She wants to develop her business further but she needs to buy a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus cuatro hijos de 18 años, 17 años, 14 años y 8 años de edad. María es pequeña comerciante, desde hace 12 años se dedica a la venta pupusas (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.) y vitaminas. Es una mujer emprendedora quien es muy conocida por sus vecinos como una mujer integra, responsable y luchadora. María desea construir una fosa de absorción para tratamiento de aguas grises para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de arena, cemento, grava, hierro y ladrillo dado que no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo por su cuenta pero si con la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Maria, 35, lives in her own house with four children, aged 18, 17, 14 and 8.  She is a small-time trader who has been selling stuffed tortilla snacks and vitamins for 12 years.  These snacks known as pupusas are tortillas filled with such things as beans, corn and cheese.  

She is an enterprising woman who is well-known by her neighbours as an honest, responsible and hard-working person. 
 
Maria wishes to build a well to treat her grey water, so she is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, cement, gravel, iron and bricks.  She needs the loan because she hasn’t got the money to make the investment, but she does have sufficient funds to pay back the loan in instalments.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, iron and bricks to build a well.

loans.name: Otinkrong Group

texts.en:
Janet is 38 years old. She lives in the Teshie area of Accra-Ghana. She is married with children.

Janet purchases bedsheets, cosmetics and towels and resells them to earn a living. She is working hard to help sustain the family income.

Janet is requesting a loan of GHS 1500 to buy more bedsheets, cosmetics and towels to resell to customers. She hopes that her business will develop successfully so she will be able to send her children to school.

Janet is the featured borrower of this batch of the group called Otinkorang. There are five members who include the following:

Mary is a 43-year-old married mother of two children. Mary runs a grocery store to earn a living. She would like to borrow GHS 700 to buy supplies for her shop.

Joyce is 30 years old. She is the mother of one dependable child. She sells wine glasses and secondhand clothing. She would love to borrow GHS 1000 to invest in her business.

Dorcas is 67 years old. She wants to borrow GHS 1000 to buy cooking utensils and plastic products to resell.

Naomi is 37 years old. She has two children. She would like to borrow GHS 1200 to be able to buy and sell underwear and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy more bedsheets, cosmetics and towels to resell to customers.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en:
Sera is married and has two children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the past three years, she has operated a green grocery selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Meet Rose, a farmer residing in the Kisii area of South Nyanza. She has been farming for the past 13 years, with her primary source of income being milk, tea, maize, bananas, and vegetables. 

The most enjoyable part about farming is planting and selling vegetables because they mature quickly and give her money instantly. The biggest challenge is lack of enough money to buy farm inputs.

Rose chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During the training, she learned how to develop a culture of saving. Through this dairy loan, her family's living standards will improve because it will provide food and capital.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emmy Group

texts.en:
Mercado is the featured borrower of Emmy group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua, because they have been close friends since they arrived in Lebanon and started to work as housekeepers to provide their beloved families with the necessary standards of living.

Mercado is a 36-year-old married mother of six children. She works as a housekeeper to make sure that her beloved children will get the best education that will be their best weapon for a brighter future. She is devoted to her children and misses them a lot. She hopes that one day they will unite back together forever, but in the meantime her main aim is to provide them with the best education. Her low income isn’t enough to cover both her living needs in Lebanon and her family’s increasing needs back in her hometown in the Philippines, and that’s why her acquired loan will be sent to her children to pay for their increasing educational fees.

Mercado is the beautiful lady at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Leonida is a 46-year-old single mother of one child at the center of the picture, and Roslyn is a 28-year-old single lady standing at the far right side of the picture.

All of them are motivated to work hard to improve their families’ socioeconomic situation through providing them an acceptable good education level.

They believe that being a united team at Al Majmoua is a ray of hope. They will work on acquiring the necessary loans in the future to cover their children's education installments.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing educational fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to look after her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI  est un groupe de l’association SARAMAYA II  de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe des femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans. Mariées avec en  moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments à l’image de AWA SEYDOU qui est la première  personne debout de la droite vers la gauche  de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à NTENTOU dans la  Sous-Préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de condiments : tomate,  oignon et choux.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a deux ans. Elles sont à leur troisième  prêt solidaire. 
AWA SEYDOU, qui est un membre du groupe et très connue à N’TENTOU, excelle dans la vente de condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  5 paniers de tomate.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place  auprès des grossistes  et vend ses condiments à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle mixte.    
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 21.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et être réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de condiments.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group that is part of the Saramaya II association of N’Tentou. The group brings together women who know each other through relatives and neighbors. On average, they are 29 years old, married, and have four children.

They each have different businesses such as buying and selling condiments through Awa Seydou, the woman standing all the way to the right in the photo. They live in large traditional families in N’Tentou, which is in the Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali). 

They have been running small businesses for years and are very sought after for their sales of tomatoes, onions, and cabbage. 

With the hopes of satisfying the growing demands of their clients, the members of the group decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program two years ago. This is their third group loan. 
 
Awa Seydou, who is very well known in N’Tentou, excels in condiment sales. She would like to use her loan to buy five baskets of tomatoes. She buys her supplies in Ouelessebougou and from the local wholesalers. She sells her condiments in Ouelessebougou for retail prices, for cash and credit, and to a mixed clientele.

She would like to earn an average monthly profit of 21,000 FCFA - an amount that will allow her to reimburse the loan and reinvest in her condiment business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Luís Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta el bachillerato, por la situación económica no pudo seguir en la universidad, esta casado y su esposa es profesora, sus hijos están casados y viven con ellos, todos dependen de él


Luis trabaja actualmente como empleado de una alcaldía, desde hace 9 años, antes de esto fue cobrador de buses y sastre, con esto se sostuvo en su juventud, cuando niño trabajo en la agricultura, con su padre, por lo que siempre ha sido una persona muy trabajadora ganándose el sustento de varias maneras, su  horario es de 8:00 am a 4: 00 pm y regresa a ayudar a los quehaceres del hogar. 


Luis utilizara el préstamo para comprar una cuna y juguetes para su hijo de año y medio de edad,  pagar algunas deudas que tiene con otra institución y ayudar a sus padres en la compra de algunas medicinas.
 

Luis sueña con ver crecer a sus hijos, prepararlos con el estudio para enfrentar la vida con un futuro seguro, tener una casa propia porque donde viven están alquilando, sabe que con la ayuda de Dios y mucho esfuerzo puede lograr su sueño
texts.en:
Luis, 36, studied until the end of high school, but due to financial reasons, couldn’t continue his education at university.  He is married and his wife is a teacher.  His children are now married and live with them, and are financially dependent on him.

At the moment, he is working in a city hall.  He has been working in this for nine years.  Before this, he was a bus fare collector and tailor.  With these jobs he managed to look after himself when he was young.  When he was a child, he worked with his father in agriculture, so he has always been a hard worker, earning a living any way he can.  His working day is from 8 am until 4 pm and when he gets home he helps with the housework.

Luis will use the loan to buy a cot and toys for his son who is one and a half years old.  He will also pay off a loan he has with another institution and help his parents to buy some medicine.

loans.use: to buy a cot and toys for his one and a half-year-old son; to pay some loans off with another institution; and to help his parents buy some medicine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies to maintain her coffee plants

loans.name: Janet Cecilia

texts.es:
Janet Cecilia tiene 22 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general en su tienda ubicada en su domicilio, tiene clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos como sacos de arroz, harina, leche enlatada, huevos, menestras entre otros y de esta manera ofrecer a sus clientes generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Janet Cecilia is 22 years old and lives with her husband and children in the district of Oyotún. The local people earn their living from farming, commerce, and animal raising. Her community is located in the province of Chiclayo, part of the region of Lambayeque on Peru's northern coast.

Together with her husband, Janet Cecilia runs a grocery store located in her house. She has a large customer base and is now seeking a loan to buy a variety of products such as bags of rice, flour, cans of milk, eggs, and vegetable soups to offer her customers and generate more money for her family.

loans.use: Buy stock for her store such as rice, flour, cans of milk, eggs, and vegetable soups

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
Mira is a 40-year-old lady who lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter in Korisaya village Deoghar, Jharkhand. She has made it a point to send her kids to school. Her husband runs a rental business from his home. He rents music equipments like DJ music boxes, generators, long tubal sound boxes etc during weddings or other ceremonies and earns around INR 5,000-6,000 per month. He has been in this business for the last 10 years. He also sells newspapers in the evenings and earns INR 5000 per month. 

Mira is requesting a loan to open a shop for the rental business in their locality. Korisaya village is on the border of Deoghar town and 1,000 people live in this village. Lots of weddings take place during the months of March to May, November and December. Mira is hopeful that if they establish their own shop in this place, they can earn more profit. She wants to expand and hire a few people and give them jobs.

loans.use: to open a music equipment rental shop

loans.name: Malti

texts.en:
Malti is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children (two sons and two daughters), all of whom are studying in Korisaya village, Deoghar, Jharkhand.  She sells bangles in her locality.

Her husband owns a poultry farm in Deoghar town, as there is a good demand for meat all year round except during Shraavana. Shraavana is the fifth month of the Hindu year, beginning in late July and ending in the third week of August, when people don’t eat meat, as this month is considered very holy in the Hindu calendar and the business goes down. His monthly income is around INR 5,000 per month. 

Since Malti’s bangle business isn’t doing that great, she has started helping her husband on his farm. Most of their income is spent on taking care of their four children so she is not able to save enough to expand her farm business. That’s why Malti is requesting a loan to buy more chicks and hens. Malti dreams of opening her own meat shop in Korisaya.

loans.use: to buy chicks and hens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, pepper, cold water, and salt for her business.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married mother and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

She has been operating an open-air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a widow with two children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a food-making business, making consumables like beans and chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbors. With the KES 25,000, she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plated goods.

loans.name: Leido

texts.es:
Leido tiene 26 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Colasay, una comunidad de clima variado con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de construcción civil, es maestro de obras desde hace varios años, trabaja en su mismo distrito y caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 501 nuevos soles para la compra de herramientas que le permitirán realizar de una mejor manera su trabajo.
texts.en:
Leido is 26 years old, and lives with his wife and children in the district of Colasay, a community with a varied climate and green landscapes. Its inhabitants make a living in agriculture, trade and livestock. It is located in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

He provides civil construction services, and has been a master builder for several years. He works in his local area and nearby villages. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa of 2,501 soles to buy tools which will allow him to carry out his job more successfully.

loans.use: to buy tools which will allow him to carry out his job more successfully.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: Rosmery  de 32 años de edad, habita en un municipio muy cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 4 años. Allí vende mercancía variada en un local desde hace 14 años. Su idea de negocio nació como iniciativa de su hermana, quien hoy es propietaria de varios locales comerciales. Ella la ayudó con el primer capital de trabajo e hicieron una sociedad y empezaron a surtir el negocio,  con productos que observaron habían tenido una mayor rotación, teniendo como meta resolver las necesidades de ingreso de su hogar. Poco a poco el negocio fue creciendo   y sus inventarios fueros mas diversos; así  fue como empezó a vender celulares, accesorios para ellos, electrodomésticos, gorros, mochilas, ropa para damas, para caballeros e infantil, a clientes que se convirtieron en fijos y también logrando atraer mas compradores eventuales, impulsando la venta desde el punto. Su horario de trabajo es desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche diariamente y ofrece los productos de contado y a crédito. Su meta más adelante es tener su propio local, para sacar adelante a sus hijos y su mayor desafío es el poco capital con el que cuenta. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará morrales, celulares, y ropa en general, para responder a su clientela, haciendo de su credikiva una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 32 years old, and lives in a town near the city of Barranquilla with her partner and young, 4-year-old daughter. She has sold various goods in a store there for 14 years. Her business idea was born at the initiative of her sister, who today owns various commercial premises. She helped her out with the initial working capital and they set up a business and began to stock it with products that they noticed had the highest turnover, with the aim of resolving the income needs of her household. 

Little by little the business grew, and her stock became more varied. This is how she began to sell mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, household appliances, hats, rucksacks, women's, men's and children's clothing, to customers who became loyal. She also managed to attract more buyers, achieving more sales. 

Her working hours are 9 in the morning to 8 at night every day, and she offers goods on credit and for cash. Her future aims are to have her own premises and support her children, and her biggest challenge is her lack of capital. 

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva, to buy backpacks, mobile phones and clothing in general, to meet her customers' demands, making her loan from Kiva a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy backpacks, mobile phones and clothing in general.

loans.name: Mujeres Mazahuas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Mazahuas es un grupo de personas alegres y muy trabajadoras; siempre muestran su gran entusiasmo para realizar cualquier actividad. Ellos se conocen desde hace varios años y su amistad es un lazo muy fuerte, cuando generalmente se les presenta un dificultad todas apoyan para resolverlo de la mejor manera. Los integrantes viven en una comunidad mazahua se caracteriza por el cultivo de maíz. 

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque iniciaron el grupo todos los integrantes eran mujeres, aunque actualmente ya hay dos hombres decidieron conservar el nombre. Doña Domitila o Domi, como le dicen de cariño a la del grupo, es una mujer viuda que ya no tiene ningún dependiente económico. Platica que tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 20 años “Inicié mi negocio porque anteriormente no había ninguna tienda de este tipo en el pueblo, pero ahora ya tengo mucha competencia y esto no me beneficia en nada por eso solicito un crédito para invertir en mi negocio”. Doña Domi siente que ha perdido muchos clientes porque le hacen falta muchos productos de abarrotes de alguna manera quiere recuperar sus clientes para que sus ingresos vuelvan hacer los mismos. Ella tiene mucha confianza en su crédito ya que podrá comprar azúcar, huevo, leche, pan, productos enlatados, etc. espera que con su inversión pueda recuperar sus clientes y generar más ingresos.  Los integrantes del grupo son Claudia, Gerardo, José Antonio, Miguel quienes invertirán su crédito en sus borreguitos y Doña Juana quien tiene una tienda de abarrotes. *En la foto: Doña Domi al frente de su grupo vestida de rosa y con su tradicional sombrero entre las manos*
texts.en:
Mujeres Mazahuas (Mazahuas Women) is a group of friendly and very hard-working individuals, who always show a huge amount of enthusiasm to carry out any activity. They have known one another for many years, and their friendship is a very strong bond. When a problem arises, they all support one another to resolve it in the best way possible. The members of the group live in a Mazahua community which is known for growing corn.

They chose the name of the group because when the group was first created all of the members were women, and although there are now two men they decided to keep the name. Domitila, or Domi, as the group affectionately call her, is a widow who no loner has any financial dependents. She says that she has had a grocery store for 20 years. “I started my business because in the past, there wasn't a store of this kind in the town, but I now have a lot of competition, which doesn't benefit me at all, which is why I'm requesting a loan to invest in my business”. 

Domi feels that she has lost a lot of customers because she lacks a lot of grocery products. She wants to somehow get her customers back so that her profits return to their previous levels. She has a lot of confidence in this loan as it will enable her to buy sugar, eggs, milk, bread, tinned products, and other items. She hopes that her investment will allow her to get her customers back and boost her earnings.

The members of the group are Claudia, Gerardo, José Antonio, and Miguel, who will invest their loan in their sheep, and Juana who has a grocery store. In the photo, Domi is at the front of the group and is wearing pink, with her traditional hat in her hands.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as milk, sugar, detergent, soft drinks, etc.

location.town: Dios Padre, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
DJEKAFO est un groupe de l’association BENKADI de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe des  femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans. Mariées avec en moyenne quatre enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de grains de néré à l’image de KIATOU qui est la deuxième personne  debout  de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités d’achat vente de grains de néré. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, il y a quatre ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
KIATOU, excelle dans la vente de grains de néré. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de grains de néré.  Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et sur place auprès des grossistes  et vend ses produits à BAMAKO en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité d’achat vente de grains de néré.
texts.en:
Djekafo is a group in the Benkadi association in Ouelessebougou and is made up of women who know each other through being relatives and neighbours. The group members are all married and are 32 years old on average, with an average of four children.

The women are involved in various businesses such as trading néré seeds, like Kiatou, pictured second from the left. They live in large traditional families in Ouelessebougou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Mali). They have been running their businesses for several years and they are in high demand for the néré seeds they trade.

In order to satisfy growing demand from customers, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan programme four years ago. This is their fifth solidarity loan.

Kiatou is very good at selling néré seeds and will use her loan to buy ten sacks of them. She gets her supplies from Ouelessebougou and directly from wholesalers and sells her products to individuals in Bamako, for cash and on credit. Her customers include both men and women.

Kiatou hopes to make 30,000 CFA francs a month, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her néré seed business.

loans.use: to buy néré seeds.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rosario del Pilar tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de tubérculos y granos, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada por ella misma, crianza de cerdos y la venta de leña, tiene una familia unida que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rosario del Pilar is 41 years old, and lives with her husband and children in the district of Buenos Aires, a town with a warm climate, whose population makes a living in agriculture, and the cultivation of tubers and grains, trade and livestock in particular. It is located in the province of Morropon in the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.

Rosario makes a living selling food she prepares herself, rearing pigs and selling firewood. She has a close, hard-working family. She has requested a loan of 1,000 soles to buy materials for her home.

loans.use: to buy materials for her home.

loans.name: Maramou

texts.fr:
Née en 1975 à FALADIE, MARAMOU  vit avec ses 6 enfants et son époux dans une famille nucléaire à MANA,  dans la Sous-préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU  (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
MARAMOU n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt,  elle s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage et vente de céréales : maïs, haricots et mils. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso, il y a cinq ans. 
Après avoir remboursé le cinquième  prêt, MARAMOU est à son sixième  prêt individuel  qui sera utilisé pour  acheter, 3 sacs de mils et  2 sacs de riz, auprès des paysans producteurs de MANA et environ qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Elle  vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles BAMAKO et OUELESSEBOUGOU.   
MARAMOU  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour   aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans les activités l’achat stockage et vente de céréales.
texts.en:
Maramou was born in 1975 in Faladie, and lives with her husband and six children in Mana, in the Ouelessebougou sub-prefecture (Koulikoro Region, Mali).

Maramou did not have the opportunity to go to school, but entered business very young, buying, storing and selling cereals such as corn, beans and millet. In order to satisfy her growing customer base, she began to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso five years ago.

Having successfully paid back the fifth loan, Maramou is requesting a sixth, which she will use to buy three sacks of millet and two sacks of rice from producers in Mana and the surrounding area. She will store those supplies for at least three months.

Maramou generally sells her goods in bulk to traders from cities like Bamako and Ouelessebougou. She hopes to make a monthly average of 45,000 CFA francs, which she will use to help her husband with family expenses, repay her loan and reinvest in her business buying, storing and selling cereals.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Novissi Group

texts.fr:
Amevi est âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Amévi est responsable du groupe NOVISSI du quartier Adidogomé. Ce groupe est composé de 22 femmes. Amévi est une femme dynamique qui fait la transformation du maïs en un repas appelé localement "Ablo". la préparation de cette nourriture lui prend 3 heures de temps. Elle a commencé cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans et dispose d'une grande clientèle venant des différents quartier de Lomé. Amevi s'approvisionne en maïs au marché de son quartier un fois par semaine.
Ce crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'acheter 2 sacs de maïs afin de réduire les fréquences d'approvisionnement et bénéficier des remises sur ses achats effectuées.
Les autres membres du groupe mènent les petites activités génératrice de revenus.
texts.en:
Amevi is 35 years old, married and the mother of two. She is the leader of the Novissi group from the Adidogomé neighbourhood, which is made up of 22 women.

Amevi is a dynamic person who turns corn into a local dish known as "ablo"; this takes her three hours. She has been in business for more than 10 years and has many customers from different parts of Lomé.

Amevi buys her corn at her local market once a week. This loan will help her buy two sacks of corn, enabling her to reduce her supply frequency and receive a discount on her purchases. The other group members also run small businesses.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of corn.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa de 65 años de edad,  por sus escasos recursos económicos  estudio hasta 3º grado, ella era una de las mayores de los doce hermanos y tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar ya que sus familia era muy pobre. Está acompañada, su esposo  se dedica a trabajar en el campo.


Felipa actualmente se dedica a sembrar maíz  y lo ha hecho desde que era niña, ya que su padre le enseñó este trabajo en aquel tiempo no tenían otra forma de sobrevivir mas que la agricultura, también cuando era niña trabajo en las tabacaleras con su padre;  además de trabajar en la agricultura, también trabajo como empleada en los cañales los cuales es un dinero extra, se levanta desde las 5:00 am y tiene que empezar con los quehaceres del hogar.

Felipa  utilizará el dinero del préstamo para sembrar  maíz, ya que en estos días es donde empiezan a limpiar las tierras donde trabaja, ademas comprara un ternero que en termino de un año estará para la venta.
 

Felipa en un futuro sueña con tener una mejor casa de la que ahora tiene, poder darle a sus hijos lo necesario para que puedan vivir, ademas sueña con comprar un vehículo y poder salir a pasear con su esposo  e hijos, ella está segura que el crédito es un compromiso pero también sabe que solo así puede lograr sus sueños, confiando primero en DIOS, será un mayor esfuerzo pero así obtendrá una mejor situación económica.
texts.en:
Felipa is 65 years old, and because of her lack of financial resources, only studied up to the third grade. She was one of the oldest of twelve siblings and she had to help her parents work as her family was very poor. She has a husband, who works in the countryside.

Felipa currently works growing corn, which she has done since she was a girl, when her father taught her how to do this job. During that time, the only option open to them to survive was agriculture, When she was a girl, she also worked in tobacco plantations with her father. In addition to working in agriculture, she worked as an employee in the sugar cane fields, which represented an extra source of income. Every day, she gets up at 5am to start her housework. 

Felipa will use the money from the loan to grow corn, since now is the time to start clearing the land she works. She will also buy a calf which will be ready to sell within a year.

In the future, Felipa dreams of having a better home than the one she has at the moment, of giving her children what they need for them to live comfortably, and of buying a vehicle and being able to go out for a drive with her husband and children. She knows that this loan is a commitment but is sure that it is the only way she can achieve her dreams, by placing trust in God, and by making a huge effort to obtain a better financial situation.

loans.use: to grow corn, since now is the time to clear the land she works, and buy a calf, which will be ready to sell within a year.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, oil, bread, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more eggs, soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en: Aisha is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a retail shop business and has been in this business for eight years. Aisha has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cans of cooking oil, boxes of soap, bags of rice and loaves of bread. Aisha works in a shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and defaulters. Aisha aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to own a delivery van to ease her transportation needs. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of their good customer care. Aisha resides in the family's house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loans.use: To buy more cans of cooking oil, boxes of soap, bags of rice and loaves of bread.

loans.name: José Lorenzo

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta segundo grado, está soltero y no tiene hijos, él vive con sus padres los cuales se dedican a la agricultura.

José es agricultor, ha realizado esta actividad desde que era muy pequeño, lo aprendió de su padre, el lugar donde trabaja está a 3 kilómetros de su casa y los recorre a pie o en ocasiones en bicicleta, para poder transportar los productos agrícolas José alquila una carreta y así es como los lleva a su casa, el trabajo lo realiza en 6 horas diarias.

Con el crédito solicitado comprará una yunta de bueyes para poder llevar los productos básicos hasta su casa, eso le servirá de mucho pues le facilitará el trabajo y ya no tendrá que pagar por alquilar una carreta para llevar los productos a su casa.

Sus sueños son mejorar la siembra, aumentar la producción y poder comercializar los granos en la comunidad donde él reside.
texts.en:
José is 33 years old, and was only able to study up until second grade. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents who make a living in agriculture.

José is a farmer, and has been in this business since he was very young, learning it from his father. The place where he works is 3 kilometers from his home and he walks there, or sometimes goes on his bicycle. José hires a cart in order to transport his agricultural produce to his home. He works for six hours every day.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a team of oxen to transport his produce to his home. This will be very useful to him as it will make his work easier and he will no longer have to pay to hire a cart to take the products to his home.

His dreams are to improve his crop, increase his yield and sell his produce in the community in which he lives.

loans.use: to pair a team of oxen.

loans.name: Donika

texts.en:
This is a photograph of Donika with two of her five kids, inside their home. She is forty-one and married. They live in a village. Donika works in livestock and arboriculture (cultivation of trees, shrubs and other woody plants). She wants to add another dairy cow to the existing herd. She says, “I have five children to feed. They range in age from five to twenty years old. I do what I can even though at times it becomes difficult financially. Adding another milk cow will give me the opportunity to sell dairy, hence, this will increase my family’s income.”

Currently Donika has one dairy cow that fulfills their family’s needs for dairy, one horse that she uses for transportation and orchards growing plums, nuts and quinces that she sell to wholesale buyers. She also grows plants to feed to her animals.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow so that she can sell raw milk to dairy farms

loans.name: Al –Noor Al-Waetat Group

texts.en:
Al–Noor Al-Waetat is a group consisting of four women living in Sana'a, Yemen. They know each other as friends. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB to make improvements in their families.

Lamya is the leader of the group. She is twenty-three years old and the mother of two children, who both live with her. She is a very vigorous woman and works as a housewife. She says that she works very hard inside the house, especially as her children are still very small. Lamya doesn't have anyone who can help her with this work. Also, her husband's income is not enough to cover their family's expenses. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase a clothes washing machine so that her workload will decrease. She is happy and hopes to get a lot of support in order to buy more home appliances.

In future, Lamya hopes to build a third floor to her house and furnishing it in order to rent.

loans.use: purchase a washing machine

loans.name: Matluba

texts.en:
Matluba lives with her family in a rural area. Her house is located near the mountains. She is forty-six years old. Matluba is married and has three children. She has worked in animal husbandry more than twenty-five years. She has a vast experience in this field. She grows animal feed in the land near her house and then uses it to feed cows. 

Currently she plans to repair her house as it is in bad condition but she has not got enough money. Matluba is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy building materials as cement, wood and paint for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy building materials as cement, wood and paint for repairing her house

loans.name: Masitula

texts.en:
Masitula is a single mother of four children. Three of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family member, who is her aunt. 

Masitula has a business of selling tomatoes and onions. She has been in this business for four years. She works in the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy boxes of tomatoes and onions. Her major business challenges include seasonality and rent. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to start growing some vegetables. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest rates that it charges. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: María Eleticia

texts.es:
María tiene 61 años de edad, desafortunadamente no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada desde hace mas de 40 años y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, tienen 6 hijos que ya formaron sus propios hogares, y en casa solo viven ella, su esposo y dos nietos.
María se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, leche, queso, requesón en la comunidad, y en los lugares mas cercanos, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad y esa ha sido la forma con la cual ha sacado adelante a sus hijos y ha colaborado con su esposo, y el trabajo lo realiza 5 horas diarias.
El crédito solicitado lo necesita para comprar una vaca lechera y mejorar el negocio de la venta de leche, esto le servirá de mucho pues obtendrá mayores ingresos.

Sus sueños son seguir luchando para apoyar a su familia y continuar con el negocio de la leche.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old, and unfortunately didn't have the chance to study. She has been married for over 40 years and her partner makes a living in agriculture and livestock. They have 6 children which already have their own families, and only her, her husband and two grandchildren live in her home.

María makes a living selling dairy products including milk, cheese, and curd in her town and nearby communities. She has been in this business for many years and it is how she supported her children and helped her husband. She works five hours every day.

She has requested this loan to buy a dairy cow and improve her business selling milk. It will be very useful for her as it will help her to boost her earnings.

Her dreams are to continue fighting to support her family, and continue with her dairy business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, wheat flour, maize flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a viable location and his customers are varied. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. 

He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy stocks of sugar, bread, flour and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He successfully repaid his previous loan of 20,000 KES.

loans.use: buy stocks of sugar, bread, flour and other items

loans.name: Jonis De Jesús

texts.es:
Jonis tiene 39 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos que estudian y son las únicas personas que dependen de Jonis-
Él se dedica a la agrilcultura dese hace mas de 20 años, esta actividad la aprendió de sus padre quien desde muy joven le enseñó a cultivar maíz y frijol, el trabajo le queda a 1 kilómetro de su casa y los recorre a pie o a veces en carreta, lo que se le dificulta es transportar la cosecha hasta su casa pues es demasiado largo y tiene que pagar por transporte para que le leven sus cosechas, el trabajo lo realiza en 6 horas diarias.
El crédito lo solicita para alquilar el terreno donde sembrará, además necesita pagar mano de obra para limpiar el lugar pues tien mucha maleza, además comprará algunos insumos agrícolas necesarios para la siembra.

Él espera mejorar su calidad de vida cultivando mas productos, y sabe que lo puede lograr con su esfuerzo y la ayuda de los créditos.
texts.en:
Jonis is 39 years old, and studied at school up to the third grade of school. He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has three children, who study, and are dependent on Jonis.

He has made a living in agriculture for over 20 years. He learned this activity from his father, who taught him how to grown corn and beans from a very young age. His work is 1km from his home, and he gets there on foot or sometimes in a cart. Transporting the harvest to his home is a problem for him because it is too far away and he has to pay for his harvest to be transported. He works six hours every day.

He is requesting the loan to pay the rent for the land he grows on, and he also needs to pay workers to clear the land as it is covered in weeds. He also wants to buy some agricultural inputs his crops need.

He hopes to increase his quality of life by growing more crops, and he knows that he can achieve this through his effort and the help of the loans.

loans.use: to pay the rent for the land he grows on, pay workers and buy some inputs his crops need.

loans.name: Ada Del Carmen

texts.es: Ada tiene 42 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida quien es albañil y su pequeño hijo de 10 años de edad. Ada es una mujer carismática y emprendedora. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de  verduras de forma ambulante y así se gana la vida y junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía del hogar. Ada desea mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación de las paredes de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: ladrillo, madera, cemento, arena y hierro. Es su sueño brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Ada is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her partner, who is a builder, and her young, 10-year-old child. Ada is a charismatic and enterprising woman. She has sold vegetables on a mobile basis for 10 years, which is how she makes a living and supports her family with her partner. Ada wants to improve her and her family's living conditions, which is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in repairing the walls of her home. To do this she needs materials such as bricks, wood, cement, sand and iron to change the walls of her home. Her dream is to secure better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, wood, cement, sand and iron to change the walls of her home.

loans.name: Miriam Marina

texts.es:
Miriam Marina tiene 28 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Laynas, una zona rural del distrito de La Matanza, una comunidad de clima caluroso cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de Chicha de Jora, una bebida que se prepara en base al maíz, cuenta con clientela en la zona, debido al clima de su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chicha de jora y de esta manera seguir preparando su producto para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Miriam Marina is 28 years old, and lives with her spouse and children in the village of Laynas, a rural area in the district of La Matanza. This community, which has a warm climate, has basic services such as water and electricity. Its inhabitants make a living in agriculture, livestock and trade. It is located in the province of Morropon in the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.

Miriam makes a living selling beer called Chicha de Jora, which is prepared from maize. She has customers in the area, thanks to the region's climate. She has requested a loan of 800 soles to buy ingredients to make chicha de jora and in this way continue preparing her product to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make maize beer.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Esperanza Group

texts.es:
DUO Buena Esperanz La señora Josefina de 33 años, soltera,  desde hace 5 años posee una Tortilleria ubicada en la colonia Santa Otilia Chimaltenango que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña Josefina es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar maiz y gas propano para seguir elaborando y tortilas y seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Josefina is 33 years old and single. She has run a tortilla stand in the area of Santa Otilia Chimaltenango for five years. Thanks to her efforts in her business she has been able to establish and make improvements to her home while providing for and bringing up her family.  

Josefina's dream is to be able to improve her and her family's quality of life through a micro loan which she is applying for through FAPE. With this loan she would like to buy corn and propane gas to continue making tortillas and expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy propane gas to make tortillas

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 31-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and business-friendly area and her primary customers are of all types. 

Eunice describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have good living standards. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is a single mother of three children, two of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has business selling used clothes and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of   600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of old shirts and trousers.  

Sarah doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.   Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She works in the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also buying a plot of land and building a house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of old shirts and trousers

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
Nickson is a 22-year-old single man. He describes himself to be sincere and determined. He operates a farm where he grows carrots, potatoes and peas for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a busy productive area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of seeds and fertilizer. 

Nickson will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Yehowa No Group

texts.en:
Nine women from Teshie are in the photograph who belong to the group called Yehowa No (Belong to God). They sell maize, detergent, fish, shirts, rice, Milo, milk, plates, bowls, fabric and linen.

One of the women from this group is Grace (the lady standing fourth from the right in the photo). She is the representative of the group and she sells groceries. She purchases the items (Milo, milk, drinks and distilled bottled water) from the market. She sells to her customers in her neighborhood. She sells from the morning at seven until nine in the evening daily. She cooks for her family intermittently. Her husband assists her in selling and maintaining  the grocery shop. In this way, she is earning to improve her cash flow, which is not sufficient to manage her daily activities. 

She wants to enlarge her business, so she and her group members are requesting a total loan amount of GHS 4,500 so that they can all earn more and improve their families' cash flow.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam lives in Norakert village with her parents and sister.

She studies at Yerevan State University and specializes in mathematics.
 
Mariam's mother works at the village store as a seller and her father is self-employed. Mariam's parents work hard to sustain the family’s living and at the same time pay for Mairam's education, but financial difficulties caused Mariam to apply for this loan. It will greatly help her to pay for university tuition and continue her studies there.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a single woman. She describes herself as courageous. She operates a farm where she keeps quail (a type of bird) that produce eggs to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a profitable place and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more birds and poultry feed. Her business goal is to be stable within five years. She hopes that in the future, her family will benefit.

loans.use: to buy more birds and poultry feed.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine lives and studies in Yerevan town. She is a student at Yerevan State University of Armenia. 

Her parents are hardworking and kind people. Karine's father used to work as an army officer, but now he is retired and drives a taxi using his own car. Karine's mother takes care of the household. 

By applying for this loan, Karine asks lenders to help her with the university tuition. That is very important for her to be able to continue her studies there and become a good professional.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Sumera

texts.en:
Sumera, a 30-year-old married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sewing and then selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Sumera has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors. These purchases will allow her to fulfill the demands of her customers on time. With a good credit history, this will be Sumera's sixth loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. Leonida has been in this business for 15 years now.

Leonida requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like bath soap, shampoo, diapers, sanitary napkins, juice, eggs, etc. to sell.

Leonida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like bath soap, shampoo, diapers, sanitary napkins, juice, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 46-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching bed sheets, covers and pillows for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads, cloth and laces in different colors to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads, cloth and laces in different colors.

loans.name: Junita

texts.en:
Junita works hard to support her family. Junita is married and has a roasted whole pig vending business in the Philippines. Junita has been in this business for five years now.

Junita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional pig, ingredients and materials for her business.

Junita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig, ingredients and materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy work materials such as fabric, thread and more.

loans.name: Mansub

texts.en:
Mansub is a 50-year-old lady who enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested for a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get increase in her income by targeting more customers. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 45-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 16 years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of five children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase stock of grocery items like grains, sugar and rice in large quantity. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of grocery items like grains, sugar and rice in large quantity.

loans.name: Oliver 's Group

texts.en:
Oliver is 44 years old and a father of 3; he currently lives with his wife who is a petty trader in the village market. Oliver works as a mill spindle press operator at the village mill and he has worked in this mill for over 8 years now, although his job is strength consuming but his daily earning is sometimes not enough to support his family daily expenses. From his savings, he established a palm oil retail point for his wife at the local market and with this, the family earnings improved.

Oliver is requesting this loan from Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society which he is also a member of to enable him process and store enough palm oil for this season so as to keep his wife busy during the off peak and also make more income.

He is a very hard working young man and he loves his family so much, all his desire is to see his children attain the best education in life and become better-off than he is today.

Other member of his group which includes his younger sister hopes to use a portion of their loan to process and store palm oil.

The group thanks all those who lovingly contributes to their loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm bunches, process and store edible palm oil for resale when the price appreciates in the local market

loans.name: Lawrence's Group

texts.en:
Lawrence is 66 years old retired teacher and a father of 5; he currently lives with his wife in Umutanzi Village. He also supports 2 of his grandsons in school. Since he retired, he has been denied of his pension as a result of on-going pension program not working, which has made it impossible for Lawrence and most pensioners in Nigeria to get their pension from the government. To cope with his frustration and also to keep life going, he joined Nke-Anyi Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society, and have since then work as a palm oil manual worker. 

Lawrence spends 8 hours a day and 5 days a week working at the local palm oil mill in his village as a manual worker. Last year he was fortunate enough to get a loan from Nke-Anyi FMCS highly competitive members loan program which enabled him to store 50 liters of palm oil. The sales of this product fetched him more money for the year to cover his family expenses.
Other member of his group are also manual workers at the mill who intends also to use a portion of their loan to process and store palm oil and resale it back when the price appreciates.

Lawrence hopes to use his profit to fix his motorbike and also support his family.

Lawrence appreciates all Kiva lenders who share his pains and supports his loan.

loans.use: to purchase palm bunches, process and store edible palm oil for resale when the price appreciates in the local market

loans.name: Faizan

texts.en:
Faizan is a 54-year-old married woman. She is the mother of eight children. She has been manufacturing clay pots for many years. She makes various types and styles of clay pots and earns a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

She generally uses a hand-spun wheel to prepare her pots, which is a very time-consuming process. Now she has decided to use an electric machine to increase productivity and quality. Therefore she is applying for a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. With this loan amount she will be able to buy a new electric machine with packs of good quality clay. 

She is a very good client and pays back on time.  She is in her third loan cycle. She wants to introduce her products to nearby cities, which will ultimately help in generating more profits.

loans.use: to buy a new electric machine for turning clay with packs of  good quality clay.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.en: Mahina is 29 years old. She is married and has one child. Mahina began her own business one year ago, dealing with sewing. She runs her business well, as she has a great experience in sewing. Mahina is the main feeder of her family, as her husband is a migrant worker and doesn’t send money regularly. She has her own workshop. Mahina is going to increase her working capital, because she needs a new sewing machine. She is asking for a loan of 7500 Somoni, which she will use to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ruksana

texts.en:
Ruksana, age 35, is a married woman.  She deals in THE business of animal sales. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural fertilisers and supplies to help her with her coffee crops

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as "honest." She operates a beauty salon, where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a profitable place, and her customers are of all kinds. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy beauty products and other items for use in the salon. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and other items for use in the salon

loans.name: Grupo Del Reense (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Del Reense (Flat) está ubicado en una comunidad mazahua en donde aún se conserva la lengua materna, sus tradiciones, su vestimenta, pero es una comunidad que se caracteriza por los arboles tan altos que proporcionan su sobra a las casas de los habitantes. El grupo está integrado por seis mujeres muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras por eso mismo cada uno de ellas tiene una actividad económica y necesitan de un crédito para invertir en sus negocios. Rosa y Ma Guadalupe invertirán en borregos y pollos; Guillermina y Marcelina, en pollos y pavos; Mayte, en vacas y Guadalupe en pollos.

Las integrantes eligieron el nombre del grupo porque donde realizaron sus primeras solicitudes y reuniones de crédito, había un árbol de capulín enorme, y el nombre del árbol en su lengua materna, el mazahua, es "Reense".

Guadalupe o Doña Lupita, como le dicen de cariño, está casada con el señor Margarito desde hace ya varios años juntos han formado una familia con dos niños los cuales están estudiando. Desde hace cinco años ella decidió ayudar con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus hijos criando y engordando pollos. “Los compro desde pequeños y durante seis meses los crio y engordo para después venderlos a mis vecinas cuando necesitan prepararlos como alimentos para su familia”. Lo importante de los pollos es cuidarlos mucho del frío y alimentarlos muy bien. Doña Lupita está muy contenta y agradecida con su negocio porque podrá comprar más pollos y pastura para los caballos que también tiene en casa. Acerca de los caballos, son los que utiliza para trabajar en las milpas, ya sea para sembrar o levantar la tierra de los sembradíos de maíz. Lupita dice que antes le daban miedo sus caballos porque los consideraba agresivos, pero con el tiempo los ha tratado y ahora los considera parte de su familia. La única dificultad de Doña Lupita es cuando sus pollos enferman y mueren para ella es una gran pérdida de inversión, pero esto no la ha desanimado nunca pues quiere continuar ayudando con los gastos de la educación de sus hijos; porque para ella es muy importante que sus pequeños puedan terminar una carrera profesional para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The Grupo Del Reense (Flat) group is located in a Mazahua community where their mother tongue, their traditions and their clothing are still preserved. It is notable for its trees that are so high they shade the residents' houses. The group is made up of six women who are very hardworking and enterprising. That is why each of them has a financial activity and they need a loan to invest in their businesses.  Rosa and Ma Guadalupe will invest in sheep and chickens.  Guillermina and Marcelina will invest in chickens and turkeys. Mayte will invest in cows and Guadalupe in chickens.

The members picked their name of the group when they made their first applications and credit meetings. There was an enormous wild cherry tree and the name of the tree in the mother tongue, Mazahua, is "Reense".

Guadalupe, or Doña Lupita, as she is affectionately called, has been married to Margarito for several years and together they have made a family with two children who are in school. Five years ago, she decided to help with the household expenses and the children's education  by raising and fattening up chickens. “I buy them when they are small and for six months I raise them and fatten them and afterwards, I sell them to my neighbors when they need to make food for their families.” The important thing with the chickens is to be very careful with the cold and feed them very well. Lupita is very happy and grateful with her business because she can buy more chickens and fodder for the horses that she also has at her home. The horses she uses to work in the fields, whether for planting or for tilling the soil of the corn crops. Lupita says that before she was afraid of her horses because she thought they were aggressive, but over time, she has gotten to know them and now she considers them to be part of the family. Doña Lupita's only difficulty is when her chickens get sick and die because for her that is a big loss of investment. But this has never discouraged her because she wants to keep helping with the education expenses for her children. For her it is very important that her little ones to get college degrees so they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for her horses.

location.town: Dios Padre, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee crop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell, including soda, beer, and gin

loans.name: Carmen Ramona

texts.es: Carmen, tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposo con quien tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Petoa, Santa Bárbara. Tiene mas de tres años de dedicarse a vender ropa de segunda en general para damas, caballeros y niños. Esta mercadería la vende de forma ambulante y por encargos. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para su negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 10,000 lempiras para surtir de ropa como blusas, pantalones, jeans, faldas, vestidos, camisas y ropa de niños.  Su meta a futuro es lograr tener un local propio y tener estabilidad económica en su familia.
texts.en: Carmen is 35 years old. She lives in free union with her husband, with whom she has three children. She lives in a village that belongs to the township of Petoa, Santa Barbara. For more than three years she has been selling secondhand clothing in general, for women, men, and children. She sells this merchandise as a street vendor and on order. She has applied for a number of loans for her business. She is now applying again for 10,000 lempiras to stock clothing such as blouses, pants, jeans, skirts, dresses, blouses, and children's clothing. Her goal for the future is to have her own shop and have economic stability in her family.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing such as blouses, pants, jeans, skirts, dresses, blouses, and children's clothing to sell

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur  OUMAR est âgé de 37 ans et vit avec son épouse et ses trois enfants dans une famille nucléaire à N’TENTOU dans la Sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU (Région de Koulikoro, République du MALI).
OUMAR  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa à la soudure. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand soudeur à OUELESSEBOUGOU.   
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, OUMAR décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. 
Après avoir remboursé le deuxième prêt, il est à son troisième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter des matériels de soudures auprès des grossistes de BAMAKO qu’il transforme en porte et fenêtre et revend au client de OUELESSEBOUGOU à crédit et au comptant a une clientèle mixte.
OUMAR espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 100.000. FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités de la soudure.
texts.en:
Mr. Oumar, age 37, lives with his spouse and his three children in a nuclear family in N'tentou, in Ouelessebougou Subprefecture (Koulikoro Region, Republic of Mali).

Oumar never had a chance to go to school. Early on, he got interested in welding, a business he learned from his mother's brother, who once was a famous welder in Ouelessebougou.

Eager to satisfy his rapidly growing clientele, Oumar decided to work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso. Having repaid his second loan, he is now seeking his third personal loan, to be used to buy welding supplies from wholesalers in Bamako.

He then transforms them into doors and windows that he sells in Ouelessebougou, on credit or for cash, to a mixed-gender clientele.

Oumar hopes to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 100'00, to be used in part to repay the loan. The remainder will be reinvested in his welding business.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies

loans.name: Dubya

texts.es: Dubys ofrece en su negocio comidas rápidas almuerzos y productos de fritanguería en general, en un barrio muy tradicional de la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde habita con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en las edades de 6 a 21 años. Su experiencia data desde hace 22 años, cuando por necesidad, de generar ingresos en su hogar, teniendo 14 años debió asumir la responsabilidad de generar posibilidades de desarrollo a su hogar. Por eso con su cónyuge empezó aprovechando sus potencialidades en la preparación de comidas para obtener nuevos ingresos. Sus ventas hoy las realiza de contado desde las 6.30 hasta las 2 de la tarde, todos los días y su meta mas adelante es tener su propio local, aunque su mayor desafío sea aumentar sus ingresos, para aspirar al subsidio de vivienda del gobierno nacional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará víveres, como arroz, aceite, harinas y otros insumos no perecederos, para tener inventarios en existencia.  Con el anterior crédito con esta organización,  logró ampliar su negocio ofreciendo un servicio mucho más efectivo y así reunir para comprar su casa pues en la actualidad vive arrendada.
texts.en:
In her business, Dubys offers fast foods, lunches, and fried foods in general, in a very traditional neighborhood of the city of Barranquilla, where she lives with her husband and their four children, ages 6 to 21 years old. Her experience dates from 22 years ago, when, because of the necessity of generating income in her home, at 14 years old had to assume the responsibility of generating the possibility of improving her home. 

Because of that, with her husband she began to taking advantage of her potential in preparing foods to make a new source of income. Now, she makes her sales in cash from 6:30 until 2:00 in the afternoon every day. Her goal further on is to have her own store, although her greatest challenge is increasing her income to aspire to the national government’s housing subsidy. 

Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the second loan requested from the Mario Santo Domingo foundation, by means of which she will purchase provisions like rice, oil, flours, and other nonperishable supplies in order for the inventory to exist. With the previous loan from this organization, she was able to increase her business, offering much more effective service and thus gather funds to purchase her home since currently she rents.

loans.use: to purchase provisions like rice, oil, flours, and other nonperishable supplies.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: Verónica o Vero, como la llaman de cariño, tiene 30 años de edad y está casada con Daniel desde hace ya cuatro años, juntos han formado una familia con un niño pequeño quien ya asiste a la escuela. Vero tiene una farmacia y un consultorio médico en una comunidad mazahua, aunque ella no vive en esta comunidad, decidió poner sus negocios ahí porque tiene una cuñada que es dentista y le comentó acerca del lugar. Vero explica que al principio no le agradaba mucho la idea  de abrir sus negocios allí ya que pensó que no tendría tanto éxicto, incluso aseguraba un fracaso en sus negocios. Afortunadamente, todo fue distinto, Vero lleva ya tres años en la comunidad. Hace un año Vero se enteró de los servicios de VisionFund México y decidió solicitar préstamos para hacer crecer su negocio.
