Esta vez Vero quiere comprar más medicamentos, gasas, jeringas, cremas, pomadas para su farmacia. “Estoy muy contenta y agradecida con VisionFund y KIVA porque gracias a la oportunidad de un crédito puedo comprar el material que me hace falta". Vero platica que afortunadamente no tiene competencia cerca y eso eso le facilita tener a todos los clientes de la comunidad.. “Siempre trato muy bien a mis pacientes para que regresen, pidan otra consulta y decidan comprar sus medicamentos en mi misma farmacia” La meta de Vero es poder lograr tener otro consultorio y otra farmacia en otros lugares. Sonriendo Vero comentó "Lo ideal sería tener una red de farmacias y consultorios en mas lugares”.
texts.en:
Veronica, or Vero as people call her affectionately, is 30 years old and has been married to Daniel for four years. Together they have made a family: they have a young son who goes to school. 

Vero runs a pharmacy and clinic in a mazahua community. Even though she doesn’t live in this community, Vero decided to set up a business there because one of her sister-in-laws is a dentist and she told her about the area. Vero explains that at first she didn’t like the idea of opening up a business there because she didn’t think it would be very successful; in fact she thought it would be bound to fail. Luckily, everything turned out differently and Vero has now spent three years working in this community. 

Vero found out about the VisionFund Mexico service one year ago and she decided to apply for some loans to expand her business. This time around Vero would like to buy more medication, gas, syringes, creams and ointment for her pharmacy. She says “I am very happy and grateful to VisionFund and Kiva because, thanks to the opportunity of this loan, I can buy the items I need”. Vero reports that luckily there are no competitors nearby, which makes it easier for her to attact and keep customers in the community. “I always treat my patients very well so they will come back, ask for another appointment and decide to buy their medication in my own pharmacy”. 

Vero’s goal is to open up another clinic and a pharmacy in other areas. Smiling, Vera says "The ideal would be to have a network of pharmacies and clinics in more areas”.

loans.use: to buy medication, syringes, creams and toothpaste, etc.

location.town: San Francisco Barrio, San Felipe del Prgreso

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
This is Safina. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more shop items. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing.

She would like to apply for another loan, to buy a stock of household consumables to resell, including wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness, and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy a stock of household consumables to resell, including wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mwanauru

texts.en:
Mwanauru runs a general store. She appreciates her previous loan that she used to improve her living standards. Her loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income.

Mwanauru is requesting a loan to buy more stock of household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar to sell. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Dariya Khatoon

texts.en:
Dariya Khatoon is 30 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of six children. It was very tough for Dariya Khatoon to manage her household's needs, with the small income of her husband. Therefore, she decided to help her husband in earning income. For this purpose, she started her business. She buys cloth of different varieties from the wholesale market, and sells them in her area. Now she is playing a very important role for her family.

For the improvement of her business, she applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use this amount to purchase a greater variety of cloth in different colors, taking into account the taste and choices of her customers. It will help her to grow her sales, and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of cloth in different colors

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, eggs, milk, etc., for her business,

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam operates a food business to make beans and chapati (flat bread) . She feels that the high cost of purchasing food ingredients is her major challenge. 

She requests 30,000 KES to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is a 31-year-old, married woman. She deals in a business, selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloth of different fabrics, in various colors and designs, from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough money through her business. 

Shabana is requesting a PKR 45,000 loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 27-year-old vigorous lady who has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses her income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of available funds, Shazia is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

Shazia is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers, and buttons. This will be her sixth loan cycle and she has repaid her loans well. Shazia will use her loan to create a means of increasing revenue to generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to buy spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Carmelo Cruz

texts.es:
Carmelo, es casado, vive con su esposa y su hija de 3 años, no posee ayuda económica del extranjero, se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo realiza en conjunto con su esposa, el oficio lo aprendió de un amigo, trabaja de 7:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde, todos los días.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de blusas, pantalones, camisas, trajes para niño y niñas, vestidos, surtido en estilos, colores y tallas, su objetivo es tener un negocio muy bien surtido para satisfacer los las demandas de sus clientes de esta manera sus ventas e ingresos serán mejores.
El Sr.: Carmelo aspira a seguir fortaleciendo el negocio para tener una solvencia económica favorable, con lo que cancelara sus deudas y dará un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Carmelo is married and lives with his wife and 3-year-old daughter. He does not have outside economic help. He makes a living selling clothing. He does so along with his wife. He learned the trade from a friend. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. every day.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of blouses, pants, shirts, outfits for boys and girls, and dresses, all varied in style, color, and size. His objective is to have a well-supplied business to meet his customers’ demand. Because of this, his sales and income will be improved.

Carmelo aspires to continue strengthening the business to have favorable economic solvency, with which he will pay off his debts and give a better lifestyle to his family.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, shirts, outfits for boys and girls, and dresses.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 25-year-old vigorous, unmarried woman. For the past four years, she has run a hand-embroidery business. Rabia’s sister assists her in making beautiful patterns. She is zealous about her work and her client demand is strong. Rabia’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Rabia is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to grow her business and buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. Rabia is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Sarafeen

texts.en:
Sarafeen is a 53-year-old mother with 5 children. Sarafeen has sold milk with her husband for many years.  She initiated her own business and bought a cow to support her family at the time when her husband was the only wage earner. With the passage of time, her sales and income increased. She now has 5 cows and 5 goats. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family and financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of  40,000 PKR to purchase another cow. She expects an increase in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is in her 10th loan cycle with a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is a 45-year-old married woman. She and her husband have sold  milk for the past 10 years. She has attained a good number of customers and has become famous for providing good-quality milk. She makes enough money to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. She is currently in her fourth loan cycle and has applied for 45,000 PKR to purchase another cow. 

She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Nutifafa1 Group

texts.fr:
Félicité est responsable du groupe NUTIFAFA1 ce qui signifie en français la Paix. Félicité est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle a commencé son petit commerce de vente de céréales et de tubercules et du charbon de bois depuis 1990. Elle s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois dans le village de Kati, localité située à 95 kilomètres de Lomé. Actuellement Félicité dispose de stock de maïs et d'igname et aimerais simplement augmenter son stock de charbons de bois afin de satisfaire ses clients. 
A cet effet, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 17 sacs de charbons de bois.
Les autres membres du groupe NUTIFAFA1 exercent aussi le petit commerce de fruit, de légume, de pagnes et de céréales.
texts.en:
Félicité is responsible for Nutifafa 1 Group, which means "peace" in English. She's married and the mother of two children.

She started her retailing business in 1990. She sells cereals, yams, and charcoal. Three times a month, she gets her supplies in Kati, a village located 95 kilometers from Lomé.

At this time, Félicité has a stock of corn and yams, and would simply like to increase her charcoal stock, in order to satisfy her customers. To this effect, she is seeking this loan to buy 17 sacks of charcoal.

The other members of Nutifafa 1 Group are also retailers who sell fruits, vegetables, pagnes (colorful African cloth), and cereals.

loans.use: to buy 17 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Jiltañani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JILTAÑANI” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Patricia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: librería, tienda de fotocopias, venta de salchipapas, venta de pantalones, repostería, costura de polleras, tienda de abarrotes, venta de productos de limpieza.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Patricia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras (faldas bolivianas); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de un trabajo anterior, donde fue ayudante, posteriormente decide independizarse y emprender un negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The "Jiltañani" communal bank is entering its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of its Senkata regional office.  The group is made up of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors of which Patricia is the president.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in various businesses such as bookstores, copy stores, selling hotdogs and french fries, selling pants, bakeries, making skirts, grocery stores, selling cleaning products.  

The loan that they are seeking will benefit the small businesses of which Patricia is a member.  She states that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer.  She joined after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution.  Currently, she has a business making Bolivian skirts.  She tells us that she learned this trade in a previous job where she was an assistant.  Afterwards, she decided to become independent and start her own business.  

The loan that she is receiving will be used to increase her capital (purchasing fabric in bulk) that she will purchase from stores in the city of El Alto, and after making the skirts, she will sell them in her retail space.  This line of work allows her to earn an income to support her family, as she is married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: purchase fabric in bulk.

loans.name: Chidzo

texts.en:
Chidzo is a hardworking woman who lives at the Coastal region of Kenya.

For the past year, she has operated a business to sell men and women's clothing. She cites stiff competition as her major challenge in the business. 

Chidzo requests a loan to purchase bulk quantities of clothing to sell. She joined Yehu to boast her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Liduvina De Jesus

texts.es: La diversidad de productos que nos reciben en la tienda de Doña Liduvina, son un reflejo de su deseo de superación en la vida. Casada y madre de tres hijos ya independientes, de oficio comerciante dedicada a la venta de productos de consumo. Con la venta de caramelos, así inicio su pequeño negocio que hasta hoy ha prosperado en gran manera. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de Granos básicos, Lácteos y enlatados. Estima que con este préstamo lograra satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Como plan futuro tiene incrementar el tamaño de su negocio.
texts.en:
The diversity of products that greet us in Liduvina’s store is a reflection of her desire to improve her life. Married and the mother of three children already grown, she is in the shop keeping trade dedicated to the sale of consumable goods. She began selling candy in her small business that until now has prospered greatly.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of basic grains, milk products, and canned goods. She estimates that with this loan she will be able to satisfy her customers’ demand. Her future plan is to increase the size of her business.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, milk products, and canned goods.

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es:
Oscar, se dedica a al cultivo y comercialización de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), lo aprendió de su papá desde que tenía 10 años, actualmente lo hace de manera independiente iniciando su jornada laboral a las 6:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 2:00 p.m., Oscar es casado, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos.
El financiamiento lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, insecticidas, abono, plaguicidas, semilla, le serán de ayuda para que el terreno este en óptimas condiciones para sembrar y eliminar las amenazas de plagas. Espera tener una buena producción y mejorar sus ganancias.
Su sueño es tener los recursos económicos necesarios para que su familia tenga una vida mucho mejor y que sus hijos tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Oscar works growing and selling basic grains (corn and beans).  He learned this trade from his father when he was 10 years old.  Currently, he works on his own, starting at 6am and finishing at 2pm.  Oscar is married, and lives with his wife and children.  

The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, manure, pesticides and seeds that will help ensure that the land will be in the optimal condition to plant his crops and eliminate the risk of pests.  He hopes to have a good harvest and improve his earnings.  His dream is to have the financial resources for his family to have a much better life and for his children to attend college.

loans.use: purchase fertilizers, insecticides, manure, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 44-year-old married woman. She and her husband have successfully run a small, home-based general store. She has 6 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her in purchasing goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requests 45,000 PKR to buy packs of salt, grain, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demands at her store. She is expecting to increase her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, grain, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Jose Javier

texts.es: José, tiene 41 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene un hijo, vive con su madre en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Trabajó en una maquila por varios años. Ahora lleva 3 años de vender mercadería como sandalias, blusas, jeans, calcetas, tenis, camisas etc. de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Está solicitando el segundo préstamo que es por 16,000 lempiras  para surtir de mercadería como ser sandalias, fajas, bóxer, camisetas, calcetas, jeans etc. Su meta es llegar a tener su propio local y darle mejor vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
José, 41, is single and has one child.  He lives with his mother in a town in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

José worked in a factory for many years, but for the last three years has been selling merchandise such as sandals, blouses, jeans, socks, sneakers, shirts, etc.  He sells on foot and on order.

He's requesting his second loan and he's asking for 16,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy sandals, belts, boxer shorts, t-shirts, socks, jeans, and other merchandise.

José's goal is to have his own store and give his son a better life.

loans.use: to buy sandals, belts, boxer shorts, t-shirts, socks, jeans, and other merchandise

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: Don Marcial, tiene 52 años de edad, es casado,  vive en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Atima, Santa Bárbara con su hija y nietos. Toda su vida se a dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos café, maíz y frijoles. El cuenta con producción de café el cual vende en pergamino en la misma zona. Solicito el sexto ciclo de préstamo que es por 5,500 Lempiras para comprar fertilizantes y para limpieza de la finca de café. Tiene como plan mantener bien su finca para darle mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Don Marcial is 52 years old. He is married. He lives with his daughter and grandchildren in a village that belongs to the township of Atima, Santa Barbara. He has worked all his life in agriculture, growing basic grains, coffee, corn, and beans. He produces coffee that he sells as parchment coffee in the same zone. He is applying for his sixth loan for 5500 lempiras to buy fertilizers and to pay for weeding the coffee planting. His plan is to maintain his farm well in order to give a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for weeding his coffee plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep.

loans.name: Dúo Un Amor Verdadero Group

texts.es:
Dúo Un Amor Verdadero
Este dúo lo forma María Angelina originaria del área de san Martin Jilotepeque. María Angelina se dedica a la venta de comales de barro se esfuerza por seguir adelante y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y con el apoyo de kiva lo están logrando. Solicita el crédito para comprar más materia prima y surtir aun más sus negocios de venta de comales.
texts.en: The Duo Un Amor Verdadero group was formed by Maria Angelina, who is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque.  Maria Angelinsa sells earthenware skillets. She works hard to continue advancing and to give her family a better quality of life, and with the support of Kiva, she is achieving this. She is applying for the loan to buy more basic materials and further stock her business of selling skillets.

loans.use: to buy materials to make and sell skillets.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
As a single parent of three children, Lorna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Lorna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lorna has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business
